spell.name: Dark Star

m.text: a shard of onyx and a drop of the caster's blood, both of which the spell consumes

entries: This spell creates a sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The sphere can have a radius of up to 40 feet. The area within this sphere is filled with magical darkness and crushing gravitational force.

For the duration, the spell's area is {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. A creature with darkvision can't see through the magical darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it. No sound can be created within or pass through the area. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are {@condition deafened} while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there.

Any creature that enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 8d10} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this damage is disintegrated. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust.

spell.name: Wristpocket
entries: You flick your wrist, causing one object in your hand to vanish. The object, which only you can be holding and can weigh no more than 5 pounds, is transported to an extradimensional space, where it remains for the duration.

Until the spell ends, you can use your action to summon the object to your free hand, and you can use your action to return the object to the extradimensional space. An object still in the pocket plane when the spell ends appears in your space, at your feet.

spell.name: Time Ravage

m.text: an hourglass filled with diamond dust worth at least 5,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You target a creature you can see within range, putting its physical form through the devastation of rapid aging. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 10d12} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the save fails, the target also ages to the point where it has only 30 days left before it dies of old age. In this aged state, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, and its walking speed is halved. Only the {@spell wish} spell or the {@spell greater restoration} cast with a 9th-level spell slot can end these effects and restore the target to its previous age.

spell.name: Tether Essence

m.text: a spool of platinum cord worth at least 250 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: Two creatures you can see within range must make a Constitution saving throw, with disadvantage if they are within 30 feet of each other. Either creature can willingly fail the save. If either save succeeds, the spell has no effect. If both saves fail, the creatures are magically linked for the duration, regardless of the distance between them. When damage is dealt to one of them, the same damage is dealt to the other one. If hit points are restored to one of them, the same number of hit points are restored to the other one. If either of the tethered creatures is reduced to 0 hit points, the spell ends on both. If the spell ends on one creature, it ends on both.

spell.name: Temporal Shunt

time.condition: taken when a creature you can see makes an attack roll or starts to cast a spell

entries: You target the triggering creature, which must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or vanish, being thrown to another point in time and causing the attack to miss or the spell to be wasted. At the start of its next turn, the target reappears where it was or in the closest unoccupied space. The target doesn't remember you casting the spell or being affected by it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th. All targets must be within 30 feet of each other.

spell.name: Sapping Sting
entries: You sap the vitality of one creature you can see in range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage and fall {@condition prone}.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Reality Break
entries: You shatter the barriers between realities and timelines, thrusting a creature into turmoil and madness. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it can't take reactions until the spell ends. The affected target must also roll a {@dice d10} at the start of each of its turns; the number rolled determines what happens to the target, as shown on the Reality Break Effects table.
At the end of each of its turns, the affected target can repeat the Wisdom saving throw, ending the spell on itself on a success.

entries.caption: Reality Break Effects
rows: {@b Vision of the Far Realm.} The target takes {@damage 6d12} psychic damage, and it is {@condition stunned} until the end of the turn.
{@b Rending Rift.} The target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 8d12} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@b Wormhole.} The target is teleported, along with everything it is wearing and carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see. The target also takes {@damage 10d12} force damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.
{@b Chill of the Dark Void.} The target takes {@damage 10d12} cold damage, and it is {@condition blinded} until the end of the turn.

spell.name: Ravenous Void

components.m: a small, nine-pointed star made of iron

entries: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of destructive gravitational force centered on a point you can see within range. For the spell's duration, the sphere and any space within 100 feet of it are {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and nonmagical objects fully inside the sphere are destroyed if they aren't being worn or carried.

When the sphere appears and at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends, unsecured objects within 100 feet of the sphere are pulled toward the sphere's center, ending in an unoccupied space as close to the center as possible.

A creature that starts its turn within 100 feet of the sphere must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled straight toward the sphere's center, ending in an unoccupied space as close to the center as possible. A creature that enters the sphere for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes {@damage 5d10} force damage and is {@condition restrained} until it is no longer in the sphere. If the sphere is in the air, the {@condition restrained} creature hovers inside the sphere. A creature can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC, ending this {@condition restrained} condition on itself or another creature in the sphere that it can reach. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this spell is annihilated, along with any nonmagical items it is wearing or carrying.

spell.name: Pulse Wave
entries: You create intense pressure, unleash it in a 30-foot cone, and decide whether the pressure pulls or pushes creatures and objects. Each creature in that cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. And every creature that fails the save is either pulled 15 feet toward you or pushed 15 feet away from you, depending on the choice you made for the spell.
In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the cone are likewise pulled or pushed 15 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 6d6|3-9|1d6} and the distance pulled or pushed increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Magnify Gravity
entries: The gravity in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you can see within range increases for a moment. Each creature in the sphere on the turn when you cast the spell must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} force damage, and its speed is halved until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no reduction to its speed.
Until the start of your next turn, any object that isn't being worn or carried in the sphere requires a successful Strength check against your spell save DC to pick up or move.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|1-9|1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Immovable Object

m.text: gold dust worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch an object that weighs no more than 10 pounds and cause it to become magically fixed in place. You and the creatures you designate when you cast this spell can move the object normally. You can also set a password that, when spoken within 5 feet of the object, suppresses this spell for 1 minute.

If the object is fixed in the air, it can hold up to 4,000 pounds of weight. More weight causes the object to fall. Otherwise, a creature can use an action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, the creature can move the object up to 10 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, the DC to move the object increases by 5, it can carry up to 8,000 pounds of weight, and the duration increases to 24 hours. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the DC to move the object increases by 10, it can carry up to 20,000 pounds of weight, and the effect is permanent until dispelled.

spell.name: Gravity Sinkhole
entries: A 20-foot-radius sphere of crushing force forms at a point you can see within range and tugs at the creatures there. Each creature in the sphere must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d10} force damage and is pulled in a straight line toward the center of the sphere, ending in an unoccupied space as close to the center as possible (even if that space is in the air). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 5d10|4-9|1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Gravity Fissure
entries: You manifest a ravine of gravitational energy in a line originating from you that is 100 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 8d8} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Each creature within 10 feet of the line but not in it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 8d8} force damage and be pulled toward the line until the creature is in its area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d8|6-9|1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Gift of Alacrity
entries: You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target can add {@dice 1d8} to its initiative rolls.

spell.name: Fortune's Favor

m.text: a white pearl worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You impart latent luck to yourself or one willing creature you can see within range. When the chosen creature makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw before the spell ends, it can dismiss this spell on itself to roll an additional {@dice d20} and choose which of the {@dice d20}s to use. Alternatively, when an attack roll is made against the chosen creature, it can dismiss this spell on itself to roll a {@dice d20} and choose which of the {@dice d20}s to use, the one it rolled or the one the attacker rolled.
If the original {@dice d20} roll has advantage or disadvantage, the creature rolls the additional {@dice d20} after advantage or disadvantage has been applied to the original roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Sorcerous Burst
entries: You cast sorcerous energy at one creature or object within range. Make a ranged attack roll against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@dice d8} damage. If you roll an 8 on the d8 for this spell, you can roll another d8, and add it to the damage.

Whenever you cast this spell, the maximum number of these d8s you can add to the spell's damage equals your spellcasting ability modifier. You choose the damage type each time you cast this spell: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, Psychic or Thunder.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Starry Wisp
entries: You launch a mote of light at one creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Radiant damage, and until the end of your next turn, it emits Dim Light in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the {@condition invisible} condition.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Barkskin
entries: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical vines surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Constitution modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

spell.name: Icicle Storm
entries: You choose a point within range and cause a portal to open, firing barbed icicles in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point. Each creature in its range must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 4d6} magical piercing damage and is hindered by a lodged icicle for 1 minute, or until it uses an action to remove it. If it succeeds on the save, it takes half damage and avoids the icicle.
While the icicle is lodged, the creature's movement speed is reduced by 10 feet, and takes {@dice d4} cold damage whenever it takes an action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d6|3-9|1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Conjure Animals
entries: You summon nature spirits that take the form of a Large swarm of spectral animals in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The swarm lasts for the duration, and you choose the animal form of the spirits, such as wolves, serpents, or birds.

When a creature hostile to you enters a space within 10 feet of the swarm for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, you can make a melee spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes Radiant damage equal to {@damage 2d10} plus your spellcasting ability modifier.
You have advantage on Strength saving throws while you're within 10 feet of the swarm, and when you move on your turn, you can also move the swarm up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d10|3-9|1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Conjure Celestial
entries: You summon the protective presence of a celestial spirit, which manifests as a pillar of divine light that shines in a 10-foot radius, 40-foot high cylinder centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, Bright light fills the cylinder, and when you move on your turn you can also move the Cylinder up to 30 feet.
When a creature enters the cylinder for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, you can bathe that creature in one of the following lights:

entries.name: Healing Light
entries: The creature that isn't Undead or a Construct regains hitpoints equal to {@damage 4d12} plus your spellcasting modifier. A creature can be healed by this spell only once per casting of this spell.

entries.name: Searing Radiance
entries: The creature must make a dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 8d12} Radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the healing and damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d12;8d12|7-9|1d12} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Conjure Minor Elementals
entries: You summon elemental spirits that flit around you for the duration. Until the spell ends, once per turn any attack you make deals an extra {@damage 2d8} damage when you hit a creature within 15 feet of you. This damage is Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire or Lightning (Your choice when you make the attack).
In addition, the ground within 15 feet of you is {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for your enemies.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|4-9|2d8} and the range of {@quickref difficult terrain||3} increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Conjure Elemental
entries: You summon an Elemental spirit that fills a 10-foot cube within range. The spirit lasts for the duration and is composed of air, earth, fire or water (your choice) when you cast this spell.

When a creature hostile to you moves within 5 feet of the spirit, you can make a melee spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d8} damage of a type determined by the spirit's element: Bludgeoning (earth), Cold (water), Fire (fire), or Lightning (air). If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is also pulled into the Cube and has the {@condition restrained} condition. At the start of each of its turns, the target must make a Strength saving throw against your Spell save DC. On a failure, the target takes {@damage 4d8} damage of the same type of the spell attack. The spirit can have only one creature restrained at a time.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d8|5-9|2d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Conjure Fey
entries: You summon the awesome presence of a Medium Fey spirit in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The spirit lasts for the duration, and it looks like a Fey creature of your choice. When the spirit appears, you can immediately make one melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the spirit. On a hit, the target takes Psychic damage equal to {@damage 3d12} plus your Spellcasting ability modifier, and the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition frightened} condition until the start of your next turn.
As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can teleport the spirit to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of the space it left and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d12|6-9|2d12} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Power Word Fortify
entries: You utter a word of power that fortifies up to six creatures you can see within range. The spell bestows 120 Temporary Hit Points, which are divided equally among the spell's recipients.

spell.name: Conjure Woodland Beings
entries: You summon nature spirits that flit about you for the duration. Until the spell ends, each creature you choose that enters a space within 10 feet of you for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 5d8} Force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
In addition, you can take the {@action Disengage} action as a Bonus Action for the spell's duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 5d8|5-9|1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Fount of Moonlight
entries: A cool light wreathes your body for the duration, emitting Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet.
Until the spell ends, you have Resistance to Radiant damage, and your melee attacks deal an extra {@damage 2d6} Radiant damage on a hit.

In addition, immediately after you take damage from a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself, you can use your Reaction to force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition blinded} condition until the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Arcane Eruption
entries: Churning magical energy  explodes in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. When you cast the spell, you select the type of damage dealt by the explosion: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, Psychic or Thunder. Each creature in the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 6d6} damage of the chosen type. on a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

Choose one of those d6s. The number rolled on that die determines a condition thats applied to each creature that failed the save, as shown below. A creature has the conditon until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 6d6|4-9|1d6} for each slot level above 4rd.

spell.name: Poison Spray
entries: You extend your hand toward a creature you can see within range and project a puff of noxious gas from your palm. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature. It takes take {@damage 1d12} poison damage on a hit.
This spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d12} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d12}), 11th level ({@damage 3d12}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d12}).

spell.name: Spare the Dying
entries: You touch a living creature that has 0 hit points. The creature becomes stable. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
The spell’s range doubles when you reach levels 5 (30 feet), 11 (60 feet), and 17 (120 feet).

spell.name: Shillelagh

components.m: mistletoe, a shamrock leaf, and a club or quarterstaff

entries: The wood of a {@item club|phb} or {@item quarterstaff|phb} you are holding is imbued with nature's power. For the duration, you can use your spellcasting ability instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of melee attacks using that weapon, and the weapon's damage die becomes a {@dice d8}. The weapon also becomes magical, if it isn't already. The spell ends if you cast it again or if you let go of the weapon.
The weapon’s damage die changes when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 1d10|d10}), 11 ({@dice 1d12|d12}), and 17 ({@dice 3d4}).

spell.name: Acid Splash
entries: You hurl a bubble of acid. Choose a point you can see within range. Creatures within 5 feet of the point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} acid damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: True Strike

m.text: a weapon with which you have proficiency

entries: Guided by a flash of magical insight, you make one attack with the weapon used in the spell’s casting. The attack uses your spellcasting ability for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity.
If the attack deals damage, it can be Radiant damage or the weapon’s normal damage type (your choice).

Whether you choose to deal Radiant damage or the weapon’s normal damage type, the attack deals extra Radiant damage when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 1d6}), 11 ({@damage 2d6}), and 17 ({@damage 3d6}).

spell.name: Snowball
entries: You produce a floating frigid snowball, you may immediately throw it at a creature within range as a ranged spell attack, dealing {@damage 1d8} cold damage on a hit and ending the spell.
If not flung immediately, it harmlessly falls into your hands, arms or the ground, becoming an ordinary snowball. Any trace of it dissapears after a minute.

at 5th level, you can create upto two, At level 11, you can create upto three and at level 17, you can create upto four. You can throw the snowballs at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each snowball.

spell.name: Blowback
entries: A small firey explosion bursts in your hand producing a strong shockwave behind you. Make a melee spell attack against a creature, dealing {@damage 1d10} fire damage on a hit. Regardless of whether this attack hits, any creature within 5 feet in the opposite direction of the attack must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} thunder damage

At level 5, the damage increases to {@damage 2d10} fire and {@damage 2d8} thunder, at level 11 the damage increases to {@damage 3d10} fire and {@damage 3d8} thunder and at level 17 the damage increases to {@damage 4d10} fire and {@damage 4d8} thunder

spell.name: Thunderous Roar
entries: You yell a sound in the form of a piercing scream or a booming roar that is made louder tenfold, blasting people you face with the thunder. Creatures that fall in a 10 foot cone originating from you must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} thunder damage and be pushed 5 feet away.
At level 5, the thunder damage increases to {@damage 2d8}, at level 11 the damage increases to {@damage 3d8} and at level 17 the damage increases to {@damage 4d8}.

spell.name: Phantom Weapon
entries: You create an illusion of a weapon in an empty hand that feels all too real to your foes. You may make a melee spell attack with your action, dealing {@damage 1d10} psychic damage on a hit or you may make a ranged spell attack against a creature within 30 feet, dealing {@damage 1d8} damage on a hit.
The weapon lasts for the duration of the spell or until you let go of it. A creature with truesight is immune to damage from this spell.

At level 5, the psychic damage for the melee and ranged attacks respectively increases to {@damage 2d10} and {@damage 2d8}, at level 11 the damage increases to {@damage 3d10} and {@damage 3d8} and at level 17 the damage increases to {@damage 4d10} and {@damage 4d8}.

spell.name: Encoat
entries: As a part of casting this spell you touch a weapon or a piece of ammunition. A pungent poison trickles from your fingers, coating it. The next attack made with this weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d6} poisoned damage.
If no attack was made within the duration, the poison becomes inert and disappears.
At level 5, the extra poison damage dealt increases to {@damage 2d6}, at level 11 the damage increases to {@damage 3d6} and at level 17 the damage increases to {@damage 4d6}.

spell.name: Clotshot
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a target within 5 feet If the attack hits, it takes {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage as you drain and harden some blood from the creature to shape it into a dart. You then send it flying to a creature you can see within range as a ranged spell attack taking {@damage 1d4} piercing damage on a hit. This spell does not work if the first target does not possess blood.
At certain levels, both amounts of damage increase. {@damage 2d6} and {@damage 2d4} at level 5. {@damage 3d6} and {@damage 3d4} at level 11. {@damage 4d6} and {@damage 4d4} at level 17.

spell.name: Arc Discharge
entries: A surge of static wells up on you and discharges in the form of an arc of current. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} lightning damage.
This spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d10}), 11th level ({@damage 3d10}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d10}).

spell.name: First Response
entries: When you cast this spell, you target a creature and expend one of its hit die. If a target is conscious, it must also be willing and if it does not have any hit die, the spell fails. As you gain levels as a Flickwrist, the effects of this spell are strengthened.
You may spend a hit die of a targeted creature to grant it 1 hit point and make it conscious if it wasn't.
At the 5th level, it now heals for an amount rolled by the hit die
At the 11th level, it may also add its Constitution modifier to the amount healed.
At the 17th level, when revived from 0 hitpoints, the target may roll any number of hit die and is resistant to all damage until it's turn ends.
This spell does not work on constructs or undead.

spell.name: Suppress
entries: When you cast this spell, You target a creature and expend one of its hit die. If a target is conscious, it must also be willing and if it does not have any hit die, the spell fails. This spell improves as you gain levels as a flickwrist

Until the end of the creature's turn, you can suppress the effects of one ailment affecting it. You can suppress a disease, {@condition poisoned}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}

At the 11th level, you are now able to suppress {@condition petrified|phb|petrification}, any effects of exhaustion, {@condition stunned} or any reduction to one of the target's ability scores. You also grant advantage to saving throws to end the supressed effect.

At the 17th level, you can seemingly suppress ill effects indefinitely. You can end any of the effects listed before 11th level and can end any of the effects at 11th level by expending an extra hit die.
This spell does not work on constructs or undead.

spell.name: Immolation
entries: Flames wreathe one creature you can see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 8d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, the target also burns for the spell's duration. The burning target sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

On your turn, as a bonus action you can force the target to repeat the saving throw, taking another {@damage 8d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.
If damage from this spell kills a target, the target is turned to ash.

spell.name: Air Trick
entries: You choose a still parcel of air or one within a light breeze that you can see within range and within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

items: You create a burst of thunderous sound that can be heard up to 300 feet away originating from the area you chose.
You cause small flames in the area like candles, torches, or small campfires to flicker, brighten, dim for 1 minute, or snuff them out entirely.
You create a harmless sensory effect using air, such as causing leaves to rustle, wind to slam shutters closed, or your clothing to ripple in a breeze.

You cloud the area with a light fog, {@quickref Vision and Light|PHB|2||lightly obscuring} it. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.
You can have a whisper that you make be heard as such in the area.
You chill or warm the air in the area.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

components.m: a mildly compressed pocket of air

spell.name: Pungent Vapours
entries: You turn the air in a 5 foot cube of air within range into a corroding cloud of acid, Singeing enemies that stand in or pass through the area. A creature must make a Constitution saving throw if it starts it's turn in there or if it moves into its area. If it fails its takes {@damage 1d8} acid damage
When you reach 5th level the poison damage from this spell increases to {@damage 2d8}, {@damage 3d8} at 11th level and {@damage 4d8} at the 17th level.

spell.name: Transfusion
entries: You must be a humanoid possessing blood to cast this spell. You touch another humanoid possessing blood and siphon blood either into it or from it. Each turn after the spell is cast, the creature losing blood will lose {@damage 1d10} hipoints while the recipient will gain that amount.
If the creature is unwilling to transfer blood it must be grappled or restrained for this spell to work.

spell.name: Rusting Rain
entries: A sulphurous cloud manifests in the area within range of your choosing, showering those at it's mercy with a downpour corrosive droplets of a strong acid.

Creatures in the storm's cylindrical area of 30 foot radius and height, must make a Dexterity saving throw when the storm appears or if they end their turn there. They take {@damage 9d4} acid damage on a failure as or half as much on a success.

Creatures armoured by metal such as plate mail or constructs who fail the saving throw also recieve a stacking -1 penalty to their AC. If the armour or creature is magical, the maximum penalty is -3 which disappears after spending a minute outside the rain. Whereas non-magical armour breaks if it provides no bonus to AC.
Damaged armour may be repaired with {@item smith's tools|phb} or the {@spell mending} spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every level greater than 5th level that this spell is cast at, it deals an extra {@damage 2d4} damage.

spell.name: Wield Weather
entries: You wield the very forces behind natural phenomena and harness them like puppet strings. Depending on the natural phenomena occuring within 5 miles of you, you may manifest a controlled portion of it to aid you. Choose a phenomenon when this spell is cast and you gain it's following benefits

entries.name: Sunny Noon
entries: A beam of concentrated sunlight fills a cylindrical area 20 feet wide and 60 feet tall. Creatures moving into or starting their turn in the area are affected as though by the {@spell sunbeam} spell. You may use an action thereafter to move the beam upto 30 feet horizontally in any direction.

entries.name: Full Moon
entries: A beam of concentrated moonlight fills a cylindrical area 20 feet wide and 60 feet tall. Creatures moving into or starting their turn in the area are affected as though by the {@spell moonbeam} spell cast at 6th level. You may use an action thereafter to move the beam upto 60 feet horizontally in any direction.

entries.name: Fog
entries: You may shape any instance of fog within range in any manner you seek when you cast this spell. Additionally, you may darken or lighten so as to be lightly or heavily obscured. You may change the fogs properties and shape as a bonus action on subsequent turns.

entries.name: Rain
entries: You gain control of the intensity and the location of the showers. When you cast this spell, you may create a area of 60 feet wide cylinder reaching to the clouds where the rain doesn't fall. You may also use a bonus action to increase the intensity to a torrent, making the area within range heavily obscured and deafening to be in, or decrease it to a light drizzle.

entries.name: Hail
entries: As a bonus action you may increase or decreae the intensity of a hailstorm within range. Additionally, when you cast this spell, you may create a 30 feet wide and 60 feet tall column of hail. Creatures moving into or starting their turn in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d10} bludgeoning and {@damage 2d10} cold damage. A creature must spend 2feet of movement for every foot it moves in the area.

entries.name: Thunder Storm
entries: When you cast this spell and on the start of every subsequent turn, roll a {@dice 1d20|d20} . Nothing happens if you roll a 1 or 2, but if you roll between 3-18 you may use a bonus action on this turn create a lightning strike like one in the {@spell call lightning} spell cast at 6th level. If you roll a 19 or 20, you may use an action to summon an arc of bouncing lightning as though you cast {@spell chain lightning}.

entries.name: Tornado
entries: Utilizing the rotational force of the whirlwind you are able to create a miniature of it within range. The creation and control of it works as though you cast {@spell whirlwind|XGE}.

Additionally, when dealing with a natural tornado, you may use a bonus action to grant you and any creatures of your choice within 30 feet advantage on any saves or checks to resist any of it's effects. You may also use an action to speed up or slow down the progress of a tornado by upto 60 feet per round

entries.name: Rainbow
entries: You tap into the prismatic forces within the rainbow and are able to channel it as devastating beams. When you cast this spell, You create a cone of rainbow light as though you {@spell prismatic spray} but instead, roll 3 d8s for each target, ending the spell. One you use this feature of the spell you cannot use it again for 3 days.
This spell may work differently on planes outside of the material

components.m: A pouch of licorice root shavings

spell.name: Fool Me Once

time.condition: which you take after succeeding on a saving throw

entries: As you succeed on a saving throw, you become {@condition invisible} and an illusory duplicate of you appears to fail the saving throw and undergo the effects. The double suffers a horrific fate of your own devising, the result of which leaves it dead or {@condition incapacitated}. The illusion may include minor environmental changes as a result of the duplicate's presumed actions, such as a broken window the duplicate appears to have fallen through.
The illusion lasts for the duration. You remain {@condition invisible} for the duration, unless until you attack or cast a spell.

spell.name: Throwing Arm
entries: You manifest a floating spectral arm-like object that assists you in hurling weapons at your foes. After you cast this spell you may use a bonus action to make the arm draw a light weapon from the material component and throw it as part of the same action. Make a thrown weapon attack with but with your spellcasting ability for the attack and damage rolls.
Alternatively, you may use the hand to assist you in throwing a weapon. If using your action to make a thrown weapon attack, you can use your bonus action to grant you advantage on one attack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd or 4th-level spell slot, the attack gains a +1 bonus to hit and damage. When you cast it using a 5th or 6th-level spell slot, the attack gains a +2 bonus. When you use a 7th-level or higher spell slot, the attack gains a +3 bonus.

spell.name: Rimeburst
entries: You conjure a large shard of ice and send it hurtling towards a creature you can see within range. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d10} cold damage on a failure and half as much on a success.

Regardless of the result, the shard bursts in a 30 foot cone in a direction of your choice originating from an edge of the target spraying those affected with sharp ice. Targets in the cone's area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d10} Piercing damage on a failure or half as much on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every level greater than 5th level that this spell is cast at, it deals an extra {@damage 1d10} damage of each type.

components.m: A vial of water and a pinch of salt

spell.name: Varkeno's Veneer
entries: Select two allies within sight and range when this spell is cast. For the duration of the spell they recieve a +3 bonus to their AC along with you

For each attack that any beneficiary dodges, the bonus reduces by 1. While the spell is active, you may use a bonus action to spend a spell slot to re-arm the veneer, with it's AC bonus becoming equal to the level of the spell slot used or +3, whichever is lower.

components.m: A piece of amber worth 50 GP

spell.name: Mind Mold
entries: With a few words you turn a targets brain sour. A targeted creature who can hear you within range must succeed a Intelligence saving throw or take {@damage 5d6} psychic damage and {@damage 5d6} necrotic damage or half of each on a success.
A target without a brain is immune to this damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every level greater than 5th level that this spell is cast at, it deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of each type.

spell.name: Wetvision
entries: You grant yourself the ability to percieve through the touch of water. For the duration of the spell you are able to percieve everything that shares contact of the same body of water with you to a distance of 120 feet
Be it a pond, a lake, a river or even the same parcel of rain, you can see and make out the position and form of creatures within even if they are {@condition invisible}

spell.name: Coulette's Concussor
entries: You manifest a bubble of thunderous energy and launch it towards your foes, launching them in turn. You shoot this ball directly to a point you can see, forming a 30 feet cone of effect at that point, expanding away from you.
Creatures caught in the area must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be thrown 15 feet away and recieve {@damage 4d10} thunder damage or half as much on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every level greater than 4th level that this spell is cast at, it deals an extra {@damage 1d10} thunder damage.

spell.name: More Magic Missiles
entries: You produce 8 glowing darts of magical force that revolve around you while you concentrate on this spell. As part of casting this spell or with an action on every subsequent turn, you can send upto 3 darts to hit a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals {@damage 1d6+1} force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

You may also use a bonus action to send 1 dart towards a creature. This spell does not affect targets defended by the {@spell shield} spell or any other effect that nullifies the {@spell magic missile} spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every level greater than 4th level that this spell is cast at, you produce an additional 2 darts.

spell.name: Even More Magic Missiles
entries: You produce a whopping 25 glowing darts of magical force that swirl around you while you concentrate on this spell. As part of casting this spell or with an action on every subsequent turn, you can send upto 5 darts to hit a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals {@damage 1d8+1} force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.

You may also use a bonus action to send up to 2 darts towards creatures of your choice. This spell does not affect targets defended by the {@spell shield} spell or any other effect that nullifies the {@spell magic missile} spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At level 9, you instead produce 28 darts.

spell.name: Discharge Defense
entries: A thin imperceptible veneer of glowing static covers your body occassionally producing small arcs of lightning. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it.

The veneer grants you resistance to lightning damage, and whenever a creature within 10 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, the shield discharges unto the attacker. The attacker takes {@damage 1d12} lightning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, the damage increases to {@damage 2d12}. When you cast it using a spell slot of 7th, 8th or 9th level, the damage increases to {@damage 3d12} and you gain immunity to Lightning damage.

spell.name: Desiccation
entries: The atmosphere and your surroundings lose their water to your very touch. Touch a point on a surface as part of this spell and a cubic area 200 feet on each side around the point begins to lose water and moisture.

At the end of the first 10 minutes, the air within the area becomes completely parched. any effect that deals fire damage in this area will deal an additional {@damage 2d6} fire damage. After the spell ends, the air goes back to its normal humidity within an hour

Every subsequent 10 minutes after the first, every non-magical source of water will lose either half its water or 10 gallons of it, whichever is larger. Now on, you may begin to see small non-magical plants shrivel and die.
After an hour you will see larger non-magical plants like trees wither and die and plant creatures fighting in this area will have disadvantage on all attacks and saving throws.

spell.name: Spatial Collapse

components.m: A crumpled sheet of gold foil

entries: Upon casting this spell you create a spatial sphere centre on a point you can see within range and you designate upto 6 creatures of your choice, giving them the ability to use it. When you move into any space occupied by the sphere you may teleport to any space you can see within or adjacent to the sphere as part of that movement.
On subsequent turns you may use a bonus action to move spatial sphere upto 30 feet in any direction.

spell.name: Godrage
entries: You fill yourself with righteous fury and bring down the wrath of your god. You are surrounded by a brilliant glowing light that sheds bright light to 5 feet and dim light a further 5 feet. For the duration, you gain advantage for all melee weapon attacks, and you inflict an additional {@damage 2d10} force damage with a successful attack. In addition, your AC improves by 2, you can't be {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition poisoned}, and you have advantage on Wisdom saving throws. Finally, you score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20, instead of just 20.
On subsequent turns, you must use your action to make a melee attack each round while this spell is active. If you choose to take a different action, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th-level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Exaltation

components.m: a flask of holy water and powdered sapphire worth 100 gp

entries: With this spell, provide aid, protection, and joyful feelings to a willing creature you touch; you can't cast this spell on yourself. For the duration, the creature radiates a pale glow that sheds dim light to a 5-foot radius and gains the following benefits:

• The creature can't be {@condition frightened} or {@condition poisoned}, and it can't be rendered {@condition unconscious} unless it is reduced to 0 hit points. If it had been suffering from one of those conditions before you cast exultation, the condition is paused while this spell is in effect.
• While the creature has less than 6 levels of {@condition exhaustion} it doesn't suffer from its effects while this spell is in effect.
• The creature gains a number of temporary hit points equal to 10 + your caster level. When the spell ends, the target loses any remaining temporary hit points from this spell.
• The creature has advantage on {@skill Intimidation} and {@skill Persuasion} ability checks.
• Once while this spell is active, the creature may roll a {@dice d6} and add the number rolled to any ability to check or saving throw it makes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th-level or higher, the creature gains an additional 5 temporary hit points for each slot level above 3rd. In addition, when you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th or 7th-level, the die becomes a {@dice d8}. When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 8th or 9th-level, the die becomes a {@dice d10}.

spell.name: Waning Valor
entries: You instill a target creature you can see within range with false courage. The creature gains {@damage 20+4d10} temporary hitpoints.
Unless the creature gains temporary hitpoints from some other source, the creature will lose {@damage 1d10} temporary hitpoints at the start of each of its turns till it has none.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every level greater than 4th level that this spell is cast at, it grants an additional {@damage 1d10} Temporary hitpoints.

components.m: A juniper berry and container of gin

spell.name: Becloud
entries: You cloud a creatures awareness to exclude your presence. If the creature you can see fails a Wisdom saving throw, it will forget about your presence and will behave as though you do not exist. Attacking or casting a spell while in this state provokes a Wisdom check from the target against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

This creature will be unable to target you specifically but may still affect you with area effects if they fall in your area. If the creature sees you with Truesight or makes a {@skill Perception} check higher than your Spell save DC the illusion is lost.

spell.name: Accursed Matrimony
entries: Select a point you can see within range when you cast this spell, creatures within 15 feet of the point must make a Charisma saving throw. If two or more creatures failed the saving throw, the caster may select any two of them and have their souls lightly bound.
If any one of the two are hit by an attack, the other will take {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage.
This spell does not affect constructs or any other creature without a soul.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every level greater than 4th level that this spell is cast at, it deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage.

spell.name: Phoenix Facade
entries: You send visions of the most dire consequences to a fallen ally, inspiring them to fight at all costs, severely damaging their body in the process. When you target a creature who is rolling death saves with this spell, it gains 1 hitpoint. The target may then roll upto half their max hitdie and along with the result, add the spellcasting modifier for each hitdie rolled and gain that many temporary hitpoints.

Until the start of the target's second turn, it has advantage on all saving throws, resistance to all instances of damage, advantage on all attack rolls and has the effects of any existing conditions suppressed except for {@condition petrified}, {@condition invisible} and {@condition prone}.

For the target's first turn, it gains an additional action which can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action.

At the start of the second turn the target will lose all temporary hitpoints gained from this spell and gain 4 levels of {@condition exhaustion}. Additionally, until its next long rest, it will die after only failing one death save.

components.m: A feather of a golden pheasant and a diamond worth 200gp which gets consumed

spell.name: Resist Death
entries: You grant a creature some proof against their demise. This spell works differently depending on the target:-

entries.name: Living
entries: If the target is alive, conscious and willing, it bolsters them against finishing blows. If the target is takes damage that reduces it to 0 hitpoints while being the target of this spell they instead drop to 1 hitpoint and gain a level of {@condition exhaustion}, ending the spell.

entries.name: Dying
entries: If the target is rolling for death saves, it now rolls it with advantage. On a success, it may roll a hit die and gain hitpoints equal to the result plus the spellcasting modifier and one level of {@condition exhaustion}. If the result of the die roll for the death save is a 20, then it instead revives with half its health and no exhaustion taken.

components.m: A vial of strong acid and two copper wires.

spell.name: Trapping Pit
entries: When you cast this spell, a square area of 10 feet on a horizontal surface becomes an invisible entrance to an extradimesional space 15 feet deep and as wide as its entrance. Any creature that it may accomodate must make a Dexterity saving throw if it walks over the entrance or is standing over it when the spell is cast. A creature who cannot fit will instead experience the area as dificult terrain.

A creature that fails this saving throw will fall into the pit while creatures that succeed may shift to an unoccupied position next to the hole they came from before they fell or use their flying speed to stay afloat. The space's walls may be scaled but at half movement without climbing speed.
Attacks and spells can't cross through the entrance into or out of the extradimensional space, but those inside can see out of it through the square entrance.

If you cast this spell again while any pits created by you still exist, they disappear. If any creatures or objects exist inside the pit when the spell ends, it is ejected safely onto an unoccupied space closest to the pit.

components.m: a twisted loop of parchment within a wooden pitcher

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may make an additonal pit for each level higher than 2nd.

spell.name: Weapon of Wind
entries: Strands of wind come together to envelope a weapon you wield, lending it's power to it. Whenever you land an attack with this weapon against a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you.
The weapon loses its power if you are not wielding it, returning if it is again wielded by you.

spell.name: Marching Mine
entries: As part of casting the spell you turn a tiny non-magical object in your hand into a walking bomb as it sprouts legs. The object mustn't be attached to another object or a surface or being carried by another creature. As part of the same action, you may throw it upto 30 feet away

The mine is an object telepathically controlled by you which moves at the start of your turn. It has an AC of 16 and an HP of 15 and has a walking and climbing speed of 20 feet It is immune to poison, psychic and necrotic damage.

If the object is destroyed, duration of the spell ends or if concentration on the spells ends, the object explodes affecting targets in a sphere of a radius of 15 feet, disintegrating the object and ending concentration. Creatures caught in the blast must make a Dexterity saving throw failing which deals {@damage 2d12} fire damage to them or half as much if they succeed

The object can see normally and you mentally recieve information it visually percieves. While concentrating on the spell, you may use a bonus action to command it to hide, to which it recieves a bonus to its {@skill Stealth} check equal to your spellcasting modifier. You may also use a bonus action to give it one charge. It holds a maximum of 3 charges and deals an additional {@damage 1d12|d12} damage for each charge held when it explodes. Additionally, the blast radius increases to 20 feet when fully charged.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every level greater than 2nd level that this spell is cast at, the mine deals an extra {@damage 1d12} damage and may hold an additional charge.

m.text: A tiny object, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Expedite
entries: Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the target's speed is tripled, it gains a +3 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains two additional actions on each of its turns. Those actions can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack each only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action.
When the spell ends, the target can't move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it and it gains a point of {@condition exhaustion}.
A creature that benefits from this spell does not also benefit from {@spell haste}.

components.m: A pouch of licorice root shavings

spell.name: Conjure Barrage

components.m: one piece of ammunition or a thrown weapon

entries: You enchant a piece of ammunition or a thrown weapon with planar magic. You may then replace an attack you make using the ammunition or thrown weapon with the creation of a conical barrage consisting of multiple copies of the component. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage type is the same as that of the weapon or ammunition used as a component.
Magical ammunition or thrown weapons that lose their magic if used will do so. The copies disappear after travelling but the component remains if it is still magical.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every level greater than 3rd level that this spell is cast at, it deals an extra {@damage 1d8} damage.

spell.name: Kinetic Tunnel
entries: Imagine a point 10 feet away from you. When you cast this this spell, the material component disappears and reappears as a thin speeding projectile at the point, travelling in a direction of your choice for 50 feet before it vaporizes.
Creatures in the path of the projectile must succeed a Dexterity Saving Throw or take {@damage 5d8} Piercing damage, taking half the damage otherwise.
The projectile produces a cracking sound that can be heard a thousand feet away as it appears.

m.text: A blowgun needle, crossbow bolt or a bullet which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For every level greater than 3rd level that this spell is cast at, it deals an extra {@damage 1d8} damage.

spell.name: Aristo's Affluent Armoury

m.text: A weapon or piece of ammunition worth at least 10 gold, which the spell consumes

entries: You open a small portal into an armoury through which you can put your arm, drop the material component and grab a weapon. Once you grab a weapon, the portal disappears, leaving a spectral weapon in your hands. The weapon is banished back to the armoury after an hour.

You are considered proficient with the weapon you summon. If you use a magic weapon of (uncommon rarity or above) as this spell's material component, the weapon you recieve remains permanently. You can not use this weapon as a component for this spell. Weapons summoned this way also recieve a +1 enchantment if they aren't already a +1 weapon (Unless you roll a 1 for enchantment)

A weapon summoned by this spell is banished when this spell is cast again. roll a {@dice 1d12|d12} to determine the form of the weapon then roll another {@dice 1d12|d12} to determine the effect it recieves

entries.caption: Weapon
rows: A {@item scimitar|tct|Scimitar},{@item shortsword|tct|Shortsword}, {@item mace|tct|Mace} or {@item handaxe|tct|Handaxe}

entries.caption: Echantment
rows: {@item weapon of certain death|egw|Weapon of Certain Death}
{@item Shortsword of Life Stealing|dmg|Weapon of Life Stealing}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level, The weapon you recieve becomes a +2 and you can determine one of either the weapon's form or its enchantment. The summoned weapon lasts for 24 hours before disappearing.

The next time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} cold damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must make a Constitution saving throw or have its movement speed halved for the spell's duration.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Chilling Smite

entries: Upon casting this spell you grasp a book or tome, your mind is instantly flooded with the knowledge and information contained within it. When the spell ends, all the knowledge and information acquired this way vanishes from your mind and you must make a Constitution saving throw against a DC of 2 * the number of hours you would normally take to read the book or tome. On a failure, you gain a level of {@condition exhaustion} and suffer {@damage 1d6} psychic damage. You don't gain any information or knowledge from parts of text that are unreadable or in a language you don't understand.
spell.name: Quick-Reading

entries: As you hold your hands with thumbs touching and fingers spread, a sheet of intense cold and shards of ice shoots forth from your outstretched fingertips. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The cold freezes any liquids in the area that isn't in a sealed container.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Frost Fingers

components.m: a cloth emblazoned with holy symbol

entries: You invest your patron's divine power into a strip of cloth that animates beside you and interposes itself against ranged attacks. You gain a +2 bonus to AC against ranged attacks for the duration of the spell.
spell.name: Cloth of Honorable Melee

entries: You call forth a breeze full of stinging acid droplets from your outstretched hand. Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} acid damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded}.
For each spell slot used higher than 1st level, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d6|1-9|1d6}.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Acid Wind

components.m: a piece of oilcloth and a pinch of dirt

entries: You produce a 5-foot-radius immobile dome of opaque blueish force at a point you see within range. Up to four creatures of Medium size can fit inside the dome. The spell fails if its area includes a larger creature or more than four creatures. Creatures and objects can freely pass in and out of the dome, and the dome doesn't block spells or other magical effects. The tent blocks nonmagical weather, including rain and hail. Creatures and objects inside the dome can't be seen by creatures outside of it and effectively have total cover from creatures outside it.
Until the spell ends, you can command the interior to become dimly lit or dark. The dome is translucent but not transparent from the inside.

When you cast this spell using a 2nd or 3rd-level spell slot, you can make the tent large enough for six creatures. When you cast it using a 4th or 5th-level spell slot, you can make the tent large enough for eight creatures. When you cast it using a 6th or 7th-level spell slot, you can make the tent large enough for 12 creatures. When you cast it using an 8th- or 9th-level spell slot, you can make the tent large enough for 16 creatures.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Katrine's Total Tent

entries: You can transform a chunk of earth or stone into a magical melee weapon of a type in which you are proficient. The chunk of earth or stone must weigh at least as much as the weapon you wish to make. If a creature other than you attempts to use the weapon, it crumbles back into earth or stone and the spell ends. The weapon is considered magical.

When you cast this spell using a 3rd or 4th-level spell slot, the weapon gains a +1 bonus to hit and damage. When you cast it using a 5th or 6th-level spell slot, the weapon gains a +2 bonus. When you use a 7th-level or higher spell slot, the weapon gains a +3 bonus.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Weapon of the Earth

components.m: a bit of cat fur and a duck's feather

entries: You or one willing creature you touch is granted a the ability to walk at a normal pace without leaving tracks or disturbing the ground below it. The creature can also walk across relatively calm fluids, such as the surface of a lake, as if it was difficult terrain.
spell.name: Drawmij's Light Step

entries: One creature you touch is rendered scentless and cannot be tracked by smell.

This spell can be cast on a creature that attacks through scent, such as a skunk or troglodyte. That creature may make a Constitution saving throw to resist. On a failure, it cannot use this attack for the duration.
spell.name: Drawmij's Scent Mask

entries: Your kiss drains the life out of your target. You target takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage and you regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

You must be able to kiss the target's skin (although you do not need to kiss its lips). If the creature is in combat, you must succeed at a melee spell attack to kiss it; if not in combat, the creature must be willing to be kissed, {@condition restrained}, or unaware.
When you cast this spell with a 2nd-level or higher spell slot, your kiss causes an additional {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage for each slot level above 1st.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Kiss of Vampirism

entries: You summon a fey spirit that takes the form of a white and red  {@creature mastiff}. It is identical to the  {@creature mastiff} from the Monster Manual (page 332), save that its Perception skill bonus is +5. It is friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for it, as it has its own turns. It will obey any commands that you issue. If you don't issue commands to it, it will defend itself from hostile creatures, but otherwise takes no actions. The {@creature mastiff} disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.
spell.name: Alyssa's Hunting Hound

entries: You touch the corpse of a creature that has been dead for no longer than 1 week and see whatever it saw at the moment of its death.

If the target had died in a particularly horrific manner (DM's decision), you must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. You may make a new saving throw at the start of each of your turns, ending the effect on yourself on a success.
spell.name: Last Image

entries: This spell causes a dagger, dart, or other simple thrown weapon that you're holding to leap out of your hand and fly at a foe you see within range. It will then attack the target, using your spell attack modifier to hit and damage rolls, then return to your hand. If your hand isn't empty, it hovers in the air next to you. During each of your turns, you may use a bonus action to send the weapon flying to a new target. You must make a new ranged spell attack each time to hit.
spell.name: Bladeleap

entries: You concentrate gravity around your body. Each creature within 15 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage and be pulled up to 10 feet toward you. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and is not pulled toward you.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Gravity Pulse

components.m: a sample of the handwriting to be copied

entries: When you cast this spell, you gain the ability to perfectly mimic one person's handwriting for the next ten minutes.
spell.name: Ahrvar's Forgery

entries: A multitude of thorny vines burst from your fingers and enwrap a willing, nonarmored creature you touch to form a suit of fibrous armor around the target. This armor is treated as medium armor with a base AC of 15 + Dexterity modifier (max 2). Normal penalties apply if the armored creature doesn't have proficiency with medium armor. Any foe that strikes a creature encased in bramble armor with a melee attack takes {@damage 1d4} piercing damage.
spell.name: Bramble Armor

entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon drips with a noxious poison, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 3d6} poison damage to the target. Additionally, the target must make a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the spell ends.
spell.name: Envenomed Smite

entries: You determine whether a creature, object, or area you can see within 30 feet of you is affected by a curse. With a successful DC 20 Intelligence or Wisdom check, you can also determine the exact type of curse and its effects.
The spell doesn't function when used on an artifact.
spell.name: Detect Curse

components.m: Willow Bark or a Molded Apple

entries: Natural healing magic flows from your touch. A touched creature regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 2d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier, and is cured of one disease or the {@condition poisoned} or {@condition blinded} condition.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot above 2nd.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: First Aid

entries: You touch a creature that has 0 hit points. For the duration of the spell, the creature is locked in a protective coma; it doesn't need to make death saving throws (even when it takes damage), and it doesn't need food or water to survive. The affected creature still shows signs of life, though an observer might need to look closely to detect them. The spell ends when the creature regains hit points.
spell.name: Safeguarded Slumber

entries: Channel blistering cold through your outstretched hand. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d12} cold damage and their speed is halved for 1 minute.
A creature affected by this spell makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of its turn. On a successful save, the effect ends for it.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 2nd.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Grip of Winter

entries: The material component for this spell is transformed into a large sword made of bone. This magic sword lasts until the spell ends. It counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 2d6} slashing damage on a hit and has the finesse, light, and thrown properties (range 20/60). If you strike an undead creature with this weapon, it must make a Constitution saving throw, taking an additional {@damage 4d8} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. In addition, until the end of your next turn, the undead can't regain hit points and has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws to avoid being turned.
If you wield the sword yourself, the duration is 1 minute. If you give the sword to another creature to wield, the duration is concentration, up to 1 minute.
spell.name: Bone Blade

entries: You touch a willing creature, who then falls {@condition unconscious} for the duration. The creature can be awakened if someone uses an action to wake it, but will fall back asleep as soon as it's allowed to get comfortable and close its eyes. If woken up, it can attempt to stay awake by making a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends. You can also use an action to touch the creature and end the spell.

While asleep, the creature doesn't need to drink or eat, and needs only a tenth as much air as usual. Upon awakening (whether temporarily or when the spell ends), the creature the creature will be ravenously hungry and will take a level of {@condition exhaustion}. This level goes away when the creature has eaten at a large meal and has taken a short rest.

You can cast this spell again while it is active to maintain the hibernation for another 30 days. This doesn't cause any harm to the target, or cause them to take any more {@condition exhaustion} upon awakening.
spell.name: Hibernation

components.m: a small whistle made of bone

entries: With this spell, you and up to six willing targets you touch gain the ability to speak and understand a secret language incomprehensible to others. Neither the comprehend languages nor tongues spells can decipher the language.
spell.name: Fool's Speech

m.text: a clear gem or crystal prism worth at least 50 gp

entries: You draw forth a beam of elemental light and fire it at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack to hit. You may attempt a DC 13 Intelligence (Arcana) check to choose the beam's color; otherwise, it is randomly determined. You may not attempt to create a multihued beam. The beam does {@damage 3d10} damage of a type determined by its color; the target may make a Dexterity saving throw for half damage. Roll a {@dice d8} to determine the color.

entries.caption: Echantment
rows: Roll twice and ignoring further rolls of 8

entries: The beam stops once it hits a solid object, even if that object is transparent.
When you cast this spell with a 3rd-level spell slot or higher, it does an additional {@damage 1d8} damage per slot level above 2nd.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Garn's Rainbow Beam

entries: You create a long whip of vivid purple light that lashes out at your command towards a creature in range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes {@damage 6d6} force damage and is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} (escape DC equal to your spell save DC) until the start of your next turn.

If the creature breaks free of the grapple, or when the spell ends, the forcelash releases a powerful jolt of energy that causes the creature to convulse. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 3d6} force damage on a failed save and drops whatever anything it is carrying, or half as much damage on a successful save, and it doesn't drop anything.
In addition, you can pull the creature up to 15 feet closer to you (no action required).
When you cast this spell with a 4th-level or higher spell slot, the damage from the initial attack inflicts an additional {@damage 1d6} damage for each slot level above 3rd.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Forcelash

entries: You amplify your voice and let out a scream or shout when you feel pain, directing and focusing it into a 30-foot-long, 10-foot-wide line in a direction of your choice. Each creature within the line must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d8} thunder damage and is pushed away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed. Unsecured objects that are completely within the spell's area are also pushed 30 feet from you. Regardless of whether a creature succeeds or fails its saving throw, it is {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn.

This spell's power increases when you are in more pain. If the triggering damage was equal to or greater than half your hit point maximum, or was at least 40 damage, the line is instead 60 feet long, the distance creatures and objects are pushed by the spell is doubled, and the spell deals an additional {@damage 1d8} thunder damage.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd. The damage instead increases by
{@dice 2d8} per level of the spell slot above 3rd if the triggering damage was equal to or greater than half your hit point maximum, or was at least 40 damage.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Painful Resonance

time.condition: which you take when you take damage

entries: You create an invisible bridge up to 60 feet long and 10 feet wide that connects two points of your choosing. Both ends of the bridge must be within the spell's range, and both must be solid objects that can support the weight of whatever physical objects cross the bridge. The bridge itself has no weight. Anyone can cross this bridge while it exists, provided they know where it is.

When you cast air bridge using a slot of 5th level or higher, the bridge is substantial only to those you nominate; to all others, it does not exist. This is also true if you cast the spell as a ritual and are capable of casting 5th level spells.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Air Bridge

entries: You create an {@condition invisible}, spherical perimeter around a point you can see within range. The area has a radius of 15 feet. Whenever a creature would enter or leave this area without teleporting, the spell delivers an electric shock.

An affected creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d8} lightning damage and until the beginning of its next turn its speed is reduced to 0 and it can't gain any bonuses to its speed. This occurs before the creature crosses the threshold. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and its movement is not impeded.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Electric Fence

entries: You throw a bolt of fire at one creature you can see. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. If it hits, the bolt does {@damage 5d10} fire damage.
For each spell slot used higher than 3rd level, the spell does an additional {@scaledamage 5d10|3-9|1d10} damage.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Far Strike

entries: A shimmer of light flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then bursts with a thunderclap into an explosion of concussive force. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 6d6} force damage on a failed to save and is pushed back 15 feet from the spell's target point. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pushed back. In addition, if a creature's saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th-level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Forceball

components.m: a flask of holy water and powdered sapphire worth 100 gp

entries: With this spell, provide aid, protection, and joyful feelings to a willing creature you touch; you can't cast this spell on yourself. For the duration, the creature radiates a pale glow that sheds dim light to a 5-foot radius and gains the following benefits:

• The creature can't be {@condition frightened} or {@condition poisoned}, and it can't be rendered {@condition unconscious} unless it is reduced to 0 hit points. If it had been suffering from one of those conditions before you cast exultation, the condition is paused while this spell is in effect.
