• The creature can't gain any levels in {@condition exhaustion}. If had one or more levels before you cast this spell, it doesn't suffer from their effects while this spell is in effect.
• The creature gains a number of temporary hit points equal to 10 + your caster level. When the spell ends, the target loses any remaining temporary hit points from this spell.
• The creature has advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) and Charisma (Persuasion) ability checks.
• Once while this spell is active, the creature may roll a {@dice d6} and add the number rolled to any ability to check or saving throw it makes.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th-level or higher, the creature gains an additional 5 temporary hit points for each slot level above 3rd. In addition, when you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th or 7th-level, the die becomes a {@dice d8}. When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 8th or 9th-level, the die becomes a {@dice d10}.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Exaltation

entries: When cast on an evil creature with an Intelligence of 5 or higher, this spell causes feelings of intense guilt and shame to well up in that creature's mind. It must make a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 5d10} psychic damage. If this brings the target to 0 hit points, it is instead reduced to 1 hit point and falls {@condition unconscious} instead of dying. Upon waking up, the creature must make a second Wisdom saving throw or have its hit point total reduced by {@dice 3d10}. This reduction remains until a {@spell greater restoration} or similar spell is cast upon it.
spell.name: Awaken Sin

components.m: two short sticks and two smooth wooden or glass balls

entries: You create a multi-jointed, mechanical arm that appears to extend out of your body and has a reach of 30 feet. It ends in a fully articulated hand. The arm is an object that can be attacked. It has an AC of 20, 25 hit points, and uses your Strength and Dexterity. When you first cast this spell, and on each of your subsequent turns, you can use your action to cause the arm to lift or open objects or attack a creature by making a melee spell attack. On a hit, you inflict {@damage 2d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier bludgeoning damage.
spell.name: Probing Arm

entries: You fire a ray of green-black light at a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, then that creature suffers no harm. Instead, that creature's dearest friend or loved one takes {@damage 6d6} necrotic damage, no matter where that creature is (as long as it is on the same plane of existence as you). If the loved one is standing in an antimagic field, it is immune. If the creature has no dear friends or loved ones, it takes the damage instead.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Love's Pain

components.m: a vial of ink worth 1gp, which is consumed in the casting

entries: You magically record the events of your day in a diary, which you must hold or keep on your person while this spell is in effect. The spell causes thoughts you focus on to appear in the diary, in your handwriting. It doesn't write your every stray thought; rather, it records your deliberate internal narration, in whatever language you think them in. (You should inform the DM what you are actually recording while this spell is active.)

You can also cause images to appear in your diary, but you must spend time concentrating (as if concentrating on a spell) on the image you want to appear. In general, 1 minute is enough for for a rough sketch, 10 minutes is enough for a simple drawing, and 30 minutes is enough for a complex drawing. The quality of the art you produced is commensurate with your own artistic skill, but is still very rough. If you lose concentration before your drawing is complete, your drawing vanishes.
The spell ends if the diary is ever moved more than 5 feet from you or if it runs out of pages; you receive a mental alert if your diary is close to being full.
This spell only records your direct narration. You can't use it to record other people, either spoken aloud or transmitted telepathically.
spell.name: Diary

entries: You target a creature who is attacking with a weapon and cause the weapon to twist around and strike the attacker instead. It uses the same attack roll the attacker made, and if that is sufficient to hit the attacker, it takes damage.
spell.name: Bladebend

time.condition: taken when you see a creature attacking with a melee weapon

entries: When you cast this spell, you must select to implement either the right hand or the left hand of judgment effect.
Whenever you are struck by an opponent's melee attack, you can use your reaction to attack that opponent.
entries.name: Left Hand

entries: Whenever you spend your action dodging during combat, you accumulate one charge. When you make a successful attack during the spell's duration, you can expend one charge to turn the normal hit into a critical hit.
entries.name: Right Hand

spell.name: Hand of Judgment

entries: One creature you touch bursts into flame. At the beginning of each of its turns, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage, or half damage with a successful Dexterity saving throw. The fire is extinguished after two successful saving throws, which do not need to be consecutive. The flames also do damage to equipment the creature is wearing if it burns for more than two rounds.
Creatures standing adjacent to the burning creature may also take damage; each takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage at the beginning of its turn unless is makes a successful Dexterity saving throw.
spell.name: Flames of Purification

entries: You infuse one object with a magical trap. Anyone other than you who touches the object takes {@damage 10d6} lightning damage, or half damage with a successful Dexterity saving throw. You can create a command word when the spell is cast that will allow other creatures to handle the item safely.
The presence of a charge on an object can be detected with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check; the DC equals your spell saving throw.
spell.name: Charge

entries: Until the end of the round, your movement speed is doubled and, as long as you move only in a straight line, you can make a normal melee attack against each creature you move adjacent to. If your attack hits, the creature is knocked {@condition prone} in addition to other effects. You do not provoke opportunity attacks while moving in this fashion.
spell.name: Divine Rush

entries: A willing creature you touch becomes extremely elastic and is able to bend, twist, and stretch itself in any direction. While this spell is in effect, the creature gains the following traits:
• It is immune to bludgeoning damage from nonmagical attacks and resistant to damage from bludgeoning damage from magical attacks.
• Its reach increases by 10 feet, and it can increase its height by up to 5 feet.
• It can move through a space large enough for a creature two sizes smaller than it without squeezing.
When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th-level or higher, its reach and height can increase by an additional 5 feet for each slot level above 4th.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Grimly's Elasticity

components.m: a small rod made of metal

entries: A hail of tiny flaming meteors pounds to the ground in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. Each creature in the cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 5d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The flaming meteors turn the storm's area of effect into difficult terrain until the end of your next turn, and it ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the bludgeoning damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Hellish Hail

entries: You create an earthen shelter under the roots of a tree. A door appears at the base of the tree, or in the ground if the tree is not wide enough for a door. When opened, the door reveals steps that lead down into a 15-foot-square room. You can select up to nine individuals who can open the door and enter the underground space. You also designate the shelter's ambient temperature.

The shelter keeps occupants safe from storms, forest fires, and other natural hazards. The door is visible to anyone passing nearby with only a DC 10 Wisdom (Perception) check. It can be forced open with a Strength (Athletics) check, or it can be destroyed like any normal, 2-inch-thick wooden door.
Characters or creatures inside the shelter when the spell ends are expelled violently as the earth closes around them, and they take {@dice 3d6} points of bludgeoning damage in the process.
spell.name: Forest Home

entries: You control the illumination in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you can see, choosing whether it's full darkness, dim light, or bright light. You can change the level of illumination by one level as a free action when you cast the spell and at the beginning of each of your turns.
Other forms of illumination initially function normally within the zone, but you can change their effectiveness on your subsequent turns.
spell.name: Light Control

components.m: a personal, intact object belonging to the caster, twine left outside during a full moon

entries: You form a crude representation of a humanoid creature from dead twigs. Something belonging to the target must be incorporated into the twig doll. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the twig doll is mystically linked to the targeted creature. At any point in time, you can have a maximum of 2 twig dolls.

As an action, you can break or burn parts of the twig doll to injure the linked creature. A maximum of {@damage 10d6} force or fire damage can be inflicted on the linked creature. The damage can be done all at once, or in smaller amounts at a time. For example, you could spend an action to inflict {@damage 1d6} fire damage on your turn. On your next turn, you could do {@damage 5d6} force damage. This leaves {@damage 4d6} damage that could be inflicted at a later time.
The doll is destroyed and the spell ends when {@damage 10d6} damage has been done.
spell.name: Twig Torture

components.m: a pinch of goat's hair and a stone

entries: When you cast this spell, you must call loud attention to your target. All creatures within 20 feet of that target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you and become convinced that the target is to blame for all of their troubles. The target will have disadvantage on all Charisma ability checks, except for Charisma (Intimidation), and all other creatures will be hostile to the target for the duration.

When you cast this spell with a 5th or 6th-level spell slot, the duration becomes Concentration, up to 10 minutes. When you cast it with a 7th or 8th-level spell slot, the duration becomes Concentration, up to 1 hour. When you cast it with a 9th-level spell slow, the duration becomes 8 hours, without the need for concentration.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Scapegoat

entries: You and each creature you choose within range is surrounded by a protective silver aura. Each creature affected by the aura gains a +5 bonus to AC for the duration of the spell. The effect ends for a creature when it attacks or casts a harmful spell.
spell.name: Silver Shield

components.m: a dried eyeball and an eye agate worth 10gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You create a magical sensor on an object within range. Then determine the circumstance that will trigger the spell to activate.

When that circumstance occurs, the eye appears on the object and you receive a mental ping, as long as you are on the same plane of existence. If the object you chose has an eye or something that looks like an eye (for example, the eye of a statue), the magic eye will appear there. You can then use your action to see through the magic eye until the start of your next turn, for up to 1 minute. During this time, you are blind with regard to your own senses. At the end of that time, the eye vanishes from view. When you cast this spell, you can have the spell end after it pings you and you look through it, or it can remain and reappear whenever the trigger occurs.

The triggering circumstance can be as general or as detailed as you like, though it must be based on visual conditions that occur within 30 feet of the object. For example, you could instruct the eye to activate when any creature moves within 30 feet of it, or only when specific types of creatures move within 30 feet of it.
spell.name: Magic Eye

entries: You touch the ground and send a furrow of displaced earth 5 feet wide toward a point you can see. Upon reaching the target point, the earth erupts in a cylinder 30 feet in radius and 30 feet high. Creatures that were standing on top of the furrow as it passed underfoot are knocked {@condition prone} unless they make successful Dexterity saving throws. Creatures in the area of the eruption take {@damage 7d6} bludgeoning damage and are knocked {@condition prone}, or take half damage and are not knocked {@condition prone} with a successful Dexterity saving throw.
For each spell slot used higher than 4th level, the spell does an additional {@damage 1d6} damage.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Earthburst

entries: On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to choose a creature within range and curse it with bad luck. The next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw the creature makes before the start of your next turn is made with disadvantage.

You cannot choose to curse the same creature on two consecutive turns. A creature with the Lucky feat or that is attuned to a stone of luck or a luck blade can't be affected by this spell. Halflings have no particular resistance to this spell.
spell.name: Unluck

entries: You send a bolt of psychic energy through the target's mind, causing the creature to suffer from a terrible, throbbing headache. The creature must make an Intelligence saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. In addition, on a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma ability checks and saving throws for the duration, as well as on Constitution saving throws to avoid losing concentration.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th-level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Mystic Bolt

m.text: amber dust and fossil bonemeal worth 100 gp

entries: You fire a 1-inch-wide, 60-foot-long beam of senescent energy that pierces through creatures, objects, and structures alike at untraceable speed. An object or structure pierced by the beam has its AC permanently reduced by 4 if it is inorganic. If it is organic, the point pierced by the beam and the object or structure's material within 1 foot of the beam decays and ages until it is brittle enough to break by a light touch.

A creature pierced by the beam must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 10d8} necrotic damage and instantly ages {@dice 2d4 x 10} years on a failed save; if this damage would reduce a creature to 0 hit points, it falls {@condition unconscious} and is stable instead of dying, and it ages an additional year for each point of damage it took in excess of its current hit points. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't aged.

The aging can be reversed with the greater restoration spell or more powerful magic, but only if it is cast within 24 hours of failing the saving throw. After that time, only a wish spell can reverse the effect.
spell.name: Deadline

components.m: a tiny glass globe with silver filigree worth 250 gp

entries: You release a burst of electric energy that fills the area, spreading around corners. Each creature besides you in the area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 3d12} lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Additionally, each active spell or magical effect in the area whose spell level is no more than half the level of the slot used to cast this spell is automatically dispelled. For each other spell or magical effect in the area, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC of this check equals 10 plus the spell's level. On a success, the spell ends.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 5th.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Electromagnetic Pulse

entries: An aura that inflicts an overwhelming sense of despair radiates from you in a 30-foot-radius; the aura moves with you.

Each creature that's inside the aura when the spell is cast or that enters the aura must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the creature must subtract {@dice 1d6} from its attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks that it makes inside the aura. In addition, a creature other than you inside the aura must also make a Charisma saving throw before attacking or casting a spell; If the saving throw fails, the creature hesitates instead and takes no action.
spell.name: Mantle of Dread

entries: You gain control of the wind in a limited area, and can cause it to fill the sails of a ship, even on a calm day. The wind blows in the direction you desire, without weakening or shifting, for the duration of the spell. The area around the ship is unaffected by this spell; only its sails feel the wind. You must remain in range of the sails throughout the duration of the spell or the effect ends.
spell.name: Billow the Sails

entries: You scream and emit a 30-foot cone of damaging sound. Each creature in the cone takes {@damage 8d8} thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for one minute, or takes half damage and is not {@condition deafened} with a successful Constitution saving throw.
For each spell slot used higher than 5th level, violent scream does an additional {@damage 1d8} damage.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Violent Scream

entries: You gain control of one non-instantaneous, area effect spell within range whose area is not centered on an object or a creature, such as stinking cloud or flaming sphere. When you cast spell legs, and at the beginning of each of your turns, you can move the targeted area of effect up to 20 feet in any direction.

If the original spell was not cast by a willing creature and has a duration of 'concentration' , you must make an opposed ability check at the beginning of each of your turns, pitting your spellcasting ability against the original caster's. You can move the spell if you win the contest; otherwise, the spell behaves normally.
spell.name: Spell Legs

entries: You fill yourself with righteous fury and bring down the wrath of your god. You are surrounded by a brilliant glowing light that sheds bright light to 5 feet and dim light a further 5 feet. For the duration, your proficiency bonus is doubled when you make melee weapon attacks, and you inflict an additional {@damage 2d10} force damage with a successful attack. In addition, your AC improves by 2, you can't be {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition poisoned}, and you have advantage on Wisdom saving throws. Finally, you score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20, instead of just 20.
You must use your action to make a melee attack each round while this spell is active. If you choose to take a different action, the spell ends.
When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th-level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Godrage

entries: One willing creature you touch sprouts long, sharp spurs of bone all over its body. The creature does {@damage 2d6} piercing damage to its target when it successfully initiates a grapple. It does another {@damage 2d6} damage at the start of its turn to any creature it has {@condition grappled}.
spell.name: Blades of Bone

entries: When you cast this spell, your eyes glow ruby-red, causing you to shed dim light in a 10-foot radius. On each of your turns, you may use your action to force a creature within range to make a Constitution saving throw, as long as you can see that creature's eyes. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} for 1 minute.
The creature may make a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
spell.name: Basilisk Glare

components.m: a shard of a blade and a ball of tar

entries: You infuse a series of vibrations in your skin that make you capable of absorbing metal weapons that strike you. When you are struck by a metallic melee weapon, its wielder must make a Dexterity saving throw or the weapon is absorbed into your flesh and you take no damage from the attack. If the weapon is magical, its enhancement bonus is added to the creature's saving throw.
A creature within 5ft of you may wrench a weapon free from your flesh by making a contested Strength check against your DC as an Action
An absorbed weapon is stuck in your flesh and can't be removed. You can have up to five weapons absorbed at one time. Once this limit is reached, you take damage normally from subsequent attacks.
As a bonus action, you can expel all absorbed weapons. The weapons also are expelled when the spell ends. Expelled weapons fall to the ground around you.
spell.name: Blade Bond

m.text: an opal worth 50 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You channel elemental force through a creature you touch. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d10} bludgeoning damage. In addition, a creature standing on earth (such as clay, mud, stone, or sand) must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be pulled into the ground. Huge or larger creatures automatically succeed on their saving throw to avoid being buried.

A creature that starts its turn entombed in this way cannot breathe. While buried, the creature is {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, and {@condition restrained}. As an action, the creature may attempt to unearth themselves with a Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC. On a success, they emerge, {@condition prone}, in the space they last occupied.
spell.name: Burial

entries: You cause the air to vibrate with music concentrated in a wall up to 80 feet long, 20 feet high, and 5 feet wide. The wall forms in an area you choose within range. It must be straight along its entire length. Creatures in the area occupied by the wall when it's created make Dexterity saving throws. A successful saving throw indicates the creature can immediately move to an adjacent unoccupied space; if the saving throw fails or the creature has nowhere to go, the wall forms with the creature in it. The wall doesn't obscure vision or block movement physically.
When you cast the spell, you choose whether the song is melodious or cacophonous.

The melodious song causes one side of the wall that you choose to emit a pleasing melody that entrances those that can hear it; the other side is silent. Every creature within 30 feet of the melodious side of the wall that can hear the song must make a Wisdom saving throw at the beginning of each of its turns. If the saving throw fails, the creature must move toward the wall by the shortest, safest route until it is within the wall. Including using all it's actions to dash if necessary

A creature that enters the melodious wall or ends its turn inside it must make a Wisdom saving throw. If this saving throw fails, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} for as long as it's inside the wall. If it takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw; it awakens on a successful save. A creature never needs to make more than one saving throw against the wall's effect per turn.

The cacophonous song causes one side of the wall to emit thunderous, damaging vibrations while the other side remains silent. Each creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the wall takes {@damage 3d8} thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} until the start of its next turn, or half damage with no deafening if it makes a successful Constitution saving throw. Being unable to hear the wall doesn't protect a creature against the damage, which is caused by vibrations affecting the creature's whole body.

The interior of the cacophonous wall is even more dangerous; any creature that enters the wall or starts its turn there must make a Constitution saving throw (no more than one saving throw per turn). If the saving throw fails, the creature takes {@damage 8d6} thunder damage, is permanently {@condition deafened}, and is {@condition stunned} until the beginning of its next turn. A successful save halves the damage and the creature is not {@condition deafened} or {@condition stunned}. Creatures that are already deaf are immune to the stunning but still take the damage.
spell.name: Song Barrier

entries: You attempt to nullify the resistances of one creature you can see. The creature loses all of its resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, or one other type of elemental damage for the duration of the spell unless it makes a successful Constitution saving throw. The spell doesn't affect the creature's immunities.
spell.name: Breach Defenses

components.m: a feather, a pinch of wood ash, and a piece of flint

entries: You channel the power of storms, causing your eyes to glow white and static electricity to crackle all over your body. For the duration, you gain a fly speed of 50 feet, wind doesn't hinder your movement, and you have resistance to lightning and thunder damage.
On each of your turns, you can fire lightning bolts from your eyes at a creature you see within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 6d6} lightning damage.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you inflict an additional {@damage 1d6} lightning damage for each slot level above 6th.
entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels

spell.name: Stormrage

m.text: diamond dust worth 300 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target's skin becomes crystalline in appearance and structure, and the target's AC can't be less than 20, regardless of what armor it is wearing. The target is also immune to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
spell.name: Skin of the Crystal Serpent

components.m: three eggs from different kinds of creatures

entries: You forge a telepathic link among up to twelve willing creatures of your choice within range, psychically linking each creature to all the others for the duration. A creature with an Intelligence score of 2 or less isn't affected by this spell.

Until the spell ends, the targets can communicate telepathically through the bond, whether or not they have a common language. The communication is possible over any distance on the same plane of existence; however, the link is greatly weakened between planes: a creature that is part of the link can only send a short message of 25 words or less between planes. Once a creature has sent this message, it can't send another message between planes this way until the spell is cast on it again.
spell.name: Greater Telepathic Bond

entries: You create an enormous, glowing, blue-white foot of magical force in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The Medium-size foot hovers in the air, 3 to 4 feet above the ground. When you cast the spell and as a bonus action on your subsequent turns, you can move the foot up to 60 feet in any direction and direct the foot to attack a creature adjacent to it. Make a melee spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the foot does {@damage 10d8} force damage, the target then needs to make a Strength saving throw or be subject to one of the effects below. You must choose the effect before the saving throw is made.

Stomp.  The creature is knocked {@condition prone}, and {@condition restrained}. A {@condition restrained} creature takes {@damage 4d8} force damage at the end of each of its turns. The restraint ends automatically if the foot moves or attacks again. Otherwise, a {@condition restrained} creature can escape by using an action to make a successful Strength check against your spell saving DC.
Kick. The creature is pushed up to 60 feet in a direction of your choosing.
The foot is big enough to provide half cover and to prevent movement through its space, is immune to damage and all conditions.
spell.name: Bigby's Foot

entries: You coax the essence from the living to drench the surrounding area. Each creature within a 100-foot cube originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@dice 4d8} necrotic and {@damage 4d8} slashing damage as its blood is torn from its body. A creature that doesn't have blood, such as an Elemental, Construct, or Undead, is immune to this damage. The blood then coalesces at the top of the cube, whirling and churning in midair streams and crimson clouds. If no creature took damage when you cast this spell, it fails and immediately ends.

You unleash the blood as a torrent upon the spell's area, sickening your enemies within and interfering with the transmission of positive energy. Each creature you choose that starts its turn within the cube is {@condition poisoned} and can't regain hit points until the spell ends. A creature that is outside the spell's area can make a Charisma saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the spell's effects on it.

When the spell ends, all the collected blood drops to the ground; each creature inside the spell's area drops {@condition prone}, and flames, both nonmagical and those created by a spell of 5th-level or lower, are extinguished within the spell's area.
spell.name: Sanguine Storm

entries: You fire a bolt of negative energy at one creature you can see. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the bolt does {@damage 12d6} necrotic damage and the creature must make a successful Constitution saving throw or gain two levels of {@condition exhaustion}. The bolt then leaps to another target within 50 feet of the previous target that hasn't already been targeted by the spell; if more than one is available, you may choose which target to attack. The effect continues attacking creatures one after another in a chain until it misses or there are no more creatures eligible to be hit.
spell.name: Chain Enervation

entries: You surround a creature or object you can see within range with dozens of floating weapons, that move through the air with masterful precision. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d8} bludgeoning damage, {@damage 5d8} piercing damage, and {@damage 5d8} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Regardless of the result, the target is {@condition grappled} until it frees itself. A creature {@condition grappled} by the weapons can make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your spell save DC as an action. On a success, it frees itself and the weapons disappear. On a failure, it takes {@damage 1d8} slashing damage and {@damage 1d8} piercing damage. If the creature is physically moved more than 10ft out of the grapple by some other effect, it takes additional {@damage 3d8} slashing damage and {@damage 3d8} piercing damage and is freed of the grapple. An object targeted by this spell automatically fails the saving throw, and the spell deals double damage to structures that are Large or larger.
spell.name: Legion's Assault

m.text: 50gp worth of ruby dust, which the spell consumes

entries: A massive sheet of flame flares into existence extending 150 feet in a straight line from you. The wall of flame is 5 feet thick and 80 feet tall. The flames are opaque and last for the duration.
When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 12d6} fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
A creature that comes within 10 feet of the wall or ends their turn there takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage. A creature takes the same damage if it attempts to pass through the wall.
The curtain of flame is semi-solid. Creatures attempting to pass through the wall must succeed on a Strength check against your spell save DC or be rebuffed.
spell.name: Avandra's Planar Fury

entries: You bring forth a large chariot made of flames and two fiery horses to draw it in an unoccupied space within range. The chariot and horses have a land speed of 70 feet and a fly speed of 140 feet. The chariot can carry up to eight Medium or Small creatures; you must touch them as you cast the spell for them to ride the chariot safely.
Other creatures that begin their turn within 10 feet of the chariot or who approach within 10 feet during their turn take {@damage 2d6} fire damage.
While aboard the chariot, a creature has resistance to fire damage (but only selected creatures can get aboard).
The chariot and horses follow your verbal commands.

The chariot and horses can be damaged. Treat the entire assemblage as have AC 18 and 100 hit points. It uses your saving throws, and is immune to fire damage and to bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage from nonmagical weapons. The spell ends if the chariot is reduced to 0 hit points.
The chariot and horses disappear immediately when the spell ends, which can leave passengers falling to the ground.
spell.name: Chariot of Fire

entries: You sow chaos by drawing upon the secret fears of any number of creatures you can see to make them instantly aggressive toward anyone not of their own race. Each creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the creature feels the full effect of this spell; on a successful save, the creature is confused (per the confusion spell) until the start of your next turn.

Targets that failed their saving throws become homicidal against creatures of different races. They have no allies except creatures of their own race, even if those creatures were their enemies before xenophobic rage was cast. Affected creatures must use all of their powers to the best of their ability to destroy the nearest enemies they can see.
Each time an affected creature reduces another creature to 0 hit points or kills it, it can repeat the Wisdom saving throw; a successful save ends the spell's effect on that creature.
spell.name: Xenophobic Rage

components.m: rare inks worth 100 gp and which are consumed in the casting, a forked, metal rod worth at least 250 gp, attuned to a particular plane of existence or an object originally from the plane to be contacted, which is also consumed

entries: You cause a portal to open up on another plane of existence, or to another world on the Prime. The plane's runic symbols must be drawn in a circle or around a door, window, or other arch using the rare inks. You can specify a target destination in general terms, such as the realm of Mycelia in Mechanus, and the portal will appear in or near that destination; in that case, the object should be from that destination.

When you create the portal, you can specify a key needed to use it. The key can be an object or password. When the key is used, the portal will open for 1 minute, then close again. A forked, metal rod attuned to that plane of existence or another world, like the one used as a material component, can also be used to open the portal.
If you cast this spell on the same arch every 10 days for a year, the portal becomes permanent.
spell.name: Planar Link

entries: You protect the area in a 1-mile diameter circle from natural disasters, such as earthquakes, floods, avalanches, and volcanic eruptions. This spell doesn't prevent disasters caused by magic or supernatural means from occurring, such as from an earthquake spell or the regional effects of a red dragon.
Casting this spell on the same spot once every 7 days for a year makes the stable area permanent.
spell.name: Land of Stability

entries: You target a beast, dragon, giant, humanoid, monstrosity, or corporeal undead within range and force it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature's bones begin to turn to dust and it takes {@damage 8d6} force damage. For each round that you concentrate on this spell, the target suffers from additional effects.

{@b Round 2.} The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 4d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one, and its movement is reduced by 10 feet. Its hit point maximum is reduced by the amount of force damage it takes.

{@b Round 3.} The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 4d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one, and its move is reduced by a further 10 feet. Its hit point maximum is reduced by the amount of force damage it takes.

{@b Round 4.} The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 4d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one, and is has a disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. Its hit point maximum is reduced by the amount of force damage it takes.

{@b Round 5-10.} The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 4d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. On a failed save, it falls {@condition prone} and is {@condition incapacitated}. It also becomes vulnerable to bludgeoning damage. Its hit point maximum is reduced by the amount of force damage it takes.

The hit point reduction, reduction to move, and disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity rolls last until the target takes a long rest or is subjected to a greater restoration or heal spell. The target dies if this spell reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A creature killed by this spell is reduced to dust and gristle.
spell.name: The Withering of Lliira

components.m: a drop of blood from each creature that would enter the location

entries: You raise walls into existence on flat ground you can see within range. You can shape these walls as you wish, creating a temple, altar, chamber, or a similar structure. The structure must fit within a 120-foot cube, but you decide its layout and appearance, decorated inside as you see fit.

The structure must have at least one entrance, taking the form of a door or gateway, and a space of your choice no smaller than a 5-foot cube on the ground within the structure must be occupied by a reflective surface, such as a bowl of water, a mirror, or a crystal ball. The spell creates this surface, and you choose its appearance.

Any creature whose blood was used as the material component for the spell's casting can enter the structure freely. While inside the structure, the creature automatically succeeds on ability checks and saving throws made against Illusions, and gains {@sense truesight} out to a range of 60 feet. When a creature whose blood was not used as the material component for the spell's casting attempts to enter the structure, either through its entrance or via teleportation or extraplanar means, it takes {@damage 1d10} force damage and is teleported to an unoccupied but harmless space on the ground up to 15 feet away from the structure.

Additionally, you can spend 10 minutes concentrating on the reflective surface within the structure. If you do so, you can cast the scrying spell, without expending a spell slot or requiring material components. When you cast the spell in this way, the target you choose can be on any plane of existence. If the spell succeeds, the reflective surface displays anything you can see via the spell's sensor. When the spell ends, a creature targeted by the spell learns it was being watched, but not your identity.

Once you use the reflective surface to scry, it shatters, and the structure vanishes as the spell ends. The spell also ends if the structure is targeted by a wish spell, disintegrate spell, or similar magic. The walls of the structure have 150 hit points and are immune to poison and psychic damage.
spell.name: Eldritch Fortress

m.text: a primordial seed worth 2,500 gp, which is consumed

entries: You plant this seed in the ground within range. There are two possible uses for this spell, granting immediate or long-term benefits.

If you cast this spell using 1 action, a rainforest sprouts from the seed, filling a 150-foot cube for 10 minutes, or until you lose concentration. Structures and nonmagical objects in the area are immediately overgrown and ruined, nonmagical bright light in the area becomes dim light as it is blocked from hundreds of angles, and nonmagical fire is snuffed out by a rain that doesn't cease.
You can exclude one or more areas of any size within the spell's area from being affected.

A creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves. In addition, as a bonus action on your turn, you can do any of the following while you remain in the rainforest for the duration:

items: Extend your senses into the forest to learn the location of every creature in the area. Creatures that are hidden from Divination are immune to this effect.

Direct a vine within the spell's area to lash out at a creature within 30 feet of it that you can see. That creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be pulled 20 feet directly toward the vine. Alternatively, you can choose for the creature to instead be {@condition restrained} by the vine until the start of your next turn.

Use 5 feet of movement to enter a tree and, as part of the move used to enter the tree, either pass into another tree within the spell's area or step out of the tree you're in. You appear in a spot of your choice within 5 feet of the destination tree, using another 5 feet of movement. If you have no movement left, you appear within 5 feet of the tree you entered.

entries: If you cast this spell over 8 hours, the rainforest fills a 1-mile cube, it gains all of its immediate benefits, and it can't be dispelled except by a wish spell. While within the forest, you can use an action to expend a spell slot of 5th-level or higher and reawaken the forest. For 10 minutes, or until you lose concentration, you gain the benefits of the spell as if you had cast it with a casting time of 1 action.
spell.name: Primordial Rainforest

entries: With a wave of your hand, you force the sky above you to clear and become night, in a radius of 1 mile. Within the spell's area, spells that can be cast only at night (such as create undead) can be cast regardless of time of day.
When you cast this spell, choose one of the following effects. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to choose an effect, selecting the same effect or a different one.

Dreamland. The terrain within the spell's area shapes to your desires. The tactile characteristics of the terrain are unchanged, so creatures entering the area are likely to see through the illusion. If the difference isn't obvious by touch, a creature carefully examining the illusion can attempt an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to disbelieve it. A creature who discerns the illusion for what it is, sees it as a vague image superimposed on the terrain. You can end this effect as an action on your turn.

Grim. You imbue false life into a corpse you can see within the spell's area. It rises as a skeleton if you choose a pile of bones, or a zombie if you choose a fleshy corpse. On each of your turns, you can use an action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within the spell's area (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete. The creature reverts to a corpse or pile of bones when the spell ends.
Shooting Star. A star streaks across the sky. One creature of your choice who can see the star gains 25 temporary hit points. While the creature has these hit points, it immune to fear.

Slumber. You inflict drowsiness on a creature of your choice within the spell's area. If the target has less than 50 hit points, it fall {@condition unconscious} until the spell ends, it takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake.

Star Storm. Ten stars fall from the sky. Each star hits a creature of your choice within the spell's area. Each star deals {@damage 1d4 + 1} force damage to its target (roll damage for each star separately). The stars all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several. Each time you use this effect, the sky grows darker. After the 10th use, the sky above becomes entirely dark, and you can no longer use this effect.
spell.name: Night Sky

entries: You call upon the fury of Kord as the Giantslayer, drawing upon his war armoury .

Eight large weapons shoot down from the sky at points you choose within range. Each weapon is a 10ft cube, and each must strike a different point, although a big enough creature may be struck by multiple weapons.
A creature struck by one or more weapons must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 20d6} damage type of the weapon on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
spell.name: Remembrance of Swordfall

entries: You transform yourself into a being of pure flame. You retain your size category and general shape, as well as your existing features and abilities, and for the duration you gain the following benefits.
* You glow with an orange light, shedding bright light out to a 30-foot radius and dim light for anadditional 30 feet. You gain a flying speed of 60 feet.
* Whenever a creature moves to within 10 feet of you, starts its turn there, or hits you with a melee attack, that creature takes {@damage 5d10} fire damage.
* You have immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, and fire damage.

* You can cast fireball as a 3rd-level spell without expending a spell slot. Whenever you roll fire damage for a spell you cast, roll dice that are one step larger than normal. For example, a spell that normally deals {@damage 8d6} fire damage would deal {@damage 8d8} fire damage instead.
spell.name: Siphon Planar Energy: Plane of Fire

entries: A large workshop from Mechanus springs forth into a 200ft cube at a point you choose. For the duration of the spell, You may choose to use the forge to create constructs.
Choose one of the following options for what you may create.

items: One {@filter construct of challenge rating 8 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&8]|type=construct|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Two {@filter constructs of challenge rating 5 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&5]|type=construct|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Four {@filter constructs of challenge rating 3 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&3]|type=construct|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Eight {@filter constructs of challenge rating 1 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1]|type=construct|miscellaneous=!swarm}

entries: The construct(s) have the statistics of the chosen form, though it can have a wide variety of cosmetic alterations, chosen by you when you cast the spell.
When the a construct drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind only fine gray dust.
When constructs are created with this spell, they also gain temporary hit points equal to five times your spellcasting ability modifier.

At the end of the duration, the forge blinks back to Mechanus where it channels the energy required to keep the constructs powered. If this spell is cast again, these energy channels are reformed and the existing constructs power down.
spell.name: The Grand Forge of Daedalus

entries: You transform yourself in a being of pure lightning with terrible power. You retain your size category and general shape, as well as your existing features and abilities, and for the duration you gain the following benefits.

You glow with a yellow or blue light (your choice), shedding bright light out to a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. You gain a flying speed of 60 feet, and can choose to pass through solid objects, although you take {@damage 2d10} force damage if you end your turn inside a solid object.

You have immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. You are also immune to lightning damage, and any effect that would deal lightning damage to you instead grants you that many temporary hit points. Any creature that hits you with a melee attack takes {@damage 4d12} lightning damage.
You can cast lightning bolt as a 3rd-level spell without expending a spell slot. All your spells and abilities ignore other creatures' resistance to lightning damage.
spell.name: Siphon Planar Energy: Plane of Air
Deep Ethereal Tunnel

components.m: a gemstone formed from the heart of a dying world, worth at least 50,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You channel destructive energy to tear the very fabric of space on a surface you touch, creating a permanent rift 10ft in radius to another plane of existence. While casting this spell, roll an ability check with your spellcasting ability. On a 20 or higher, you can choose the connecting plane. Otherwise, the plane is chosen the randomly or decided by the DM.

spell.name: Delete Fate

components.m: an object tied to the target's soul, worth at least 100,000 gp

entries: You touch a creature and erase it from existence. The target is removed from the fabric of reality, forgotten by all.

spell.name: Plane

components.m: a piece of creation or internal void energy, and a sacrifice of the caster's own life force worth 5 times thier hitpoint maximum, over the course of the period of casting.

entries: The spell creates a new, self-sustaining pocket dimension according to the caster's desires, ranging from a paradise to a fortress. This dimension is accessible only through a portal at a fixed location chosen at the time of casting. The caster can define the laws of physics, creatures, and geography within this dimension. Upon completion, the caster's life force is tied to the existence of this dimension, granting them god-like control within its bounds but also linking their life to its continuity.

entries.name: Reload
entries: The weapon can be fired a number of times equal to its Reload score before you must spend 1 attack or 1 action to reload. You must have one free hand to reload a firearm.

entries.name: Misfire
entries: Whenever you make an attack roll with a firearm, and the dice roll is equal to or lower than the weapon's Misfire score, the weapon misfires. The attack misses, and the weapon cannot be used again until you spend an action to try and repair it. To repair your firearm, you must make a successful {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} check (DC equal to 8 + misfire score). If your check fails, the weapon is broken and must be mended out of combat at a quarter of the cost of the firearm. Creatures who use a firearm without being proficient increase the weapon's misfire score by 1.

entries.name: Ammunition
entries: All firearms require ammunition to make an attack, and due to their rare nature, ammunition may be near impossible to find or purchase. However, if materials are gathered, you can craft ammunition yourself using your {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} at half the cost. Each firearm uses its own unique ammunition and is generally sold or crafted in batches listed next to the price.

entries.name: Minor Upgrade
entries: This firearm can hold {@table Minor Upgrades|AspysGuidetoInfinitum|minor upgrades}

entries.name: Major Upgrade
entries: This firearm can hold {@table Major Upgrades|AspysGuidetoInfinitum|Major Upgrades}

entries.name: Mastery: Cleave
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Melee Weapon, Heavy Property}

If you hit a creature with a melee attack using this weapon, you can make an attack roll with the weapon against a second creature within 5 feet of the first that is also within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the weapon’s damage, but don’t add your ability modifier to that damage, unless that modifier is negative. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.

entries.name: Mastery: Graze
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Melee Weapon, Heavy Property}

If your attack roll with this weapon misses a creature, you can deal damage to that creature equal to the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon, and the damage can’t be increased in any way, other than increasing the ability modifier.

entries.name: Light
entries: While you are wielding {@i Light} weapons in both hands, You may, as part of the {@action Attack} action, make an additional attack with the weapon held in the other hand. You can still make this extra attack only once per turn and you don’t add your ability modifier to the damage of this attack, unless that modifier is negative.

entries.name: Two-Handed Throwing
entries: This weapon has the 'Thrown' property. But requires two hands to make a thrown weapon attack. If this weapon also has the 'Versatile' property, treat the damage from this weapon as though from an attack made with two hands.

entries.name: Mastery: Push
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Heavy, Two-Handed, or Versatile Property}
If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can push the creature up to 10 feet away from you horizontally if it is no more than one size larger than you.

entries.name: Mastery: Sap
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Versatile property or no other properties}
If you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature has Disadvantage on its next attack roll before the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Mastery: Slow
entries: {@i Prerequisite: None}

If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If you hit the creature more than once with this property, the Speed reduction doesn’t exceed 10 feet.

entries.name: Mastery: Topple
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Heavy, Reach, or Versatile Property}

If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition prone} condition.

entries.name: Mastery: Vex
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Ammunition, Finesse, or Light Property}
If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Mastery: Tumble
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Melee weapon, Light Property}
If you hit a creature with a melee attack from this weapon and deal damage to the creature, You can move up to 10 feet through the creature's space without spending movement speed.

entries.name: Dire
entries: If any of it's damage dice rolls it's maximum, you may roll it again and add the damage. You may repeat the process for each subsequent die rolled.

entries.name: Unarmed
entries: Attacks with this weapon count as both unarmed and weapon strikes and changes the damage type from bludgeoning to the type mentioned. If you benefit from a feature that improves the damage dice of your unarmed attack, you may choose to use it instead of this weapon's damage dice. While wielding this weapon, you treat the hand as though you are not holding anything in it and you can hold an item in the same hand but you may not use the weapon while doing so.

entries.name: Keen
entries: When you make a critical hit with this weapon, roll an additional weapon damage die.

entries.name: Hybrid Weapon
entries: This weapon can be used to make either ranged or melee attacks. It counts as a ranged or melee weapon only when making the respective attacks. The damage die for the weapon may be different depending on the attack made.

entries.name: Exotic
entries: This item is rare and not readily available during character creation. Though it may be a simple or martial weapon, characters proficient in either do not automatically gain proficiency with this weapon and is instead specially gained through other means.

entries.name: Hefty
entries: You require the Multiattack feature to use this weapon. It takes two attacks or two actions to make a single attack with it. A creature with a Strength score lower than 15 makes attack rolls with disadvantage.

entries.name: Polearm
entries: This weapon counts as a polearm for the purposes of qualifying for the {@feat Polearm Master} feat.

entries.name: Scattershot
entries: When you target a medium or smaller creature with this weapon, Make an attack against all creatures within 5 feet of it at disadvantage. If targeting a larger or bigger creature, roll an additional damage die if the attack hits.

Murderous tendencies begin to seep into the thoughts of the creature that attunes to this weapon. At the end of every 14 non-continuous days that it is attuned to this weapon, it needs to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. Failing this saving throw will cause its alignment to shift one step toward evil (good to neutral, neutral to evil). If the creature is already of an evil alignment, its alignment will move one step toward chaotic evil.
entries.name: Lesser Curse of Corruption

entries: Murderous tendencies begin to seep into the thoughts of the creature that attunes to this weapon. At the end of every 7 non-continuous days that it is attuned to this weapon, it needs to make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. Failing this saving throw will cause its alignment to shift one step toward evil (good to neutral, neutral to evil). If the creature is already of an evil alignment, its alignment will move one step toward chaotic evil.
entries.name: Curse of Corruption
Arcane Sentinel
entries: You always know the spell {@spell detect magic} and can cast it at double the radius using 1 charge. On using another charge, the spell can sense through the barriers it is blocked by such as 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

entries.name: Artifact Latent Power
entries: This Artifact has a pool of 15 charges to use its magical abilities. At the end of a long rest, roll a {@dice 1d20}. On a 20 you regain all charges and an additional 10(for a total of 25). On a 1, you regain 5 charges. Otherwise you regain {@dice 2d6+3} charges instead. This Artifact has a +12 to attack and a save DC of 20 for any abilities unleashed through it.

entries.name: Divine Arm Latent Power
entries: This Divine Arm has a pool of 20 charges to use its magical abilities. At the end of a long rest, roll a {@dice 1d20}. On a 19 and up you regain all charges and an additional 10(for a total of 30). On a 1, you regain 5 charges. Otherwise you regain {@dice 3d6+2} charges instead. This Divine Arm has a +14 to attack and a save DC of 22 for any abilities unleashed through it.

item.name: Expanded Capacity Shiftweave
entries: This Expanded Capacity Shiftweave is a magical garment capable of storing up to ten different outfits. Instead of having outfits pre-embedded at creation, this shiftweave can absorb and store any non-magical outfit it mimics. By touching an outfit and spending 1 minute concentrating, the wearer can store the outfit's design in one of the shiftweave's available slots. Stored designs can be accessed or replaced at any time.

By speaking a command word as a bonus action, the wearer can transform the shiftweave into any one of the stored outfits. The clothing cannot mimic the magical properties of other magical garments, despite being able to replicate their look.

entries.name: Chameleon
entries: While wearing the shiftweave transformed into a stored outfit, the wearer can choose to also mimic the voice and general mannerisms of the individual typically associated with the outfit. Granting advantage to deception(charisma) checks made to pass off as the individual.

entries.name: Summon Outfit
entries: As an action, the wearer can target one creature they can see within 30 feet and instantly clothe them in one of the outfits stored in the shiftweave, effectively disguising them. This transformation lasts for up to 1 hour or until the wearer dismisses it as a bonus action

item.name: The Stack Overflow
entries: Created in the hidden digital forges of the Technomancers, The Stack Overflow is a sword of sleek, metallic design, with runes of ancient modron etched along its shimmering, spiral blade. When unsheathed, the air crackles with raw data streams, and the faint hum of binary whispers can be heard.

Attacks made with this greatsword gain an additional +3 to attack and damage rolls. Additionally, this blade does {@dice 2d10} damage instead of the weapon's normal damage dice if the target relies on magic or uses enchanted equipment.

entries.name: PixelWorld Failsafe
entries: Within PixelWorld, this blade deals an additional {@dice 2d10} failsafe damage to creations of the system.

entries.name: Codebreaker
entries: Once per day, you can cast {@spell Counterspell} as a 5th-level spell without expending a spell slot. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Garbage Collection
entries: When the sword strikes an undead or construct, it can instantly disintegrate targets with 64 hit points or less, clearing away the garbage with efficiency.

entries.name: Reboot
entries: Once per long rest, if you fall to 0 hit points, you can choose to 'reboot', instantly regaining 1 hit point and standing up as a burst of energy clears any non-magical restraints or conditions.

item.name: Ring of Salving
entries: You restore an additional {@dice 1d4} hitpoints whenever you heal another creature.

item.name: Smuggler's Ring
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to {@skill Sleight of hand} and {@skill stealth} checks.

item.name: Ring of Geniality
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to {@skill Persuasion} and {@skill Deception} checks.

item.name: Explorer's ring
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to {@skill Nature} and {@skill Survival} checks.

item.name: Ring of the mage
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to {@skill Arcana} and {@skill History} checks.

item.name: Ring of truthfulness
entries: You gain advantage on {@skill Insight} checks.

item.name: Crusher's Ring
entries: Your movement speed is increased by 10ft.

item.name: Ring of Risk
entries: You gain advantage on all attack rolls, but recieve disadvantage on all saving throws.

item.name: Executioner's Ring
entries: When you miss a creature with an attack roll, you can treat that roll as a 20. Once you do so, you cannot use this feature until the next dawn.

item.name: Broodmother's Amulet
entries: If you are healed while wearing this amulet, your attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} poison damage until the end of your next turn.

item.name: Moondrop Pendant
entries: You do not provoke opportunity attacks if you are under half your maximum hitpoints.

item.name: Necklace of Elemental Augmentation
entries: When one of your cantrips deal Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning or Thunder damage, you can add your Spellcasting ability modifier to the damage dealt.

item.name: Necklace of Psychic Sparks
entries: Whenever you cast {@spell magic missile}, you shoot an additional dart.

item.name: Fey semblence Amulet
entries: You have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

item.name: Protector's Amulet
entries: When a nearby ally is targeted by an attack, you can use your reaction to make that attack miss. This feature can only be used once per long rest.

item.name: Boots of Aid and Comfort
entries: You regain 3 hitpoints whenever you heal another creature.

item.name: Bonespike Boots
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and Saving throws while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition prone}.

item.name: Acrobats Boots
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to Acrobatics checks, and Advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

item.name: Gloves of the Balanced Warrior
entries: When you make an offhand attack, you can add your Ability score modifier to the damage roll of that attack.

item.name: Swordmaster's Gloves
entries: You gain proficiency with the {@item shortsword|tct|Shortsword}, {@item longsword|tct|Longsword} and {@item greatsword|tct|Greatsword}, and have a +1 bonus to attack rolls while wielding these weapons.

item.name: Stalker Gloves
item.reqAttune: by a rogue
entries: While wearing these gloves, your Sneak attack deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage. Additionally, you gain a +1 bonus to Ability checks that use Dexterity.

item.name: Bonespike Gloves
entries: While wearing these gloves, your attacks ignore resistance to Bludgeoning, Slashing, and Piercing damage.

item.name: Mantle of the Holy Warrior
entries: While wearing this robe, you can cast {@spell crusader's mantle}. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until the next dawn.

item.name: Shade-slayer Cloak
entries: If you make an attack roll against a creature unaware of your location, the number you need to roll to land a critical hit is reduced by 1.

item.name: Cap of Curing
entries: When you hand out Bardic Inspiration to an ally, they regain {@dice 1d4} hitpoints.

item.name: Jannath's Hat
entries: While wearing this hate, you have advantage on Charisma {@skill Deception} and Charisma {@skill Persuasion} checks.

item.name: Marksmanship Hat
entries: you gain a +1 bonus to ranged and thrown attack rolls while wearing this hat.

item.name: Hat of the Sharp Caster
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on the damage die for a spell attack, you can reroll that damage die. You can only do so once per die.

item.name: +1 Shapeshifter Hat
item.reqAttune: by a druid
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and saving throw DCs of your Druid spells.
While you wear this hat, you can use your Wild Shape feature without expending on of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +2 Shapeshifter Hat
item.reqAttune: by a druid
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and saving throw DCs of your Druid spells.
While you wear this hat, you can use your Wild Shape feature without expending on of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +3 Shapeshifter Hat
item.reqAttune: by a druid
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and saving throw DCs of your Druid spells.
While you wear this hat, you can use your Wild Shape feature without expending on of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Horns of the Berserker
entries: You gain a +{@dice 1d4} bonus to Attack and damage rolls against creatures that are missing any of their hitpoints.
During combat, you take {@dice 1d4} necrotic damage if you don't deal damage during your turn.

item.name: Mask of Soul Perception
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to Attack rolls, Initiative rolls and {@skill perception} checks.
You can cast {@spell detect thoughts} once per day without expending a spell slot.

item.name: Helmet of Grit
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to Dexterity saving throws.

When you drop below half your hit points while wearing this helm, you gain an additional bonus action on your next turn. Once this feature is used, it cannnot be used again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Helm of Balduran
entries: You gain the following bonuses while attuned to this helmet:

items: You gain {@dice 1d4} hitpoints at the start of every turn.
You have a +1 bonus to AC and Saving throws.
You gain immunity to the {@condition stunned} condition.
Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

item.name: Drow Leather Armor
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to your {@skill Stealth} rolls while wearing this armor.

item.name: Ambusher's Armor
entries: While wearing this armor, you gain the following benefits:.

items: You gain a +2 bonus to Armor Class.
You gain a +2 bonus to initiative rolls.
When you hit a creature with a an attack roll on the first round of combat, you deal an additional 2 points of damage of the weapons damage type.

item.name: Psionic Ward Armor
entries: While wearing this armor, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class.
You gain resistance to Psychic damage.
Whenever you succeed on a saving throw from a spell or magical effect, you regain {@dice 1d4} hit points.

item.name: Armor of Persistence
entries: While wearing this armor, you gain a +2 bonus to AC.

Additionally, the Armor has 5 charges. Whenever you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to expend one charge, gaining resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage until the start of their next turn.
The armor regains {@dice 1d4+1} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Shield of Retaliation
entries: If you are hit by a melee attack while wielding this shield, you can use your Reaction to knock them {@condition prone}, unless they succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength/Dexterity modifier).

item.name: Viconia's Walking Fortress
entries: While wielding this shield, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a +2 bonus to Armor Class.

If you are hit by a melee attack while wielding this shield, you can use your Reaction to deal {@dice 2d12} force damage and knock them {@condition prone}, unless they succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking only half damage (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength/Dexterity modifier).
You have advantage on saving throws made against spells, and spell attack rolls made against you are made at a disadvantage.
You can cast {@spell warding bond} oncer per long rest.

item.name: Shield of Devotion
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to your AC while wielding this shield. Additionally, you can cast the {@spell mass healing word} spell once per long rest without expending a spell slot.

item.name: Bonespike Garb
item.reqAttune: by a barbarian
entries: Whenever you enter Rage while attuned to this item, you gain a number of Temporary hitpoints equal to your Barbarian level. Additionally, Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage you take from attacks is reduced by 2.

item.name: Infernal Robe
entries: While wearing this robe, you gain resistance to Fire damage, and a +1 bonus to your armour class. Additionally, you can cast {@spell fire shield} (warm only) once per long rest.

item.name: Cloak of Authority
entries: While wearing this robe, you gain advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. Additionally, you have advantage on {@skill Intimidation} and {@skill Insight} checks.

item.name: Robe of Summer
entries: While wearing this robe, you gain resistance to Cold damage.

item.name: Poisoner's Robe
entries: While wearing this robe, any spell you can add {@dice 1d4} Poison damage to one damage roll of a spell you cast that deals Poison damage.

item.name: Icebite Robe
entries: While wearing this robe, you gain resistance to Cold damage. Additionally, you can cast {@spell armor of agathys} as a 4th level spell. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: Wavemother's Robe
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and Resistance to Fire and Cold damage while attuned to this Robe. Additionally, you can cast {@spell create or destroy water} without expending a spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot cast it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Ritual Dagger
entries: This dagger is uncannily smooth. Arcane symbols are strewn on its hilt. While holding this magic weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, you can use the dagger as a spellcasting focus for your spells, gaining a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells when you do.

item.name: Lance
entries: This weapon loses the Two-Handed property while you are mounted.

item.name: Lancet
entries: It is nearly indistinct from a spear were it not for the plumage that would be the fletching on regular arrows. It can be used as a simple melee weapon which behaves like a {@item javelin|phb|javelin}.

item.name: Shot Pouch
entries: A slighlty brittle pouch coated with black powder, containing shot and gunpowder for use by shotguns.

item.name: Bayonet
entries: A sharp implement usually affixed to some ranged weapons, but still a capable weapon on its own. A ranged weapon with the 'Two-Handed' property (Except for bows) can be turned into a hybrid weapon by attaching a bayonet to it, taking a minute to do so.
After which the ranged weapon gains the following property:-

entries.name: Melee Attack
entries: You use the bayonet to stab dealing {@dice 1d4} piercing damage on a hit.

item.name: Greatbow
entries: A rather large, and wieldy bow usually used by larger creatures. It uses Strength for its attack and damage rolls.
Without a Dexterity score of at least 16, all attacks made with it are at disadvantage.

item.name: Hoopak
entries: A hoopak is a sturdy stick with a sling at one end and a pointed tip at the other.

entries.name: Melee Attack
entries: You use the pointed end of the weapon to stab dealing {@dice 1d6} piercing damage on a hit.

entries.name: Ranged attack
entries: You load a bullet into the sling and launch it with the staff dealing {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage on a hit.

item.name: Whipshot
entries: A whipshot is a combination of a whip and a slingshot.

entries.name: Melee Attack
entries: You load a bullet into its sling and whip it {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage on a hit.

entries.name: Ranged attack
entries: You load a bullet into its sling and launch it with a whip crack dealing {@dice 1d8} piercing damage on a hit.

entries.name: Melee Attack
entries: You swing it while it's loaded, dealing {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage on a hit.

entries.name: Ranged attack
entries: You lob a loaded bullet from the sling, dealing {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage on a hit.

entries.name: Melee Attack
entries: You treat it as a {@item quarterstaff|phb|quarterstaff}, dealing {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage on a hit or {@dice 1d8} if held with both hands

entries.name: Ranged Attack
entries: You blow out a loaded needle, dealing {@dice 1d1} piercing damage on a hit.

entries.name: Special
entries: Once loaded, you may replace an attack with a fiery discharge in the form of a a 15 foot cone originating from you. Creatures affected must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC of 8 + Proficiency Bonus + Dexterity Modifier), taking {@damage 2d10} fire damage on a failure or half as much on a success. You may rearm the lance by using two {@item shot pouch|tct|shout pouches} and an action.

entries.name: Special
entries: Attacks from this weapon can reach a further 5 feet, making you able to target a creature 15 feet away from you.

entries.name: Special
entries: You wield this weapon as though you are dual wielding it, allowing you to engage in two-weapon fighting (Dual wielder feat and TWF fighting style applies)

item.name: Double Crossbow
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action on this turn, you may fire this weapon again using a bonus action, ignoring the loading property for this attack.

entries.name: Special
entries: Attacks with this weapon are at disadvantage unless it is planted onto the ground. Planting requires a bonus action and a surface like dirt or wood that the weapon can dig into. Once planted the weapon is immobile and require a bonus action to displace it. While planted, it deals {@damage 1d4} additional piercing damage on a hit.

entries.name: Special
entries: A creature hit with this weapon must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + proficiency bonus + Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

item.name: Jester's Dusters
entries: When you make a melee attack with this weapon you choose to deal either slashing, piercing or bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can make another melee attack with it as part of the same action. This attack deals {@dice 1d4} slashing damage on a hit, instead of {@dice 2d4}.
Elves or Half-Elves who are proficient with this weapon gain +1 AC while wielding it and can treat it as though it has the {@b Finesse} property.

item.name: Hand Catapult
entries: A miniature version of a catapult made for handheld use. It's mechanisms are similar to a crossbow's.

item.name: +1 Kinetic Bracelets
item.reqAttune: by a flickwrist
entries: These bracelets are engraved with arcane symbols that faintly glow in response to movement. While you wear and are attuned to the bracelets, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls, spell damage rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Cantrips.
You may also apply this bonus to {@skill Sleight of Hand} and {@skill Performance} checks. In addition, you satisfy the material component of cantrips you cast while they are worn.

item.name: +2 Kinetic Bracelets
item.reqAttune: by a flickwrist
entries: These bracelets are engraved with arcane symbols that faintly glow in response to movement. While you wear and are attuned to the bracelets, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls, spell damage rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Cantrips.
You may also apply this bonus to {@skill Sleight of Hand} and {@skill Performance} checks. In addition, you satisfy the material component of cantrips you cast while they are worn.

item.name: +3 Kinetic Bracelets
item.reqAttune: by a flickwrist
entries: These bracelets are engraved with arcane symbols that faintly glow in response to movement. While you wear and are attuned to the bracelets, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls, spell damage rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Cantrips.
You may also apply this bonus to {@skill Sleight of Hand} and {@skill Performance} checks. In addition, you satisfy the material component of cantrips you cast while they are worn.

item.name: Lufstalis
entries: The Legendary Scimitar wielded by none other than Geryllen Estfall. It's said to bend the very space around it to land it's attacks
You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon
If you make a critical hit with this weapon, you may disappear and make 2 additional attacks against creatures of your choice within 30 feet reappearing 5 feet near the last creature you attacked.

item.name: The Blade of Disaster
entries: A planar rift bleeds through this hilt made of cold stone.
You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
A roll of 18-20 is a critical hit with this weapon and deals {@damage 12d12} instead of {@damage 8d12} force damage.
This sword can harmlessly pass through any barrier including a {@spell wall of force} stopping at the hilt.
