item.name: Sharp Tongue
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
This weapon has 4 charges and it recovers {@dice 1d4} charges at dawn

When a creature that you can see within this weapon's reach makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a damage roll, you can use your reaction to expend one charge, attempting to attack it. On a hit, you can roll a {@dice d6|1d6} and subtracting the number rolled from the creature's roll and dealing that much additional psychic damage. You can choose to use this feature after the creature makes its roll, but before the DM determines whether the attack roll or ability check succeeds or fails, or before the creature deals its damage.

item.name: Sheath of Gusts
entries: This weapon is nothing but a hilt and a sheath. Once attuned to, removing the hilt from the sheath for a brief moment reveals a blade of concentrated raging winds on it, violently dissipating shortly after.
As part of an attack, you may quickly draw the sword and make one attack after which the blade explodes producing one of the effects as described in the spell {@spell gust|xge|gust} (Save DC 15).
The winds regenerate at the end of the turn while the blade is sheathed.

item.name: Copper Breath
entries: This weapon is nothing but a hilt and a sheath. Once attuned to, removing the hilt from the sheath for a brief moment reveals an acrid smelling blade of foam-like acidic air.

As part of an attack, you may quickly draw the sword and make one attack after which the blade explodes producing the effect of the spell {@spell Pungent Vapours|tct|Pungent Vapours} (Save DC 15) in the place attacked.
The blade regenerate at the end of the turn while the blade is sheathed.

item.name: Gloves of Embers
entries: A pair of soot-blackened gloves
It has 3 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d4 - 1} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 5 and a Save DC of 13
You can expend a charge to cast {@spell produce flame} or {@spell create bonfire}
As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, creating a spark like one created by a fire striker.

item.name: Gloves of the Bonfire
entries: A pair of stiff leather gloves. There is a slight smell of sulfur.
It has 5 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d4 + 1} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 7 and a Save DC of 15.
You can cast {@spell produce flame}, {@spell firebolt} or {@spell create bonfire} at will.
Otherwise, when you cast a spell that deals fire damage, you can spend one charge to roll an additional damage die.
When you make an unarmed strike with this, you deal an additional 1 point of fire damage.
As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, creating a brief flame.

item.name: Gloves of Furnace Flame
entries: A warm pair of gloves.
It has 8 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d6 + 2} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 8 and a Save DC of 16.
You can cast {@spell produce flame}, {@spell firebolt} or {@spell create bonfire} at will.

You can cast {@spell burning hands} by expending 1 charge or {@spell Aganazzar's Scorcher|xge} by spending 2 charges. You can spend more charges in the casting to add an additional damage die for each charge spent, as long as the total used this turn doesn't exceed 5.
Otherwise, when you cast a spell that deals fire damage, you can spend upto 2 charges to roll an additional damage die for each charge spent.
When you make an unarmed strike with this, you deal an additional 2 points of fire damage.

As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, creating a small fire in your hand similar to one created by the {@spell continual flame}. It disappears when you wield something in it or fall unconscious or manually with a bonus action.

item.name: Gloves of Infernal Mastery
entries: A pair of gloves that feels better on the inside than on the outside.
It has 10 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d6 + 4} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 10 and a Save DC of 18.
You can cast {@spell produce flame}, {@spell firebolt}, {@spell create bonfire} or {@spell burning hands} at will.

You can cast {@spell Aganazzar's Scorcher|xge} by spending 2 charges, {@spell fireball} with 3, {@spell wall of fire} with 4, {@spell immolation|tct} with 5. You can spend more charges in the casting to add an additional damage die for each charge spent, as long as the total used this turn doesn't exceed 7.
Otherwise, when you cast a spell that deals fire damage, you can spend upto 2 charges to roll an additional damage die for each charge spent.
When you make an unarmed strike with this, you deal an additional 3 points of fire damage.

When you attune to this item you can choose to gain resistance to fire damage or you may ignore resistance when dealing damage with fire spells you cast. You may change this beneift over the course of a short rest.

As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, causing your arms to be wreathed in flames. It sheds bright light in a 30 foot radius and dim light for another 30 feet. When a creature attacks you within 5 feet of you, it takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. You may dispel this effect with a bonus action.

item.name: Gloves of Droplets

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 5 and a Save DC of 13
You can expend a charge to cast {@spell shape water|xge} or {@spell frostbite}
Snapping your fingers creates a small puff of fog.

item.name: Gloves of the Water Winding

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 7 and a Save DC of 15.

As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, causing your hands to be coated in mist for a minute.

item.name: Gloves of Glacier Guiding

As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, causing a pint of water to well up in the palm of your hand.

item.name: Gloves of the North Wind

item.name: Gloves of Sparks
entries: A pair of silken gloves.
It has 3 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d4 - 1} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 5 and a Save DC of 13
You can expend a charge to cast {@spell arc discharge|tct} or {@spell shocking grasp}
As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, creating a a small arc of current between the snapping fingers.

item.name: Gloves of Charge Channeling
entries: A tingly pair of silken gloves. Wearing it occasionally causes goosebumps.

As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, causing arcs to form between your fingers for 6 seconds.They can be crackling or silent but they emit bright light in a 10 foot radius around you and dim light for another 10 feet.

item.name: Gloves of Violent Voltage
entries: You may have some diificulty wearing these silky gloves. Reaching out towards someone might cause a spark.
It has 8 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d6 + 2} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 8 and a Save DC of 16.
You can cast {@spell arc discharge|tct}, {@spell lightning lure|tce} or {@spell shocking grasp} at will.

You can cast {@spell witch bolt} by expending 1 charge or with 2, you can expel lightning from your hand as though from the {@spell dragon's breath|xge} spell. You can spend more charges in the casting to add an additional damage die for each charge spent, as long as the total used this turn doesn't exceed 5.
Otherwise, when you cast a spell that deals lightning damage, you can spend upto 2 charges to roll an additional damage die for each charge spent.

You may drop the ball or throw it 60 feet away as an action, disappearing at the start of your next turn.

item.name: Gloves of Storm Steering
entries: A pair of supercharged gloves. Best accompanied with another pair of rubber gloves for safety.
It has 10 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d6 + 4} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 10 and a Save DC of 18.

When a creature within 5 feet of you makes an attack against you, it takes {@damage 1d6} lightning damage. You may dispel this effect with a bonus action.

item.name: Gloves of Fingersnaps
entries: A pair of metal gloves.
It has 3 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d4 - 1} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 5 and a Save DC of 13

You can expend a charge to cast {@spell thunderclap|xge} or use it in an action to force creatures in a 10 foot radius around you to make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, failing which causes them to be deafened.
As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, emitting a sound that can heard a 100 feet away.

item.name: Gloves of Whip Crack
entries: A pair of metal gloves. Tapping with it makes it reverberate.
It has 5 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d4 + 1} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 7 and a Save DC of 15.

You can cast {@spell thunderclap|xge} or {@spell booming blade|tce} at will or use an action to force creatures in a 10 foot radius around you to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, failing which causes them to be deafened.
Otherwise, when you cast a spell that deals thunder damage, you can spend one charge to roll an additional damage die.
When you make an unarmed strike with this, you deal an additional 1 point of thunder damage.
As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, you can have the sound of a whip cracking emit from a point you can see within 60 feet of you.

item.name: Gloves of Thunderstrike
entries: A humming pair of gloves. Earplugs are recommended.
It has 8 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d6 + 2} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 8 and a Save DC of 16.

You can cast {@spell thunderclap|xge} or {@spell booming blade|tce} at will or an action to force creatures in a 10 foot radius around you to make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, failing which causes them to be deafened.

You can cast {@spell thunderwave} by expending 1 charge or {@spell shatter} with 2. You can spend more charges in the casting to add an additional damage die for each charge spent, as long as the total used this turn doesn't exceed 5.
Otherwise, when you cast a spell that deals thunder damage, you can spend upto 2 charges to roll an additional damage die for each charge spent.
When you make an unarmed strike with this, you deal an additional 2 points of thunder damage.
As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, causing a sound like distant thunder to reverberate 300 feet around you.

item.name: Gloves of Void Collapse
entries: A thrumming pair of Gloves. You can feel it stirring your bones.
It has 10 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d6 + 4} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 10 and a Save DC of 18.

You can cast {@spell thunderclap|xge}, {@spell booming blade|tce} or {@spell thunderwave} at will or use an action to force creatures in a 10 foot radius around you to make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, failing which causes them to be deafened.

You can cast {@spell shatter} by expending 2 charges, {@spell painful resonance|AspysGuidetoInfinitum} with 3, {@spell thunder step|xge} with 3 or {@spell coulette's concussor|tct} with 4. You can spend more charges in the casting to add an additional damage die for each charge spent, as long as the total used this turn doesn't exceed 7.
Otherwise, when you cast a spell that deals thunder damage, you can spend upto 2 charges to roll an additional damage die for each charge spent.
When you make an unarmed strike with this, you deal an additional 3 points of thunder damage.
Once on your turn, when a creature takes thunder damage from you, it is pushed 5 feet away.
When you attune to this item you can choose to gain resistance to thunder damage or you may ignore resistance when dealing damage with thunder spells you cast.

As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, causing your arms to reverberate with thunder. When a creature within 5 feet of you makes an attack against you, it takes {@damage 1d6} thunder damage. You may dispel this effect with a bonus action.

item.name: Gloves of Basic Acids
entries: A rubbery pair of gloves. It is sour to the taste.
It has 3 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d4 - 1} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 5 and a Save DC of 13
You can expend a charge to cast {@spell primal savagery|xge} with your hands or {@spell acid splash|tct}.
As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, causing the smell of rotting eggs to come from a point you can see with 10 feet of you..

item.name: Gloves of Bitter Study
entries: A rubbery pair of gloves. A brief whiff of it irritates the nose.
It has 5 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d4 + 1} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 7 and a Save DC of 15.
You can cast {@spell primal savagery|xge} with your hands, {@spell acid splash|tct} or {@spell pungent vapours|tct} at will.
Otherwise, when you cast a spell that deals acid damage, you can spend one charge to roll an additional damage die.
When you make an unarmed strike with this, you deal an additional 1 point of acid damage.
As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, turning a pint of water within 10 feet acidic or cause the air 10 feet around you to become irritable for skin and breathing.

item.name: Gloves of Auric Diffusion
entries: A caustic pair of gloves. Touching another may cause a rash to break out.
It has 8 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d6 + 2} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 8 and a Save DC of 16.
You can cast {@spell primal savagery|xge} with your hands, {@spell acid splash|tct} or {@spell pungent vapours|tct} at will.

You can cast {@spell acid wind|AspysGuidetoInfinitum} by expending 1 charge or {@spell melf's acid arrow} with 2. You can spend more charges in the casting to add an additional damage die for each charge spent, as long as the total used this turn doesn't exceed 5.
Otherwise, when you cast a spell that deals acid damage, you can spend upto 2 charges to roll an additional damage die for each charge spent.
When you make an unarmed strike with this, you deal an additional 2 points of acid damage.
As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, causing a sound like distant acid to reverberate 300 feet around you.

item.name: Gloves of the Alkahest
entries: A pair of gloves is required to wear these gloves.
It has 10 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d6 + 4} of them at dawn. While attuned and wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

items: It counts as an arcane focus. Spells cast from the glove have an attack modifier of 10 and a Save DC of 18.
You can cast {@spell primal savagery|xge} with your hands, {@spell acid wind|AspysGuidetoInfinitum}, {@spell acid splash|tct} or {@spell pungent vapours|tct} at will.

You can cast {@spell Tasha's Caustic Brew|tce} by expending 1 charge, {@spell melf's acid arrow} with 2, {@spell vitriolic sphere} with 4 or {@spell rusting rain|tct} with 5. You can spend more charges in the casting to add an additional damage die for each charge spent, as long as the total used this turn doesn't exceed 7.
Otherwise, when you cast a spell that deals acid damage, you can spend upto 2 charges to roll an additional damage die for each charge spent.
When you make an unarmed strike with this, you deal an additional 3 points of acid damage.
When you attune to this item you can choose to gain resistance to acid damage or you may ignore resistance when dealing damage with acid spells you cast.

As a bonus action you may snap your fingers, causing your arms be coated in viscious veneer of acid. When a creature within 5 feet of you makes an attack against you, it takes {@damage 1d6} acid damage. You may dispel this effect with a bonus action.

item.name: Riviere of Displacement
entries: While you wear this necklace, any spell you cast or effect you produce that causes teleportation has the range of the destination increase by 10 feet for every 30 feet of teleportation range (rounded down).

item.name: Purse of Moneycounting
entries: This item takes the appearance of a regular purse or pouch. It only accepts treasures like jewelry, gems and coins that fits into a hole as wide as a regular hand, harmlessly expelling any other item if it is put into the pouch. The inside of the pouch is much larger than what it appears on the outside, storing up to 10,000 gp worth of coins and treasure.

If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again.
You can use a bonus action to shake the bag which will make it produce a set of chimes indicating the value of all the items inside.

item.name: Medallion of Gargoyles
entries: This stone medallion is shaped like a grotesque head. While wearing this item, you can use your action to summon a pair of {@creature Gargoyle|MM|gargoyles} that emerge from a piece of stone that you can see within range. A {@creature gargoyle|MM} summoned by this amulet disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or after 1 hour.

The summoned {@creature Gargoyle|MM|gargoyles} are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for them as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures but otherwise take no actions.
Once the medallion is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: The Memory Crystal
entries: Made of a clear and smooth polished glass, this crystal ball is perfectly spherical. While holding it with both hands, you can as an action cause one of the following effects to occur:

entries.name: Project
entries: A spectral door forms in the center of the crystal. A creature can open this door and enter the crystal with an action. When a creature enters the crystal this way, the last memory stored inside it will start to play.
Once the memory is concluded, the creature appears in an unoccupied space within 5ft of the crystal.

entries.name: Protect
entries: As an action, you can cause the crystal to take on a pearly white color. While the crystal is in this state and as long as you are holding it with both hands, you are immune to psychic damage, any effect that would sense your emotions or read your thoughts, divination spells, and the charmed condition.

You may replace the memory stored within by casting {@spell modify memory} into the crystal. The crystal can hold a total of 60 minutes of one memory. When you cast the spell, you must specify the exact time from when the memory starts. When a creature’s memory is in this crystal, projections occur from the point of view of the caster.

Additionally, you may store the memory of a location in the crystal by physically being present in the location and casting modify memory. A location’s memory is available as an explorable space to any creature using “Project”. From the area where the memory begins, a creature can travel upto 100ft in any direction before the edges of the crystal appear.

item.name: Half Plate of Seamless Percussion
entries: This Half Plate Armor is made of a mix of soft jet-black, shaped mithral plates and smooth dark brown leather. The plates themselves can be heard vibrating with a low hum when the armor is held to the close to the ear. While wearing this armor, you have a +2 bonus to Armor Class.
This armor has two functioning modes (Frequency shift and Resonance) and you can switch between them as part of a long rest.

entries.name: Frequency Shift
entries: If you are hit with an attack while attuned to this armor, you can as a reaction switch the frequency of the vibrating plates to negate some of the damage. Roll {@dice 3d8} and subtract that from the damage dealt to you for that attack, unless it is psychic damage. You can adjust the frequency of this armor a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier+1. Your uses recharge after a long rest.

entries.name: Resonance
entries: As a bonus action, you can attune the plates' frequency to the natural frequency of a single melee or ranged weapon. Thrown weapons cannot be affected this way. When the armor is attuned this way, your attacks with that weapon deal an extra {@dice 1d6} damage for 1 minute. During this time and till your next long rest, you also make Dexterity (Stealth) checks at disadvantage as the plates slowly realign. You can use this feature twice and your uses recharge after a long rest.

Mithral is a light, flexible metal. A mithral chain shirt or breastplate can be worn under normal clothes. If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks or has a Strength requirement, the mithral version of the armor doesn't.

item.name: Studded Leather Armor of Leaping Fire
entries: The Regal looking set of armor is made from the pelt of a {@creature Noon Wolf|AspysGuidetoInfinitum}. Streaks of red flame shoot through the armor in periodic intervals warming those in the close vicinity of the armor.
While wearing this armor, you have a +1 bonus to Armor Class, and you have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Leaping Fire
entries: If you take more than 30 points of damage during a single creature's turn, the armor splits dealing 3d6 fire damage to each creature in a 5ft radius. The fire spit out then gathers into a {@creature fire elemental} as if you had cast the {@spell Summon Elemental} spell, overiding any spell you were concentrating on. The fire elemental is friendly to you and your allies as long as you hold concentration. For the duration of the spell or as long as the elemental is alive, the armor loses the fire resistance trait. The armor can split in this manner once and will not summon a fire elemental until the next dawn.
Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

item.name: Longsword of Malice
item.reqAttune: by a neutral or evil creature
entries: This longsword seems to me made of a rough dark metal. It does not shine to light.
You have a +2 to attacks and damage rolls made with this weapon. A creature attuned to this weapon can hear quiet laughing coming from the blade

entries.name: Ill will
entries: When you take the attack action, you can choose to imbue this weapon with malice. On the next attack that hits, you deal this weapons normal damage and subject the target to the effects of the {@spell Harm} spell (DC 15). Once this ability is used, you cannot use it again before before a long rest. You can use a short rest to recharge this ability if you use 10 of your hit dice. You receive no healing from those hit dice but this feature is recharged.

entries.name: Lesser Curse of Corruption
entries: Murderous tendencies begin to seep into the thoughts of the creature that attunes to this weapon. At the end of every 14 non-continuous days that it is attuned to this weapon, it needs to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. Failing this saving throw will cause its alignment to shift one step toward evil (good to neutral, neutral to evil). If the creature is already of an evil alignment, its alignment will move one step toward chaotic evil.

item.name: Greataxe of Despair
item.reqAttune: by a neutral or evil creature
entries: This great-axe is made of a metal-oil amalgam. It shimmers to light as if it is coated in a layer of slick. You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. When attacking a creature that is making death saving throws with this weapon, 3 death save failures are inflicted intead of 2.

While attuned to this weapon, you can sense sorrow and despair in creatures that you can see. As an action, you can instil additional despair into a mind. The creature must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or attack rolls made against it with this weapon are at advantage until it is reduced to 0 hitpoints.

entries.name: Fickle hope
entries: When you take the attack action, you can choose to imbue this weapon with malice. On the next attack that hits, you deal this weapons normal damage and subject the target to the effects of the {@spell Power Word Pain} spell (DC 16). The hitpoint limit for this casting is removed. Once this ability is used, you cannot use it again before before a long rest. You can use a short rest to recharge this ability if you use 15 of your hit dice. You receive no healing from those hit dice but this feature is recharged.

entries.name: Curse of Corruption
entries: Murderous tendencies begin to seep into the thoughts of the creature that attunes to this weapon. At the end of every 7 non-continuous days that it is attuned to this weapon, it needs to make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. Failing this saving throw will cause its alignment to shift one step toward evil (good to neutral, neutral to evil). If the creature is already of an evil alignment, its alignment will move one step toward chaotic evil.

item.name: Music Box (Ostinato)
entries: This music box is made of a fine polished wood. Opening it plays a nice repetitive catchy tune that can often find itself seated in the minds of those that hear it.

entries.name: Summon Ostinato.
entries: As an action, you can draw out the essence of music from this box and manifest it as an invisible creature. The summoned creature is controlled by the one that summoned it and it rolls its own initiative in combat. If the {@creature Ostinato|AspysGuidetoInfinitum} uses Aural symbiosis, it is unable to take actions other than Voracious Aura.
If the ostinato is reduced to 0 hitpoints, it goes back into the box and cannot be summoned before a long rest.

item.name: Loon
entries: This brown loincloth is made of a soft silky fabric that is jagged at the edges. When worn by a creature, their AC increases by as much as their constitution modifier. However, A creature with a negative constitution modifier will have their AC decreased by the modifier.
This AC bonus is removed temporarily when the attuned creature dons armor. Shields may be used however.

item.name: Verdant fabric of the Tree Walker
item.reqAttune: by a creature that bears the mark of Ventari
entries: This fabric rests as a pile of leaves when it is not worn. As an action, an attuned creature can will the leaves to form as armor or an item of clothing such as a scarf, a jacket, a cape or a hat if the leaves are within 30ft or doff it back to a pile of leaves to a location within 30ft.
While wearing this as armor, you have a +3 bonus to Armor Class. Additionally, when in areas of thick vegetation or near a tree, you have advantage on Dexterity(stealth) check

When you take a short or long rest and when you attune to this fabric, you must choose a season to attune the fabric to. You can choose between Winter, Spring, Summer and Autumn.

You get resistance of damage of a certain type associated with the fabric. Summer (Fire), Spring (Radiant), Winter (Cold), Autumn (Necrotic)

entries.name: Plant phase
entries: As an action while wearing this fabric, you can cast either of the following spells, Tree stride or Transport via plants once a day. If any of the effects require a DC, the DC is 15.

entries.name: Tree stride
entries: You cast the {@spell tree stride} spell with this fabric. In addition to the effects of the spell, you gain an an additional effect based on the season the fabric is attuned to.

items: Winter. Once a turn, on the first attack you make when you walk out of a tree, you can add an additional 5d4 cold damage

Spring. Once a turn, when you walk out of a tree, you can force a creature you can see within 10ft of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is charmed. If you or your allies are currently engaged in hostilities with the target creature, it makes the save with advantage.
Summer. Once a turn, the first attack you make when you walk out of a tree, is with advantage.

Autumn. Once a turn, when you walk out of a tree, you can force a creature you can see within 30ft of you to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, you can move the creature upto 20ft in any direction.

entries.name: Transport via plants
entries: You cast the {@spell Transport via plants} spell.

entries.name: Germinate
entries: As an action, pick two spots on the ground that are within 40ft of you and within 40ft of each other. The fabric releases two spores that strike each of these chosen locations. At the start of your next turn, these two spores grow into two similar looking oak trees of 100ft height and 5ftx5ft width. The trees wither and die after one hour.

entries.name: Speak with plants
entries: While wearing this fabric, you can always talk to plants.

item.name: The Bad News
entries: The bad news is a firearm with a long barrel and a chamber capable of firing ammunition twice as large compared to a musket.

entries.name: Heavy Barrel
entries: If the bad news is used as an improvised weapon, the damage die used is a 1d10 instead of a 1d4

entries.name: Prone sniper
entries: The barrel of the bad news is fitted with fitted with two stands that extend when you go prone to provide stability to the firearm, negating the disadvantage caused on attacks while prone.

entries.name: Unconcealable
entries: The size of the Bad news makes it nearly impossible to hide on the person of a medium or smaller creature of height 5ft or lower.

entries.name: Twice-forged steel
entries: The refined make of the Bad News resists mishaps like misfiring. The first time that you misfire after a long rest is negated by the firearm.

item.name: Vastavikta, The Reality Monger
item.reqAttune: by a Paladin/Zealot Barbarian of Good/Neutral Alignment
entries: This Sword was forged in the divine realms and entrusted to a hero who was on a quest to quell the consequence of the Arcane Aftermath. This Sword was one of three boons that graced the world after the reality morphing event changed the face of Fer.

The Blade resembles a relatively thin greatsword, with a hilt that looks like the inside of an atom. Despite its thin form, there is an intricate series of deep carvings in arcane script around the blade, removing just enough weight that it vibrates in constant pitch when struck. The runes also cause a dull glow that sheds dim light upto 15 feet in all directions. As a bonus action, the wielder can channel the blade’s energy to shed bright light in a 30ft radius.

Whenever a creature whose reality was altered, such as with the wish spell, time travel or as determined by the DM comes within 60ft of this blade, sweet celestial music permeates the atmosphere as the blade begins to mildly vibrate.
You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra {@dice 1d8} force damage as the blade vibrates and churns the insides of the target.

The Blade has a pool of 15 charges when attuned to. Charges can be spent to do a number of things. At the end of a long rest, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 20, it regains all charges and has an additional 10 charges. On a 1, it regains 5 charges. On other rolls, it regains {@dice 1d12+3} charges upto 15.

entries.name: Wrathful Reality
entries: You can expend a number of charges to deal extra damage against creatures. As a bonus action, you can charge the weapon's persussion with a frequency. Next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before a short or long rest, You deal 1d8 psychic damage and an extra 1d8 for each charge loaded upto 5 charges. 2d8 if the creature is reality altered.

entries.name: Paranoia's End
entries: After a long rest and before charges have been regained, Choose 7 levels of spells from the {@filter wizard spell list upto level 5|spells|level=1|level=2|level=3|level=4|level=5|class=Wizard}. You can cast these spells through this sword by spending spell level*2 number of charges without the need for any material components.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: You always know the spell detect magic and can cast it using 1 charge. The radius is doubled and on spending another charge, your range becomes uninterrupted.

entries.name: Vicinity breeds affinity, affinity breeds power, power yearns vicinity.
entries: As long as one of the other 2 weapons of the arcane aftermath get within 1000ft of this weapon, the creature attuned to it always knows the direction to the weapon.

Once all three weapons of the arcane aftermath are within 30ft of eachother, they fuse with the creatures they are attuned to. All creatures attuned to these weapons recieve a +2 to any ability of thier choice. Make the following changes to Vastavikta.

items: Attacks and Damage rolls get a +4 bonus.
Wrathful Reality's charge limit increases to 7 charges.
The extra damage increases to 1d12.

item.name: Enchantment Fabric +1
entries: This soft cloth shimmers with a faint glitter. As part of a long or short rest, you can infuse this cloth with a simple or martial weapon, applying the enchantment to the weapon's attack and a damage rolls.

item.name: Enchantment Fabric +2
entries: This soft cloth shimmers with a faint glitter. As part of a long or short rest, you can infuse this cloth with a simple or martial weapon, applying the enchantment to the weapon's attack and a damage rolls.

item.name: (Asmodeus) Soulbinder, The Infernal Code of Conduct
item.reqAttune: By a devout champion of Asmodeus
entries: Soulbinder is a tome of unspeakable law and dark contracts, its pages made from the skins of damned souls, rules penned by Pyreclaw, the eternal punisher. Pages of this tome are bound together with chains that smolder with incredible heat. This accursed volume stands as a testament to Asmodeus's supremacy over all pacts and a conduit for his acolytes to channel the depths of infernal jurisprudence.

The tome provides a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs. Spells and cantrips unleashed from this tome inflict an additional {@dice 1d8} fire damage, as its scriptures blaze with the fury of the infernal realms.

When attuned to it, you know the {@spell eldritch blast} cantrip and can cast it using your spellcasting ability. The tome shoots out burning pages wrapped in chains for each of the beams. If three or more beams target the same creature, it must make a Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} till the end of its next turn. If targetted by 3 or more beams while {@condition grappled}, the creature must make another Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. The tome can only restrain one creature at a time.

entries.name: Absolute Command
entries: Using 5 charges, you forge a pact with any creature within 60 feet, compelling obedience with infernal authority. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw or become bound by the pact, on a success it deals {@dice 6d10} psychic damage and the pact ends. While under pact, the creature must use its action next turn follow the command issued by the pact, which can be a simple phrase like the ones listed in the {@spell command} spell.

entries.name: Cataclysmic Hellfire
entries: Expend 3 charges to unleash a devastating eruption of hellfire, casting a {@spell fireball} at the your current highest available spell slot without consuming it. You must have the spell slot unused. This hellfire, infused with the essence of the Nine Hells, radiates intense heat and malevolence. For each extra charge used, the {@spell fireball} grows in power, increasing its damage by {@dice 1d6} and radius by 5ft, harnessing ultimate wrath of the hell.

item.name: (Asmodeus) Ebony and Ivory, The Infernal Accords
item.reqAttune: by a devoted champion of Asmodeus
entries: Ebony and Ivory, the Infernal Accords, are a pair of enchanted pistols that embody the duality of the hells. Order and chaos, punishment and temptation. Crafted from the bones of a celestial and the heart of a demon, these pistols are a testament the law enforced within the hells. Their barrels glow with eldritch runes, and they emit a soft, ominous hum when drawn.
Wielding Ebony and Ivory grants a +5 bonus to attack and damage rolls, and each shot deals an additional {@dice 2d8} radiant or necrotic damage depending on the pistol, Ebony and Ivory respectively.

You must hold both the pistols in each hand, otherwise suffering a -10 penalty to attack rolls if used seperately. When you make an extra attack, you can use the other pistol to make an additional attack.

entries.name: Hell's Barrage
entries: As an action, expend 3 charges to unleash a barrage of hellfire bullets, targeting up to six creatures you can see within range. Make a ranged attack for each bullet. On a hit, each shot deals {@dice 4d10} fire damage instead of the weapon's damage dice.

entries.name: Infernal Armament Transformation
entries: Expend 8 charges as a bonus action to merge Ebony and Ivory into 'Hellfire's Fury', a minigun of devilish design with a capacity of {@dice 20d10} bullets. This transformation lasts for 1 minute or until all bullets are expended, whichever comes first.

As an action while transformed, you can unleash a barrage of upto 50 bullets at one or multiple targets within range. Each bullet inflicts 3 piercing damage. Targets must make a Dexterity saving throw to take half damage; failing the save results in full damage from the barrage.
Creatures who fail their saving throw by 5 or more are also frightened until the end of their next turn.

item.name: (Akadi) The Staff Beyond Absolute Zero
item.reqAttune: by a Champion of of Akadi
entries: Crafted from the eternal ice found only in the deepest parts of Akadi's frozen domain and feathers from the rarest air elementals, the Absolute Zero is a staff of unparalleled beauty and power. Its crystalline structure pulses with a soft blue light, and ethereal wings unfold from its shaft when its full might is called upon.

The staff exudes a perpetual chill, leaving a trail of frost where its wielder walks and occasionally stirring a gentle, icy breeze that ruffles the clothes and hair of those nearby. On command, it can intensify this chill, frosting over surfaces and creating a localized snowfall. This will freeze water in a 60ft radius around you as well.
This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC.
Attacks made with this staff, or spells cast using it as a focus, deal an additional {@dice 1d8} cold damage to their targets.

entries.name: Flash Freeze
entries: As a reaction when you take damage, you can instantly encase yourself in a protective layer of ice by expending 4 charges. This icy shell grants you temporary hit points equal to 10 times your level, absorbing as much of the triggering damage as possible. Once encased, you gain vulnerability to fire damage, your speed is reduced to 0, and you are incapacitated due to the intense cold and immobilization by the ice. These effects, including any unspent temporary hit points, last until the ice melts at the end of your next turn.

Should the protective ice shatter from incoming damage, it erupts in a chilling explosion. Creatures within 30 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw or suffer {@dice 8d6} cold damage as shards of ice pelt the area.

entries.name: Blizzard
entries: As an action, plant the staff into the ground and expend 10 charges to summon a localized blizzard in a 100ft radius centered on the staff for 1 minute, causing all creatures inside to become heavily obscured, the area becomes difficult terrain, and you deal {@dice 4d6} cold damage to creatures of your choice at the start of their turn while they are within the storm. The staff must remain planted, and the effect ends if it is removed. It takes a free action to remove the staff.

item.name: (Akadi) -999999999 °C
item.reqAttune: by a devoted champion of Akadi
item.rechargeAmount: 1d20; on 20, regains all charges and gains an additional 10 charges; on 1, regains 5 charges; else, 1d12+8 charges up to 20
entries: This staff is a divine embodiment of mastery over winter's ferocity. Forged in the heart of a never-ending blizzard and cooled in the node that connected the planes of air and water, this staff is encased in ice that never melts and adorned with crystalline formations that shimmer with an inner light. If the protecting outer layer of ice is broken or removed, the area around the staff chills down to -999999999 °C.
This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +5 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +5 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC.
Attacks made with this staff, or spells cast using it as a focus, deal an additional {@dice 2d8} cold damage.

entries.name: Frostborne Wings
entries: Expend 4 charges to manifest ethereal wings of ice and snow, granting you a flying speed of 60 feet for 1 hour. While these wings are manifested, your presence chills the air, causing enemies within 30 feet to take {@dice 1d6} cold damage at the start of your turn.

entries.name: Crystal Clone
entries: As a reaction before you are about to take damage, expend 5 charges to summon a crystal clone at your place which takes the damage instead and move upto your movement in a straight line. The path you moved is covered in a trail of frost for 1 minute. Any creature walking across must make a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

The clone has a fifth of you max health. If the damage is enough to shatter it, creatures 30ft around it must make a dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 8d6} cold damage. The clone melts away at the start of your turn.

entries.name: Frozen Citadel
entries: Expend 8 charges to conjure a majestic palace of ice on a solid surface you can see within 100 feet. This grand structure emerges over the course of 1 minute, towering with spires and walls of enchanted ice that shimmer with magical resilience. The palace covers a 50ft square area and rises up to 30 feet high, complete with battlements, gates, and an inner court. You may add additional details if it fits inside the 50ft square.

Inside, the air is comfortably warm for you and your allies, despite the icy construction. The palace remains for 24 hours or until dismissed. It grants sanctuary, withstands up to 100 hit points of damage before melting away, and magically locks to all except those you designate upon its creation.
Additionally, while within the citadel, you and your allies gain advantage on saving throws against cold damage based attacks and spells.

entries.name: Arcane Aura
entries: The raw chill of this staff however contained, slowly trickles out weave energy collected from the surrounding. You can draw from this pool of energy and restore spell slots to creatures of your choice. The staff collects {@dice 1d4} worth of spell slots every hour. The maximum level of slot restored through this feature cannot be higher than 7th level.

item.name: (Talos) Arborean Guard
item.reqAttune: by a devoted champion of Talos
entries: Crafted from arboreal oak and bound with the heart iron of Arborea, this shield stands as a testament to unwavering resilience and determination. It is adorned with ancient runes of vigilance and persistence that glow in the heat of battle, bolstering the resolve of allies.

While wielding this shield, you gain a +3 bonus to AC and grant advantage on saving throws against effects that cause frightened, paralyzed, blinded or restrained conditions to any number of creatures you choose within your sight.

entries.name: Rooted She Stands
entries: Expend 4 charges at will to bolster your defense with a +2 AC bonus for 10 minutes as roots from Arborea's wilderness rise to protect you. With each additional activation, the AC bonus increases by +1, but the duration is halved. Upon depleting the charges, you may transform into one of two states:

items: Barkskin Embrace: The roots recede, leaving a protective layer of bark around you. You retain the AC bonus for the remaining duration.

Guardian of Arborea: Your movement becomes 0 as you are encased in a living bulwark of trees, bark, and branches, bursting into vibrant blooms. A tempestuous wind encircles you within a 60-foot radius, and you gain the ability to redirect any ranged attacks within this area towards yourself. The AC bonus from this feature is doubled.

entries.name: Resolve of the Stoic
entries: You have the {@feat shield master|phb} feat for as long as you are attuned to this shield.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: You always know the spell detect magic and can cast it using 1 charge. The radius is doubled, and spending another charge makes your detection capabilities uninterrupted, piercing through barriers to reveal hidden magic.

item.name: (Talos) Rakshak, The Aegis of Arborea
item.reqAttune: by a devoted champion of Talos
item.rechargeAmount: 1d20; on 20, regains all charges and an additional 10; on 1, regains 10 charges; else, 1d12+8 charges up to 20
entries: The Rakshak, forged amidst a celestial tempest and nurtured by the vital essence of Arborea, transcends the mere concept of a shield. It embodies divine guardianship, brimming with the wild essence of untamed nature and emitting a resonant power that echoes the soul of its celestial domain.

While wielding the aegis, you gain a +3 bonus to AC and +75 bonus to max health. You also grant advantage on saving throws against effects that cause frightened, paralyzed, blinded or restrained conditions to any number of creatures you choose within your sight.

entries.name: Guardian's Embrace
entries: As an action for 6 charges, conjure a dome of divine energy and entwined branches around allies within a 30-foot radius. This sanctuary, lasting for 1 minute, grants immunity to non-magical projectiles and advantage on saving throws against magical effects and spells, with attacks able to pass outward unobstructed.

entries.name: Arborea's Call
entries: Spend 6 charges as an action to channel Arborea's primal force, transforming the terrain within 100 feet into a treacherous underbrush that creates difficult terrain and restrains creatures of your choice in it that fail a strength saving throw and deals {@dice 2d6} piercing damage at the start of each of thier turns. At the end of its turn, a creature may attempt to free itself by making a strength check (DC 20). Allies gain enhanced mobility, doubling their movement speed and navigating the undergrowth freely.

entries.name: Twin Aegis
entries: Expend 10 charges to summon a spectral duplicate of The Aegis of Arborea. This second shield materializes beside you granting you the AC and Max health bonus a second time. You may choose to either extend its protection or engage in offensive maneuvers. Upon activation, decide between defensive stance or offensive assault:

items: Defender's Ward: The spectral shield orbits to protect an ally within 60 feet, granting them +2 bonus to AC and advantage on all saving throws for one minute. you lose the bonuses from the second shield.

Warrior's Charge: Wielding the spectral shield, you gain a ram ability, allowing you to perform a dash action towards an enemy as a bonus action. On impact, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and take {@dice 4d8} bludgeoning damage. Additionally, you emit a taunting aura at the end of the charge, compelling hostile creatures within 60 feet to target their attacks towards you till the start of your next turn. If a hostile creature within 60ft of you targets a creature other than you it makes the attack at disadvantage.

item.name: (Pelor) Divyajyoti, The Radiance of Dawn
item.reqAttune: by a follower of Pelor
entries: Divyajyoti is a divine flail, its head crafted from a solid piece of sunstone and bound with bands of pure gold. Runes of light and order etch its surface, glowing warmly with Pelor's grace. The chain, made from celestial silver, sings with a harmonious tone when swung.

In battle, Divyajyoti emits a radiant light, illuminating the darkness and revealing hidden truths. Enemies touched by its glow find their shadows receding, unable to hide from your gaze. The glow from the flail illulinates {@condition invisible} creatures within 30ft.
Wielding this flail grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When used to strike, it deals an additional {@dice 1d8} radiant damage, intensified to {@dice 2d8} against undead creatures.

entries.name: Luminous Slam
entries: Expend 3 charges as an action to perform a Luminous Slam, channeling radiant energy into the ground with a powerful strike. This action creates a wave of purifying light that expands in a 60-foot radius from the point of impact.

items: Radiant Wave: All creatures within the radius must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 8d6} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Undead have disadvantage on this saving throw.
Blinding Radiance: Creatures that fail the saving throw are also {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn, overwhelmed by the brilliance of the light.

Sacred Ground: The area affected by the Luminous Slam also becomes consecrated till the end of your next turn. Hostile creatures within this area have their speed halved, and allies gain advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed.

If the wave of light encounters reflective surfaces of a combined area of 150sq.ft within its radius, it intensifies, granting temporary hit points equal to half the total radiant damage dealt to the wielder and their allies within the area.

entries.name: Divine Illumination
entries: Once per day, without expending charges, the wielder can cause the flail to burst into brilliant sunlight, casting {@spell daylight} as the spell.

item.name: (Pelor) Kiranmay, the Lightsaber
item.reqAttune: by a devoted champion of Pelor
entries: Forged from the heart of a celestial sun, Kiranmay radiates with an unyielding light that pierces through the deepest shadows. Its blade, is a concentrated ray of light about a meter in length.

In the presence of darkness, the sword's light intensifies, casting bright illumination within a 60-foot radius and revealing entities hidden by magic or shadow. This divine light renders {@condition invisible} creatures visible to the wielder.
This sword grants a +5 bonus to attack and damage rolls. Attacks with this sword deal an additional {@dice 2d8} radiant damage. Against undead, the damage increases to {@dice 3d8} radiant.

entries.name: Concentrated Light Slash
entries: Expend 5 charges to unleash a powerful slash of concentrated light. This radiant arc extends 5 feet wide in a direction you choose, traveling up to 120 feet before dissipating. Creatures caught in its path must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 10d6} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. For each additional 2 charges, the width increases by 5ft.

items: Reflective: If the arc strikes a reflective surface larger than the arc, it bounces in a new direction.
Purifying Light: Creatures fail the saving throw are illuminated and are unable to benefit from being {@condition invisible}

Solar Empowerment: After unleashing the slash, the sword absorbs residual light energy. Your next attack within 1 minute deals an additional {@dice 2d6} radiant damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the total damage dealt by this extra attack.

entries.name: Morning Light
entries: Expend 4 charges to harness the sun's light at dawn, enveloping allies within 200 feet in a radiant aura for 1 minute. when it appears, it grants each ally within its reach {@dice 2d8} hit points.

In addition to healing, the Solar Embrace fortifies those it touches against the cold, granting resistance to cold damage for the duration. The sun's light also purges darkness, dispelling any magical darkness in the area when the aura is activated.

entries.name: Solar Flare
entries: Once per day, without expending charges, you can summon the full power of the sun, enveloping the battlefield in a blinding light. All creatures of your choice within sight must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 10d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half on a success. On spending 5 charges, This divine flare purifies the area, curing creatures of your choice of curses, disease, and poison through a casting of the {@spell greater restoration} spell.

item.name: (Eldath) Susheel, The Cosmic Veena
item.reqAttune: by a Bard or follower of Eldath
entries: Susheel is an ethereal lyre, its existence as timeless as the oldest tales of the Feywild. Crafted from wood that whispers of ancient forests and strings woven from the very threads of time, the instrument's melodies carry the power to bridge worlds and moments. Engraved with depictions of fey dances, serene landscapes, and temporal spirals, it glows with a soft, otherworldly light, inviting its wielder to explore the mysteries of beauty, art, and time.

This artifact bestows upon its wielder the unique ability to weave magic into their music, manipulating time's flow and captivating the hearts of those who hear its divine melodies. Its songs can bend the will of listeners, suggesting actions as if whispered by Eldath herself.

Wielding Susheel grants a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs for Bard spells. Additionally, it enchants audiences with its performance, allowing the wielder to subject one creature per minute, that can see or hear the performance, to the effect of the {@spell suggestion} spell, with the DC set by the performance check.

entries.name: T# Major
entries: When you use the bardic inspiration featue, expend 5 charges to pluck a chord that weaves through the fabric of time. The wielder can hasten or slow the flow of time for up to 3 creatures within 60ft, offering them an extra bonus action or halving their speed until the end of their next turn. Unwilling targets may resist with a Charisma saving throw against the wielder's spell save DC.

entries.name: Wrath of the Feywild
entries: When you use the bardic inspiration featue, Expend 5 charges to channel the untamed power of the Feywild, releasing its wrath upon the battlefield. Upon activation, the you unleash a surge of fey energy, manifesting one of the following effects, chosen at the time of casting:

items: Feywild Storm: Call down a storm of radiant energy in a 30-foot radius centered on a point within sight. Enemies caught in the storm take {@dice 6d8} radiant damage and must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be blinded till the end of your next turn.

Thorned Grasp: Summon ethereal vines from the ground in a 20-foot square centered within 60ft. These vines lash out at all creatures in the area, dealing {@dice 6d6} piercing damage. Enemies must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be restrained by the entangling vines till the end of your next turn.

Wildfire Dance: Ignites the raw magic of the Feywild to send forth a wave of fire in a 60-foot cone. All creatures caught in the wave take {@dice 8d6} fire damage and must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell saving DC or catch fire, taking an additional {@dice 2d6} fire damage at the start of each of their turns until the the creature uses an action to extinguish it.

item.name: (Eldath) Eternity
item.reqAttune: by a devoted champion of Eldath
entries: Eternity is a divine harp, its strings shimmering with the light of stars and its body carved from wood that once formed the core of the Feywild's oldest tree. The harp's melody resonates with the very essence of creation, capable of mending the wounded soul and calming the restless heart. Its music transcends the barriers between worlds, inviting a harmony that echoes Eldath's eternal peace.

Wielding Eternity grants a +5 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs for Bard spells. Additionally, it enchants audiences with its performance, allowing the wielder to subject one creature per minute, that can see or hear the performance, to the effect of the {@spell suggestion} spell, with the DC set by the performance check.

entries.name: Melody of the Ages
entries: When you use the bardic inspiration featue, Expend 8 charges to play a tune that weaves through the fabric of time itself. This melody allows the wielder to either accelerate or decelerate time for up to 5 creatures within 60ft. Accelerated allies gain an additional action till the end of thier next turn, while decelerated foes see their speed halved and AC reduced by 10 till the end of your next turn. Unwilling targets may attempt a Charisma saving throw to resist.

entries.name: Resonance of the Feywild
entries: When you use the bardic inspiration featue, Expend 5 charges to invoke a symphony of the wild, creating an expansive sanctuary that harmonizes with extraplanar energy. This sanctuary, spanning a 60-foot radius centered on the lyre, lasts for 1 minute and manifests one of the effects as listed below. At anytime, while the santuary is active, you can spend 2 charges to immediately change the effect. You choose one when you activate this feature.

items: Healing Harmony: Allies within the sanctuary heal for {@dice 2d8} hit points at the start of their turn, as the music's soothing tones mend wounds and bolster spirits.
Veil of Serenity: The ground and upto 20ft high becomes difficult terrain for creatures of your choice, as ethereal vines and flowers sprout to slow their advance.

Melodic Guard: Allies in the aura gain {@dice 2d8} temporary hitpoints at the start of thier turns, and on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration on spells, protected by a veil of music that shields their minds.

Resonant Retaliation: When creatures hostile to you within the sanctuary attempt to cast a spell or make an attack, the sanctuary produces a dissonant chord. The attacker must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or the attack/spell fails and the caster/attacker takes {@dice 1d8} psychic damage, as the sanctuary itself seeks to preserve the peace.

entries.name: Evergreen Harmony
entries: Once per day, without expending charges, the wielder can initiate a performance that invokes Eldath's eternal blessing. This divine melody weaves a continuous aura of tranquility and resilience around you, lasting for 24 hours.

items: Continuous Protection: Allies within 60 feet of you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, enveloped in an aura that soothes the mind and fortifies the spirit against manipulation and terror.
Regenerative Melody: You and your allies within the aura regenerate hit points, restoring 1 hit point at the start of each hour.
Harmonic Shield: The aura also grants a +1 bonus to AC to all within its reach, reflecting the protective canopy of a verdant forest.

entries: For each additional charge expended (up to 5), the potency of Evergreen Harmony intensifies, enhancing its effects:

items: Each charge increases the hit point regeneration by 1 per hour, up to a maximum of 6 hit points per hour with 5 additional charges spent.

Expend 3 charges to extend the aura's advantage against charm and fear to include immunity to the poisoned condition and resistance to poison damage and instead give advantage on all wisdom saving throws.

item.name: (Bhaal) Sinewsnapper, The Silent Harbinger
item.reqAttune: by a follower of Bhaal
entries: This sinister dagger is forged from a metal that seems to absorb light, with a hilt wrapped in skin from an unknown creature. It is said to have been created in the darkest rituals to Bhaal, infused with the essence of death itself.

While wielding this dagger, you gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. Strikes from this dagger deal an additional {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage, as wounds inflicted fester with supernatural speed, sapping the strength of its victims.
When a creature that was struck by the Sinewsnapper starts it turn, it immediately loses 10ft of movement for the next hour or until it regains hitpoints.

entries.name: Shadow Blink
entries: When you take the attack action, Expend 5 charges to imbue the dagger with a shadowy essence and throw it towards a location within 60 feet. Upon the dagger's impact, you instantly blink to that location, reappearing with the dagger in hand.

entries.name: Necrotic Bind
entries: Expend 3 charges to ensnare a foe struck by this weapon in a malevolent curse. For 10 minutes, any attempt by the cursed entity to heal via magic triggers a necrotic backlash, inflicting damage equal to twice your level in necrotic energy.

item.name: (Bhaal) The Crescent of Blood
item.reqAttune: by a devoted champion of Bhaal
entries: Forged under a blood moon, The Crescent of Blood is a greataxe that whispers of death's inevitability. Its blade, dark as a moonless night and yet, shaped like the crescent of a moon, is rumored to be quenched in the blood of the god's enemies, forever thirsting for the lifeblood of the unwary.

This greataxe grants its wielder a +5 bonus to attack and damage rolls and on a critical hit the target suffers an additional {@dice 4d8} necrotic damage as the blade leeches life from them to you, restoring an equivalent amount of your hit points.

entries.name: Necrotic Surge
entries: Expend 5 charges to cloak the blade in a shroud of necrotic energy for up to 1 minute as a free action. During this time, each successful hit against a living target causes a surge of necrotic pain. The affected target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer disadvantage on their attacks till the end of thier next turn. A creature can only be affected with the surge once a turn.

entries.name: Mark of Bhaal
entries: As an action, expend 6 charges to mark a creature within sight. For the next hour, any attack you make against the marked target has a increased crit range of 1. On Expending 5 more charges, the crit range increases to 2. This reduction in crit range stacks with other features that reduce crit range.

entries.name: Siphon Life
entries: Once per day, without expending charges, landing a critical hit with this weapon allows you to absorb the life force of the target, healing for half the total damage dealt. Expending 5 additional charges enhances this effect, also granting you temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt for 24 hours.

item.name: (Diana) The Moonlit Sonata
item.reqAttune: by a follower of Diana
entries: Forged under the light of a full moon and bathed in the waters of sacred springs, Moonlit Sonata is a shortbow whose string sings with the whispers of the night. Its frame, carved from moon-touched yew, glows faintly in moonlight, illuminating the wielder's path in darkness.
Wielding Moonlit Sonata grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls and inflicts an additional {@dice 1d8} radiant damage, as its arrows are imbued with the luminescence of the moon.

This bow is graced with the touch of Diana, offering guidance under the moon's watchful eye. The wielder and their allies within 30 feet gain enhanced night vision, allowing them to see in dim light as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. Additionally, under the open night sky, the wielder and their allies gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and saving throws against illusions, as the moonlight reveals truths hidden in the shadows.

entries.name: Lunar Volley
entries: When you take the attack action, Expend 5 charges to unleash a volley of moonlit arrows instead of one of your attacks, each seeking a different target within range. You can attack up to three targets, rolling separately for each attack.

entries.name: Twilight's Embrace
entries: Expend 3 charges to envelop an area in a 20-foot radius within 100 feet in twilight, creating dim light that lasts for 1 hour. Within this area, allies gain advantage on Dexterity(Stealth) checks and enemies suffer disadvantage on perception checks to detect them. Additional effects may be activated upon spending more charges.

items: Spend 2 Charges to give allies a +20 bonus to thier stealth checks
Spend 3 Charges to make this area movable, centered on you and extending out to 40ft instead.

item.name: (Diana) Nocturne, Streak in the Dark
item.reqAttune: by a devoted champion of Diana
entries: The Nocturne, a divine longbow, was Diana's gift to her most faithful. Crafted under a lunar eclipse, its limbs are made from silvered wood that reflects the moon's phases. The bowstring, spun from moonlight, emits a soft glow, casting shadows that dance like twilight spirits.
Wielding Celestial Nocturne grants a +5 bonus to attack rolls and deals an additional {@dice 2d8} radiant damage, as its arrows are blessed by Diana's light.

This bow is graced with the touch of Diana, offering guidance under the moon's watchful eye. The wielder and their allies within 30 feet gain enhanced night vision, allowing them to see in dim light as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. Additionally, under the open night sky, the wielder and their allies gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and saving throws against illusions, as the moonlight reveals truths hidden in the shadows.

entries.name: Moonbeam Volley
entries: When you take the attack action, you may replace one of your attacks with a volley of moon beam. Expend 3 charges and shoot upwards to conjure beams of pure moonlight that strike from above, targeting up to five creatures within 100 feet. Roll to hit for each creature. On a hit, each creature takes {@dice 4d10} radiant damage. You may replace multiple attacks with a volley. Expending charges for each.

entries.name: Lunar Requiem
entries: Expend 5 charges to summon a cascade of lunar energy, enveloping an ally within 60 feet in a radiant, protective cocoon. For 10 minutes, this Requiem grants the ally a +2 AC and advantage on saving throws against spells. More so, if the ally is reduced to 0 hit points while under the Requiem's effect, they are instead restored to 1 hit point and gain temporary hit points equal to {@dice 6d8} as a burst of moonlight energy revitalizes them. This revival effect can only trigger once per use of Lunar Requiem.

Additionally, while under the effects of Lunar Requiem, the ally's appearance becomes ethereal, with a soft, moonlit glow surrounding them. This glow illuminates a 10-foot radius, allowing the ally to see in darkness as if it were dim light.

entries.name: Twilight Dominion
entries: Without expending charges, create a 40-foot radius of twilight around you for 1 hour once per day. This domain grants invisibility to you and your allies as long as you remain still and silent within it. Spending 5 additional charges extends the radius to 60 feet and allows movement within the domain without breaking invisibility.

item.name: (Erathis) The Truce, Mantle of Ethereal Order
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, paladin, or any lawful alignment
entries: This divine mantle is woven from the threads of celestial fabric, infused with the essence of law and purity. It shimmers with a soft light, reflecting Erathis's commitment to order, and is adorned with symbols of her dominion over the Material Plane. Those who drape The Truce over their shoulders feel an overwhelming sense of purpose and clarity, driven to uphold the principles of civilization and harmony.

Wearing this mantle grants a +50 bonus to Max health. The wearer is also imbued with a serene aura that calms chaos and discord, radiating an influence of peace and order. This mantle creates an aura of 5ft that applies the effects of {@spell calm emotions} continously. In initiative, it casts calm emotions at the start of your turn.
The mantle enhances the wearer's diplomatic abilities, granting advantage on Persuasion and Insight checks.

entries.name: Harmony's Call
entries: Expend 5 charges to release a surge of calming energy in a 30-foot radius centered on the mantle. For 1 minute, this wave seeks to quell aggression, offering creatures within the area a moment of clarity and peace. Affected creatures must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be compelled to use their next turn to take no action that involves direct harm to others, such as attacking or casting harmful spells. Instead, they may move, use a non-aggressive action, or attempt to communicate peacefully.
Creatures that successfully save against this effect are immune to Harmony's Call for 24 hours.

entries.name: Architect's Insight
entries: Expend 3 charges to activate Architect's Insight for 10 minutes. Upon activation, you and your allies within a 30-foot radius gain unparalleled clarity and focus.
During this time, all affected creatures gain the following benefits:

items: Clear vision upto 2 miles.
Double proficiency bonus on skill checks with tools.
Creatures attempting to deceive or outmaneuver you within this radius have their intentions subtly revealed by Erathis’s light, granting you a +5 bonus to Insight checks against such deceptions.

item.name: (Erathis) Legacy, Cloak of the Founding Order
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, paladin, or any lawful alignment
entries: Legacy is a celestial artifact, woven from the very essence of order and the foundational energies of the cosmos. It radiates with a divine light that structures chaos and illuminates the path toward civilization's zenith. Adorned with sacred geometries and symbols of the first cities, it empowers its wearer to shape the world according to Erathis' vision.

Wearing this cloak grants a +100 bonus to Max health. The wearer is also imbued with a serene aura that calms chaos and discord, radiating an influence of peace and order. This cloak creates an aura of 5ft that applies the effects of {@spell calm emotions} continously. In initiative, it casts calm emotions at the start of your turn.

entries.name: Divine Decree of Order
entries: If you have more than 10 charges, as an action you can expend all remaining charges to issue a divine decree in a 60-foot radius. For 1 minute, this decree enforces a magical contract of non-aggression, preventing any creature from initiating combat or casting spells intended to harm others. Those who attempt to break this contract must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be rendered {@condition incapacitated} till the contract is active, as they are overwhelmed by a compulsion to maintain peace.

The side that casts the first spell or makes the first attack after the contract was enforced, immediately lose thier reaction and gain disadvantage on all attack rolls till the end of each of thier next turns. The contract ends after the first shot.

entries.name: Blueprints of Creation
entries: Spend charges to instantly cast spells that embody influence over craftsmanship and civilization.

items: {@spell Fabricate} (4 charges)
{@spell Wall of Stone} (5 charges)
{@spell Create or Destroy Water} (1 charge)
{@spell Mending} (0 charges)
{@spell Leomund's Secret Chest} (5 charges)
{@spell Mordenkainen's Magnificent Mansion} (7 charges)
{@spell Conjure Celestial} (8 charges)

entries.name: The Town Hall
entries: Once per day, this mantle grants the ability to manifest the essence of civilization, creating a grand hall that serves as a sanctuary and meeting place for allies. This hall appears on a flat surface within sight, is 100ft on a side and lasts for 12 hours. You may build it as you see fit at the time of casting. Creatures that want to enter the hall must fill out an application, copies of which are available at the door. It takes 1 minute to fill out the form and includes personal details such as Name, Race, Age and Address of residence. Once filled, you may approve the creature to enter. Creatures that have filled the form once dont have to do it for subsequent castings.

items: The interior is spacious and comfortable, accommodating up to 20 individuals.
Within the sanctum, allies regain double hitpoints when rolling hitdice.

There are a 1000 spectral bureaucrats hungry for power and promotion and will do anything. Any creature inside the townhall, on saying the command word "You should be mayor" will recieve control of one bureaucrat.
A bureaucrat has 2AC, 1HP, can arrange food, replinishments and trading of mundane goods.
Among the 1000 bureaucrats, you will always find {@dice 1d20} bureaucrats that are proficient in each tool. Bureaucrats cannot go further than 200ft from the hall.

item.name: (Ioun) Ápeiro, the Keen Mantle
item.reqAttune: by a wizard or a creature with the spellcasting feature
entries: This cloak was forged in the divine realms and entrusted to a hero who was on a quest to quell the consequence of the Arcane Aftermath. This Cloak was one of three boons that graced the world after the reality morphing event changed the face Fer.

The cloak in apprance resembles an old, grey mantle with a cape of velvet cloth. Plain grey with a belt of a darker grey. It's jagged at the edges and it looks like it was torn at the base. The wearer feels eons of knowledge coursing through the cloak. Arcane scribblings come to you instantly as if the cloak made of parchment. You can use the cloak to channel any {@filter Wizard spell of lvl5 and below|spells|level=1|level=2|level=3|level=4|level=5|class=Wizard} once a day and cast it without material components. As long as you are wearing this cloak and have enough materials, you can copy the channeled spell into your spellbook.
While you are wearing this cloak, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. You also ignore half and three quarters cover when making a spell attack.
Additionally, you gain expertise in any one of the intelligence skills you are proficient in and the activation of arcane sentinel requires no charges

entries.name: Knowledge of the eons
entries: You get the {@feat keen mind} feat as long as you are attuned to this cloak. If you already have the keen mind feat, you may choose a different feat while you attune to it. You may choose a different feat everytime you attune to this cloak but you must meet the pre-requisites for the feat.

entries.name: Offensive barrier
entries: After a long rest, when you roll to regain charges, choose an element type and the cloak attunes to it. For the rest of the day, you are immune to this damage type, and when you cast a spell that rolls damage die of that element, the damage ignores resistance and immunity of the affected creature.

Additionally, When you roll for damage of the attuned type, you can spend 1 charge to reroll a number of the damage dice up to 4+Spell level. You must use the new rolls. If the damage type is different, you can reroll upto 4 damage dice.

As a bonus action/Reaction(when you take damage) you can spend 4 charges to gain resistance to another element and gain the benefits of casting spells of that type. Doing so will drop your immunity to the first damage type.

item.name: (Ioun) Sapientia Infinita, the Crown of Infinite Insight
item.reqAttune: by a wizard or a creature with the spellcasting feature
entries: The Diadem of Infinite Insight is a masterwork of divine craftsmanship, blessed by Ioun herself. Forged from celestial crystals and infused with the essence of the multiverse's wisdom, it shines with an inner light that mirrors the vastness of Ioun's knowledge.

Wearing this tiara grants a +5 bonus to Intelligence (Investigation) checks, spell attack rolls and spell save DCs for spells. The wearer gains the ability to understand any spoken language, as if under the constant effect of the {@spell comprehend languages} spell.
The activation of arcane sentinel requires no charges

entries.name: Omniscient Insight
entries: As a free action, Expend 6 charges to cast a spell with enhanced clarity and understanding. The spell ignores the target's resistances and treats immunities as resistances instead, for the duration of this casting. This ability applies to the next spell you cast within 1 minute that targets creatures or an area.

Furthermore, if the spell affects one or more creatures, you must spend 1 additional charge for each creature affected and you can choose one of the creatures that fails its saving throw against the spell to gain insight into. For the next round, you gain the following benefits against the chosen creature:

items: Advantage on attack rolls against the creature.
The creature has disadvantage on saving throws against your spells.
You gain insight into one of its vulnerabilities, if it has any.

entries.name: Chronicle of the Arcanum
entries: Expend 3 charges plus an additional number of charges equal to the level of the spell, as a special action, to invoke the Chronicle of the Arcanum. This powerful invocation allows you to peer into the past since your last long rest, revealing all the spells that have been cast within your presence during this period. You may select one spell from this retrospective catalogue and cast it once, without using a spell slot.

The selected spell is cast at its lowest level, and you must be capable of casting spells of its level. The total charge cost for this ability is 3 plus the spell's level. This ability does not allow casting of spells that are exclusive to other classes, unless they are also available to your class or through your feats.

entries.name: Temporal Rewind
entries: Without expending charges, once per day as a free action, activate Temporal Rewind to reverse the flow of time for yourself. This rewind lasts for up to 6 seconds (1 round in combat), allowing you to cancel a detrimental event that just occurred, such as receiving damage, failing a saving throw, or missing an attack. You revert to your state at the beginning of your previous turn, retaining awareness of the event you negated.

To extend this protective rewind to an ally within 30 feet, expend 5 charges. The ally gains the benefits of Temporal Rewind, negating a harmful event while maintaining the foresight of the avoided outcome.

item.name: (Tiamat) Backbiter, The existential Crisis
item.reqAttune: by a creature neutral/evil alignment)
entries: This dagger was forged in the divine realms and entrusted to a hero who was on a quest to quell the consequence of the Arcane Aftermath. This Dagger was one of four weapons that graced the world after the reality morphing event changed the face of Fer.
