classFeature.name: Arcane Apotheosis
entries: You can use one metamagic option on each of your turns without spending Sorcery points on it.

classFeature.name: Deft Explorer
entries: Beginning at 1st level, You are an unsurpassed explorer and survivor, both in the wilderness and in dealing with others on your travels. You gain the Canny benefit below, and you gain an additional benefit below when you reach 6th level and 10th level in this class.

entries.name: Canny
entries: Choose one of your skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses the chosen skill.
You can also speak, read, and write two additional languages of your choice.

classFeature.name: Favored Foe
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you are adept at focusing your ire on a single foe.

You always have the {@spell hunter's mark} spell prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare. Moreover, you can cast the spell twice without expending a spell slot. You regain any expended uses of this feature on a long rest.

classFeature.name: Tireless
entries: As a bonus action, you can give yourself a number of temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Wisdom modifier. You can use this special action a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
In addition, whenever you finish a short rest, your {@condition exhaustion} level, if any, is decreased by 1.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: By the time you reach 2nd level, you have learned to use the magical essence of nature to cast spells, much as a druid does. See {@book chapter 10|DRK|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and {@book chapter 11|DRK|11} for the {@filter ranger spell list|spells|class=ranger}.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Ranger table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter ranger spells|spells|class=ranger} of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell animal friendship} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell animal friendship} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the ranger spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Ranger table shows when you learn more ranger spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the ranger spells you know and replace it with another spell from the ranger spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your ranger spells, since your magic draws on your attunement to nature. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a ranger spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item druidic focus|phb} as a spellcasting focus for your ranger spells. A druidic focus might be a sprig of mistletoe or holly, a wand or rod made of yew or another special wood, a staff drawn whole from a living tree, or an object incorporating feathers, fur, bones, and teeth from sacred animals.

classFeature.name: Primal Awareness
entries: You can focus your awareness through the interconnections of nature: you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class if you don't already know them, as shown in the Primal Awareness Spells table. These spells don't count against the number of ranger spells you know.
You can cast each of these spells once without expending a spell slot. Once you cast a spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ranger Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you choose an archetype that you strive to emulate from the list of available archetypes. Your choice grants features at 3rd level, and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility
entries: Whenever you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace a fighting style you know with another fighting style available to rangers. This replacement represents a shift of focus in your martial practice.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Deft Explorer Improvement
entries: You gain an additional benefit when you reach 6th level in this class.

entries.name: Roving
entries: Your walking speed increases by 5, and you gain a climbing speed and a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

classFeature.name: Ranger Archetype feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Ranger Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Deft Explorer Improvement
entries: You gain an additional benefit when you reach 10th level in this class.

entries.name: Tireless
entries: As a bonus action, you can give yourself a number of temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point). You can use this action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
In addition, whenever you finish a short rest, your {@condition exhaustion} level, if any, is decreased by 1.

classFeature.name: Favored Foe Improvement
entries: Starting at 6th level, {@spell hunter's mark} no longer requires concentration.

classFeature.name: Nature's Veil
entries: At 9th level, You draw on the powers of nature to hide yourself from view briefly. As a bonus action, you can magically become {@condition invisible}, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, until the start of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: At 10th level, your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a blue dragon's lightning breath or a {@spell fireball} spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

classFeature.name: Ranger Archetype feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Ranger Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Vanish
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can use the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on your turn. Also, you can't be tracked by nonmagical means, unless you choose to leave a trail.

classFeature.name: Target Focus
entries: At 14th level, any attack roll you make against a creature under the effects of the {@spell hunter's mark} is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20. Landing a critical hit this way triggers the following effect determined by your subclass. This effect ends when the {@spell hunter's mark} on the creature ends. You also cannot be tracked by non-magical means and non-magical difficult terrain does not cost any extra movement to traverse.

classFeature.name: Ranger Archetype feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Ranger Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Feral Senses
entries: At 18th level, you gain preternatural senses that help you fight creatures you can't see. When you attack a creature you can't see, your inability to see it doesn't impose disadvantage on your attack rolls against it. You are also aware of the location of any {@condition invisible} creature within 30 feet of you, provided that the creature isn't hidden from you and you aren't {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Foe Slayer
entries: At level 20, The damage of your {@spell hunter's mark} spell increases to {@dice 2d6}. Additionally, you always know the location of a creature affected by hunter's mark, and cannot suffer from disadvantage on attacks against them.

classFeature.name: Expertise
entries: At 1st level, choose two of your skill proficiencies, or one of your skill proficiencies and your proficiency with {@item thieves' tools|phb}. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.
At 6th level, you can choose two more of your proficiencies (in skills or with {@item thieves' tools|phb}) to gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.
You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't {@condition incapacitated}, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.
The amount of the extra damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue table.

classFeature.name: Thieves' Cant
entries: During your rogue training you learned thieves' cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation. Only another creature that knows thieves' cant understands such messages. It takes four times longer to convey such a message than it does to speak the same idea plainly.

In addition, you understand a set of secret signs and symbols used to convey short, simple messages, such as whether an area is dangerous or the territory of a thieves' guild, whether loot is nearby, or whether the people in an area are easy marks or will provide a safe house for thieves on the run.

classFeature.name: Cunning Action
entries: Starting at 2nd level, your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

classFeature.name: Roguish Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you choose an archetype that you emulate in the exercise of your rogue abilities from the list of available archetypes. Your archetype choice grants you features at 3rd level and then again at 9th, 13th, and 17th level.

classFeature.name: Steady Aim
entries: {@i 3rd-level rogue {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}

As a bonus action, you give yourself advantage on your next attack roll on the current turn. You can use this bonus action only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use the bonus action, your speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Cunning Strike
entries: You have developed cunning ways to use your sneak attack. When you deal Sneak Attack damage, You can add one of the following Cunning strike effects. Each effect has a die cost, Which is the number of sneak attack damage dice you must forego to add the effect. You remove the die before rolling, and the effect occurs immediately after the attack's damage is dealt. For example, if you add the poison attack, remomve 1d6 from the Sneak Attack's damage before rolling.
If a Cunning Strike effect requires a saving throw, the DC is calculated as follows

classFeature.name: Disarm (Cost: 1d6)
entries: The target must succed on a dexterity saving throw, or it drops one item of your choice that it's holding.

classFeature.name: Poison (Cost: 1d6)
entries: You add a toxin to your strike, forcing the target to make a constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the {@condition poisoned} condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the poisoned target can repeat its save, ending the effect on a success. To use this effect, you must have a poisoner's kit on your person.

classFeature.name: Trip (Cost: 1d6)
entries: If the target is large or smaller, it must succeed on a dexterity saving throw or have the {@condition prone} condition.

classFeature.name: Withdraw (Cost: 1d6)
entries: Immediately after the attack, you move up to half your speed without provoking Oppurtunity Attacks.

classFeature.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Starting at 5th level, when an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

classFeature.name: Expertise
entries: At 6th level, you can choose two more of your proficiencies (in skills or with {@item thieves' tools|phb}) to gain the benefit of Expertise.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a red dragon's fiery breath or an {@spell ice storm} spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

classFeature.name: Reliable Talent
entries: By 7th level, you have refined your chosen skills until they approach perfection. Whenever you make an ability check that lets you add your proficiency bonus, you can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Roguish Archetype feature
entries: At 9th level, you gain a feature granted by your Roguish Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 10th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Improved Cunning Strike
entries: When you reach 11th level, You can use up to two cunning strike effects when you deal Sneak Attack damage, paying the die cost for each effect.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Roguish Archetype feature
entries: At 13th level, you gain a feature granted by your Roguish Archetype.

classFeature.name: Blindsense
entries: Starting at 14th level, if you are able to hear, you are aware of the location of any hidden or {@condition invisible} creature within 10 feet of you.

classFeature.name: Devious Strikes
entries: You have practiced new ways to use your sneak attack deviously. The following effects are now among your Cunning Strike options.

classFeature.name: Daze (Cost: 2d6)
entries: The target must succed on a constitution saving throw, or it is dazed. Until the end of its next turn, it can move or take one Action on its turn, not both. You also can't take a Bonus Action or a Reaction.

classFeature.name: Knock Out (Cost: 6d6)
entries: The target must succed on a constitution saving throw, or it has the {@condition unconscious} condition for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. The unconscious target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

classFeature.name: Obscure (Cost: 2d6)
entries: The target must succed on a dexterity saving throw, or it has the {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

classFeature.name: Slippery Mind
entries: By 15th level, you have acquired greater mental strength. You gain proficiency in Wisdom and Charisma saving throws.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Roguish Archetype feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature granted by your Roguish Archetype.

classFeature.name: Elusive
entries: Beginning at 18th level, you are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Stroke of Luck
entries: At 20th level, you have an uncanny knack for succeeding when you need to. If you fail an ability check, attack roll or saving throw, you can turn that roll into a 20. You can use this feature after the roll has been made, but before the rolls effects take place.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Martial Arts
entries: Your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use unarmed strikes and monk weapons, which are {@item shortsword|tct|shortswords} and any {@filter simple melee weapons that don't have the two-handed or heavy property|items|source=tct|category=basic|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=u~u~sand|property=!heavy;!two-handed}.
You gain the following benefits while you are unarmed or wielding only monk weapons and you aren't wearing armor or wielding a {@item shield|phb}.

items: You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes and monk weapons. In addition, when you choose the Grapple or Shove option, you can use your Dexterity modifier instead of Strength to determine the saving throw DC.
You can roll a {@dice d4} in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike or monk weapon. This die changes as you gain monk levels, as shown in the Martial Arts column of the Monk table.
You can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action.

entries: Certain monasteries use specialized forms of the monk weapons. For example, you might use a club that is two lengths of wood connected by a short chain (called a nunchaku) or a sickle with a shorter, straighter blade (called a kama).

classFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: Beginning at 1st level, while you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

classFeature.name: Dedicated Weapon
entries: {@i 2nd-level monk {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}

You train yourself to use a variety of weapons as monk weapons, not just simple melee weapons and shortswords. Whenever you finish a short or long rest, you can touch one weapon, focus your ki on it, and then count that weapon as a monk weapon until you use this feature again.
The chosen weapon must meet these criteria:

items: The weapon must be a {@filter simple or martial weapon|items|source=tct|category=basic|type=martial weapon;simple weapon|property=!heavy;!special}.
You must be proficient with it.
It must lack the heavy and special properties.

classFeature.name: Flurry of Blows
entries: You can spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Ki
entries: Starting at 2nd level, your training allows you to harness the mystic energy of ki. Your access to this energy is represented by a number of ki points. You possess an amount of ki points as shown in the Ki Points column of the Monk table.

You can spend these points to fuel various ki features. You start knowing three such features: Flurry of Blows, Patient Defense, and Step of the Wind. You learn more ki features as you gain levels in this class.

When you spend a ki point, it is unavailable until you finish a short or long rest, at the end of which you draw all of your expended ki back into yourself. You must spend at least 30 minutes of the rest meditating to regain your ki points.
Some of your ki features require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

classFeature.name: Patient Defense
entries: You can spend 1 ki point to take the {@action Dodge} action as a bonus action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Step of the Wind
entries: You can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action. Alternatively, you can spend one ki point to take both the {@action Dash} and {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

classFeature.name: Unarmored Movement
entries: Starting at 2nd level, your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield. This bonus increases when you reach certain monk levels, as shown in the Monk table.
At 9th level, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

classFeature.name: Deflect Attacks
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your reaction to deflect melee or ranged attacks against you that deal Bludgeoning, Slashing and Piercing damage. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10} + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level.

If you reduce the damage to 0, you can spend 1 ki point to redirect some of the attacks force. If you do so, choose a creature within 5 feet of you if the attack was a melee attack, or 60 feet of yourself that isn't behind total cover if the attack was a ranged attack. That creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take damage equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die plus your Dexterity modifier. The damage is the same type dealt by the attack.

classFeature.name: Monastic Tradition
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you commit yourself to a monastic tradition, chosen from the list of available traditions. Your tradition grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 11th, and 17th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Slow Fall
entries: Beginning at 4th level, you can use your reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your monk level.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Focused Aim
entries: {@i 5th-level monk {@variantrule optional class features|tce|optional feature}}
When you miss with an attack roll, you can spend 1 to 3 ki points to increase your attack roll by 2 for each of these ki points you spend, potentially turning the miss into a hit.

classFeature.name: Stunning Strike
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can interfere with the flow of ki in an opponent's body.

Once per turn when you hit another creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 ki point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn and takes {@dice 2d6} force damage. On a successful save the target takes half damage and suffers no other effects. You can further bolster this strike by spending additional ki-points (upto a maximum of 3). The force damage increases by {@dice d6} and the target has a penalty on the next constitution save they make equal to the number of additional ki-points spent.

classFeature.name: Ki-Empowered Strikes
entries: Starting at 6th level, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

classFeature.name: Monastic Tradition feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain one feature granted by your Monastic Tradition.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: At 7th level, your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a blue dragon's lightning breath or a {@spell fireball} spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

classFeature.name: Stillness of Mind
entries: Starting at 7th level, at the start of your turn, you can choose to end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. When you do, you are unable to use your action though you may still use other actions like bonus actions and movement.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Channel Ki
entries: At 8th level, as an action, you can enter a state of deep meditation until the start of your next turn. during this state, your movement speed is set to 0. however, attacks against you are made with advantage, and you must make concentration saves for any damage you take during this state in order to maintain the meditation.

If your concentration is not broken until the start of your next turn, you regain all your expended ki points. You also gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your monk level plus half the damage you took in this state (rounded down). Once you regain ki points using this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Unarmored Movement improvement
entries: At 9th level, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

classFeature.name: Purity of Body
entries: At 10th level, your mastery of the ki flowing through you makes you immune to disease and poison.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 10th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Monastic Tradition feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain one feature granted by your Monastic Tradition.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Tongue of the Sun and Moon
entries: Starting at 13th level, you learn to touch the ki of other minds so that you understand all spoken languages. Moreover, any creature that can understand a language can understand what you say.

classFeature.name: Ki-fueled Body
entries: At 13th level, you have mastered the ability to move ki throughout your body, focusing it to improve your body. As a bonus action, you can spend 4 ki points to increase an ability score of your choice by 2 (Upto a maximum of 22) for 10 minutes. While that ability score is boosted in this way, you gain a bonus to ability checks and saving throws that use this ability score equal to your wisdom modifier. You can only benefit from one instance of this feature at a time.
At 20th level, you can increase Wisdom and Dexterity Upto a maximum of 26.

classFeature.name: Diamond Soul
entries: Beginning at 14th level, your mastery of ki grants you proficiency in all saving throws.
Additionally, whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can spend 1 ki point to reroll it and take the second result.

classFeature.name: Timeless Body
entries: At 15th level, your ki sustains you so that you suffer none of the frailty of old age, and you can't be aged magically. You can still die of old age, however. In addition, you no longer need food or water.
Additionally, whenever you finish a short rest, you may reduce any exhaustion remaining by 1 level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Monastic Tradition feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain one feature granted by your Monastic Tradition.

classFeature.name: Empty Body
entries: Beginning at 18th level, you can use your action to spend 4 ki points to become {@condition invisible} for 1 minute. During that time, you also have resistance to all damage but force damage.
Additionally, you can spend 8 ki points to cast the {@spell astral projection} spell, without needing material components. When you do so, you can't take any other creatures with you.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. However, if you are atleast 19th level, that maximum increases to 22.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Perfect Self
entries: You have honed your body and mind to new heights. Your Dexterity and Wisdom scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 26.

classFeature.name: Memorize Spell
entries: Studying your spellbook for 1 minute,you can exend mental and magical effort to memorize a spell. Choose one spell of level 1 or higher from your spellbook that you don't have prepared. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest, and you forget the spell you memorized whenever you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Mysticshift Duelist
entries: Originating from the elite Cassius recon groups, Mysticshift Duelists blend emerging scientific insights and a deepening arcane understanding, born from a world where the weave of magic is unraveling. These pioneers of martial and mystical arts integrated newfound arcane knowledge into their combat techniques, crafting a refined martial art that harmonizes elemental forces with physical prowess. Over the years, their practices spread beyond Cassius, evolving into a distinguished discipline. Today, Mysticshift Duelists are renowned warriors who embody the art of transformation, leveraging elemental stances to dynamically adapt in combat. Their path demands a profound comprehension of both the elements and one's inner self, attracting those intrigued by the challenge of mastering such versatile and potent powers.

subclassFeature.name: Arms of the Mysticshift
entries: {@i 3rd-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}

Upon embarking on the path of the Mysticshift Duelist, you commit to mastering the art of combat through both traditional weaponry and the precise application of firearms. This unique synthesis of martial disciplines forms the foundation of your journey, preparing you for the eventual creation of your signature weapon—the Elemental Gunblade.

At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with one {@filter melee weapon|items|category=basic|type=melee weapon} and one {@filter firearm|items|category=basic|type=firearm;modern;renaissance} of your choice. These weapons become the focal point of your training, each representing one half of the duality you seek to master. Through rigorous practice, you learn to channel elemental energies into every strike and shot, laying the groundwork for the fusion of these disciplines.

Your dedication to mastering both the blade and the bullet grants you unique combat advantages. When wielding your chosen melee weapon or firearm, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and the attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcomming resistance.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Stance Initiation
entries: {@i 3rd-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}

Starting at 3rd level, you gain the ability to adopt elemental stances, each offering unique enhancements to your attacks. When you make a weapon attack, you may choose one of your stances to activate it, adding the effects from the stance if it hits. Repeated attacks made with the same stance grants additional effects stacking based on the number of successful attacks made. Switching stances resets the stacks to 0.
The saving throw DC for stance effects is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (whichever is higher).
Select two stances initially, you may choose an additional stance when you reach the 7th, 10th and 15th level in this class.

entries.caption: Stances
rows: Attacks ignite targets, dealing {@dice 1d8} ongoing fire damage for 1 turn.
Create a blaze around the target, dealing {@dice 2d8} fire damage to enemies within 10 feet.
Unleash a fiery explosion on hit, dealing {@dice 4d8} fire damage to all enemies within 30 feet. Requires a Dexterity saving throw.
Gain +1 AC and deal {@dice 1d4} cold damage to melee attackers.
Attacks slow the target, reducing their speed by 10 feet until your next turn.
Freeze the ground, making it difficult terrain in a 15-foot radius around the target.
Encase targets in ice on hit, {@condition stunned} for 1 turn. Requires a Constitution saving throw.
Increase movement speed by 10 feet and add {@dice 1d4} lightning damage to attacks.
Gain advantage on all Dexterity saving throws and skill checks.
Create a tempest on hit, dealing {@dice 2d8} lightning damage to the target and up to two additional enemies within 20 feet.
Gain +2 to all saving throws and resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
Attacks fortify you, granting temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Constitution modifier.
Attacks can cause the earth to grasp enemies, reducing their speed to 0 until the end of their next turn.
Trigger a localized earthquake, knocking enemies within 20 feet prone. Requires a Strength saving throw.
Attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage, healing you for half the amount dealt.
Diminish enemy strength, reducing their damage output by {@dice 1d4} for 1 turn.
Silence enemies hit, preventing them from casting spells for 1 turn. Requires a Wisdom saving throw.
Consume life force, dealing {@dice 3d6} necrotic damage and gaining temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. Affects all enemies within 15 feet.
Add {@dice 1d6} radiant damage to attacks and dispel magical darkness in a 10-foot radius.
Illuminate targets, granting advantage on attacks against them and dealing {@dice 1d6} additional radiant damage.
Enemies hit are {@condition blinded} for 1 turn. Requires a Constitution saving throw.
A radiant burst expands from you, blinding all enemies within 20 feet and dealing {@dice 3d8} radiant damage. Requires a Constitution saving throw.
Attacks extend your reach by 5 feet and add {@dice 1d4} force damage.
Generate an updraft with each hit, granting you the ability to ignore difficult terrain.
Gain a flying speed of 30 feet for 1 turn.
Create a vortex on hit, pulling up to three enemies within 30 feet towards the target. Requires a Strength saving throw.
Attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} poison damage and slow enemies by 10 feet.
Entangle enemies hit, reducing their speed to 0 until they succeed on a Strength saving throw.
Vines grapple the target, {@condition restraining} them for 1 turn. Requires a Strength saving throw.
A massive vine burst restrains all enemies within 20 feet, dealing {@dice 3d6} poison damage. Requires a Strength saving throw.

entries: Upon reaching 6 successful attacks in the same stance, unleash the specified effect. Stacks reset to 1 thereafter.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of Blade and Bullet
entries: {@i 7rd-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}

At 7th level, you gain the ability to combine your chosen melee weapon and firearm into a singular, powerful weapon: the Elemental Gunblade. This fusion requires a ritual that spans a day and a night, during which you must channel elemental energies into the weapons, binding them with your own spirit. The resulting Elemental Gunblade is a masterwork of craftsmanship and arcane power, unique to you and unusable by anyone else.

Upon completing the ritual, you gain proficiency with your Elemental Gunblade, which retains the properties of both the original melee weapon and firearm. The elemental gunblade also counts as one of your chosen weapons and benefits from the +1 bonus to attack rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Reverb
entries: At 7th level, you gain the ability to instantly channel the full force of an Elemental Stance through your Gunblade. Once per short rest, as part of an attack, you can apply one of your known stance's max stack effect on your target.

Additionally, when you switch stances from max stacks, the energy release emits a 15-foot radius elemental shockwave, dealing {@dice 2d8} force damage and pushing creatures of your choice back 5 feet on a failed Dexterity save.

subclassFeature.name: Stance Weaving
entries: {@i 7rd-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}
By 7th level, you have mastered the ability to shift between your known elemental stances in such rapid fluidity that they have begun to weave more effectively.

As a bonus action on your turn, you enter a perfect weave state for 1 minute. If you have a stance active, you gain 5 stacks in it immediately. While in this state, when you switch to a new stance the effects from the previous one linger until the next switch. You must also switch stances every turn to keep perfect weave active. You lose perfect weave at the end of your turn if you have not switched stances atleast once.
You may enter this state as many times as your proficiency bonus and uses recharge on a short rest

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Resilience
entries: {@i 10th-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}
Your mastery over the elemental forces not only empowers your attacks but also fortifies your resolve and vitality. This mastery manifests in two key ways:

items: Defensive Harmony: You gain a bonus to all saving throws equal to half the number of stacks (rounded down) you have in any stance. This bonus reflects your heightened elemental awareness, enhancing your ability to evade or withstand harmful effects.

Elemental Transference: When you switch stances, the accumulated elemental energy rejuvenates you, healing you for an amount equal to the number of stacks in the previous stance before the switch. This healing represents the restorative power of the elements flowing through you, a reward for your strategic mastery over the elemental stances.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Gunblade Ascendance
entries: {@i 15th-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}
Your mastery of the elemental stances allows you to unleash a devastating Ascendant Attack, channeling the full might of your chosen element through your Elemental Gunblade.

Upon reaching the maximum stacks in an elemental stance twice in a row, you gain the ability to perform an Ascendant Attack associated with that stance for the next one minute. You may use this special ascendant attack in place of one of your extra attacks. These powerful attacks can be used once per long rest for each stance.
The Ascendant Attacks are as follows:

items: Inferno Vortex (Blaze Reprisal Stance): Create a 30-foot radius vortex of fire at a point you can see within 120 feet. Creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 6d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The area becomes difficult terrain, and creatures that fail the save are also {@condition blinded} by the intense flames for 1 minute. An affected creature at the end of each of its turns may repeat the saving throw to try and end the blindness.

Frost Sigil (Glacial Guard): Summon a sigil on the ground within a 60-foot radius. Creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@dice 4d6} cold damage on a failed save and becoming {@condition slowed} for 1 minute on a failed save. The ground becomes difficult terrain. An affected creature at the end of each of its turns may repeat the saving throw to try and end the slowness.

Lightning Tempest (Tempest Fury): Target up to three creatures you can see within 150 feet. Each must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 5d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Affected creatures are also {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.

Earthshaker Pulse (Stone Bulwark): Cause an earthquake in a 50-foot radius around you. Enemies must make a Strength saving throw or be {@condition knocked prone} and take {@dice 4d6} bludgeoning damage. The affected area becomes difficult terrain.

Abyssal Drain (Void Embrace): Release a 20-foot radius wave of dark energy. Enemies within range must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@dice 5d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You gain temporary hit points equal to the highest damage dealt to one target.

Radiant Dawn (Solar Flare): Emit a 60-foot radius burst of radiant light. Enemies within the burst must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute and take {@dice 5d6} radiant damage. Allies in the area gain temporary hit points equal to your fighter level. An affected creature at the end of each of its turns may repeat the saving throw to try and end the blindness.

Galeforce Dash (Aether Wind): Transform into a gust of wind, moving up to 100 feet in a line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 4d6} force damage on a failed save, and is {@condition pushed} 15 feet to the side of the line on a failed save.

Verdant Cataclysm (Nature's Bind): Cause a 40-foot radius of thorny vines to erupt. Creatures in the area must make a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} and take {@dice 4d6} piercing damage at the start of each of their turns. On a success, the creature is no longer restrained and moves to the nearest unoccupied space outside the vines. The area becomes difficult terrain.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Resonance
entries: At 18th level, select an elemental stance at dawn; its base effect is always on. When you hit max stacks on your selected stance, you can activate Elemental Resonance for 1 minute, maximizing your chosen stance's effects without needing stacks on each attack. This power surge ends if you're incapacitated or prone.
Once Elemental resonance ends, you may use it again after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Four Elements
entries: You follow a monastic tradition that teaches you to harness the elements. When you focus your ki, you can align yourself with the forces of creation and bend the four elements to your will, using them as an extension of your body. Some members of this tradition dedicate themselves to a single element, but others weave the elements together.
Many monks of this tradition tattoo their bodies with representations of their ki powers, commonly imagined as coiling dragons, but also as phoenixes, fish, plants, mountains, and cresting waves.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Attunement
entries: You have acquired a basic grasp of the elements, familiar enough that you may easily manipulate them to some minor extent. Depending on the path you have chosen you receive its corresponding attunement feature. As a wayfarer you may choose two of the following instead:

items: {@b Water:} You learn {@language primordial||Aquan} and are able to recreate the effects of {@spell shape water|XGE}. You may also produce or carry a gallon of water in the form of a globule that you may freely manipulate with your attunement while it remains in your space. Any water you produce disappears after a minute has passed or in 6 seconds if in arid climates like deserts or tundras.

{@b Earth:} You learn {@language primordial||Terran} and are able to recreate the effects of {@spell mold earth|XGE} and may instead have as many non-instantaneous effects active at a time as your proficiency bonus. Soil, stone and sand weigh a fourth of what it naturally would for you
{@b Fire:} You learn {@language primordial||Ignan} and are able to to recreate the effects of {@spell produce flame} and {@spell control flames|XGE} as actions or bonus actions.
{@b Air:} You learn {@language primordial||Auran} and are able to to recreate the effects of {@spell gust|XGE}, {@spell air trick|tct} and {@spell air bubble|AAG}(only on self)

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Novice
entries: You learn magical disciplines that harness the power of the four elements, some may require you to spend ki points when you use them. When you get this feature, choose a path for your elemental tutelage. You may choose among {@b Water}, {@b Earth}, {@b Fire} or {@b Air}. Each path grants benefits towards their corresponding disciplines. You may also choose neither of them and follow the path of the {@b Wayfarer}, which allows for more freedom in your choice of disciplines.

As a disciple of a particular path, you learn the discipline of its Elemental Attack and one other from any path. As a wayfarer, you may pick any two disciplines from any path of your choice. You will learn more as well as have more of them become available at the 6th 11th and 17th level.
Whenever you learn a new discipline you may also replace one that you haven’t received freely from a path with another.

entries.name: Elemental Attacks
entries: Among the disciplines you may learn are {@i Elemental Attacks} which are a new attack option that you can use with the {@action Attack} action. You are proficient with it, and you add your Dexterity modifier to its attack and damage rolls. Its damage die is a {@dice d6}. This die changes as you gain monk levels, as shown in the Martial Arts column of the Monk table.

When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn and use this special attack as part of it, you can spend 1 ki point to empower it, applying some extra effect depending on the attack. When you gain the Extra Attack feature, this special attack can replace any attacks you make of the Attack action. For each attack replaced you may also empower each of them with a ki point.

entries.name: Casting Elemental Spells
entries: Some elemental disicplines take the form of spells that you cast and if done as an action, count as an {@action Attack} for the purpose of bonus action attacks. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the Player's Handbook for the general rules of spellcasting. When {@i casting} one of these spells, you use its casting time and other rules, but you don't need to provide material components for it.
As a follower of a path you may use any of its corresponding disciplines without spending its ki cost once per long rest including one ki-empowered elemental attack (1 ki point).

As a wayfarer, you gain a special pool of wayfarer ki that may only be used on elemental disciplines. The amount you possess equals half your monk level rounded up as shown in the Four Elements Monk table.
{@b Elemental Attack: Water Whip}
You wield a watery whip as a bludgeoning simple melee weapon with 10 foot reach.
{@b Empowered:}

A creature you can see within 30 feet must instead make a Dexterity saving throw. If it fails, it takes bludgeoning damage equal to your damage roll and you can either knock it {@condition prone} or pull it up to 10 feet closer to you, otherwise just taking half the damage.
{@b Elemental Attack: Earthen Spear}
You raise an earthen pillar within 10 feet of you as a bludgeoning melee weapon attack
{@b Empowered:}

A creature within 30ft must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, it takes bludgeoning damage equal to your damage roll and is either knocked {@condition prone} or moved 10 feet in any direction. Otherwise, it will only take half damage on a success.
{@b Elemental Attack: Leaping Devil}
Your attacks extended a plume of fire. It works as a ranged attack (10/30), dealing fire damage.
{@b Empowered:}

Choose a creature within 30 feet and another within 15 feet of it, both of which you can see. Both must make Dexterity saving throws as you lob a bouncing firebolt, each either taking a damage roll's worth of fire damage on a failure or half on a success.
{@b Elemental Attack: Unbroken Air}
You fling a bolus of air as a ranged attack (10/30), dealing bludgeoning damage.
{@b Empowered:}

A creature within 30ft must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, it takes bludgeoning damage equal to your damage roll and is either knocked {@condition prone} or pushed 10 feet away. Otherwise, it will only take half damage on a success.
{@b Ice-Bound Shimmer}
You spend 2 ki to cast {@spell armor of agathys}.
{@b Gift of the Golem}
You spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell weapon of the earth|agi}
{@b Sweeping Cinder Strike}
You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell burning hands}.
{@b Rush of the Gale Spirits}
You can spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell fog cloud}.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Journeyman
entries: The following disciplines become available for learning. Followers of a path can choose a discipline belonging to their path and another from any path. Wayfarers can choose 2 disciplines from any path.
{@b Soft Snow Soft Hail}
You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell tidal wave|XGE}.
{@b Dead Man's Regret}
You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell maximilian's earthen grasp|XGE}.
{@b Sky of the Harvest Festival}
You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell pyrotechnics|XGE}.
{@b Hide of the Feathered Serpent}
You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell wind wall}.
{@b Blood Curdled}
You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell hold person}.
{@b Birth of the Geyser}
You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell erupting earth|XGE}.
{@b Flames of the Phoenix}
You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell fireball}.
{@b Gong of the Summit}
You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell shatter}.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Empowerment
entries: You can spend additional ki points to increase the level of an elemental discipline spell that you cast, provided that the spell has an enhanced effect at a higher level. The spell's level increases by 1 for each additional ki point you spend.
You may also empower {@i Elemental Attacks} by spending additional ki, increase the damage by a martial arts die roll for each additional ki point.

The maximum number of ki points you can spend to cast a spell in this way (including its base ki point cost and any additional ki points you spend to increase its level) is determined by your monk level, as shown in the Spells and Ki Points table below.

entries.caption: Spells and Ki Points
colLabels: Maximum Ki Points for a Spell

subclassFeature.name: Improved Attunement
entries: Your familiarity with the basics of element manipulation has given you a benefit depending on your chosen path:-

entries.caption: Improved Attunement Features
rows: You become resistant to cold damage.
You become resistant to non-magical physical damage.
You become resistant to fire damage.
You become resistant to thunder damage.
You can walk on water and gain a swimming speed equal to your movement speed.
You may move freely over surfaces or difficult terrain made of soil, sand or stone in any direction while keeping your hands free.
You are immune to any fire damage caused by a discipline or attunement you produced.
You may use a bonus action to gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed for 10 minutes once per long rest. You may use it again before by spending 3 ki points.
You gain blindsight upto 60 feet for objects and creatures in the same body of water as you.
You may originate your {@i Fangs of the Fire Snake} from any source of fire you can see within 60 feet
While you aren't incapacitated, you can choose to fall as though affected by the {@spell feather fall} spell.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Expert
entries: The following disciplines become available for learning. Followers of a path can choose a discipline belonging to their path and another from any path. Wayfarers can choose 2 disciplines from any path.
{@b Shepherd the Water}
You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell control water}.
{@b Dwarven Touch}
You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell stone shape}.
{@b Hide of the Vermillion Serpent}
You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell wall of fire}.
{@b Flight of the Phoenix}
You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell haste} targeting only you.
{@b Churning of the Lake}
You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell maelstrom|XGE}.
{@b Exploding Mole Technique}
You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell earthburst|tct}.
{@b Panoply of the Sun}
You can spend 3 ki points to cast {@spell fire shield}.
{@b Egg of the Thunderbird}
You can spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell coulette's concussor|tct}.

entries.subclassFeature: Grip of the Unwavering Mind|Monk|DRK|Four Elements|tct|11

subclassFeature.name: Grip of the Unwavering Mind
entries: When forced to make Concentration saving throws on disciplines you've cast, you may make a Wisdom saving throw instead of Constitution. You also have advantage on checks made against being {@spell counterspell||counterspelled}.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of the Path
entries: You gain the ability to cloak yourself with the element of your path. You gain the ability to cast for 4 ki points, one of {@spell investiture of ice|XGE}, {@spell investiture of stone|XGE}, {@spell investiture of flame|XGE} or {@spell investiture of wind|XGE} depending on the path you've chosen.
After you use the action granted by these spells, You may use your bonus action to repeat the action, make an attack, or use {@i Flurry of Blows}

Wayfarers gain an additional way to learn a discipline. In addition to the disciplines already learnt, they receive a special disipline slot which may be used to learn a discpline right away. However, after every long rest, they may choose to meditate on this learning and change the discipline in the slot for another available one.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Master
entries: The following disciplines become available for learning. Followers of a path can choose a discipline belonging to their path and another from any path. Wayfarers can choose 2 disciplines from any path.
{@b Hide of the Sea Serpent}
You can spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell wall of ice}.
{@b Hide of the Serpent Beneath}
You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell wall of stone}.
{@b Ordeal of Sin}
You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell immolation|tct}.
{@b Decree of the Feathered Serpent}
You can spend 6 ki points to cast {@spell control winds|XGE}.
{@b Wag of the Earthen Catfish}
You can spend 10 ki points to cast {@spell tsunami}.
You may only use this discipline again after a long rest.
{@b Sigh of the World Turtle}
You can spend 10 ki points to cast {@spell earthquake}.,
You may only use this discipline again after a long rest.
{@b Escape of Flaming Monkey}
You can spend 8 ki points to cast {@spell fire storm}.
You may only use this discipline again after a long rest.
{@b Mount of the Storm God}
You can spend 8 ki points to cast {@spell whirlwind|XGE}.
You may only use this discipline again after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Original Pilgrimage
entries: Over the course of your journey you have discovered the the long sought attunement to the source of your power and now your path can take you there. Once per long rest, You may spend 8 Ki points to cast {@spell plane shift} which will only take you to the elemental plane associated with your path.
Wayfarers can choose to go to the Plane of Water, Earth, Fire or Air when they cast the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Way of Awakened Mind
entries: Old Livian tales speak of strangely garbed men who broke upon the shores of Yesvaris on strange boats from a sea that surrounds no land. They bore no blade nor bow, spoke no tongue that one could understand, bearing no message nor gift for any lord, instead they were content to merely wander the earth.

Little was spoken yet some could detect some deep disappointment. They sold their ships and settled into a refuge atop Mt. Songshan. There they would live mostly in isolation, far from the squabbling tribes below for a few centuries.

Only during the invasions of Gulbrodr, the Reaver King did they swear fealty to Seauntrenu the Strange under the agreement that he or anyone else may seek tutelage from the monastery if their devotion was deemed enough.

A few of the acolytes there would learn of a way to seemingly poke and prod their sight through to a second world held within the future. Though some believe it demeaning to utilize such a blessing for combat, rogue schools doing just that would eventually rise, with the original purpose lost to time.
Heretical though it may been to some, it proved to be a very effective method of combat.

subclassFeature.name: Premonition
entries: As a bonus action, you slip into one of two lucid states where you perceive glimpses into the near future:-

entries.name: Vulpine
entries: As part of activating this state and at the start of each of your turns, make a Premonition check (a DC 15 Wisdom check). On a success, roll a Premonition die which is a {@dice 1d20|d20} and keep it with it's result. Whenever a feature calls for spending a Premonition die, you must possess and spend at least one ki point to use it.
Whenever you or a creature you see within 10 feet makes an attack roll or a saving throw you may replace the roll with the Premonition die's roll, spending it.

Any Premonition die gained, lasts only till the start of your next turn, unless you spend a ki point then. If you do, you forgo making the Premonition check for that turn and keep the Premonition die from the previous turn.
This state lasts for a minute, after which any Premonition die possessed are discarded.

entries.name: Cervine
entries: For this turn and for the next 10 minutes, you gain advantage on all ability checks.
Once you enter any of these states, you must take a long rest to regain use of it.

entries.name: Roll20 Macro
entries: A nifty macro for Premonition checks in Roll20. In your Roll20 character sheet look for the 'Attributes & Abilities' tab. Then create an ability called something like 'Premonition check' and in the larger text field paste this bit of code:-
&{template:default}{{name=Premonition Check}}{{ [[ {1d20+@{< Character name >|wisdom_mod}}>[[15]] ]] }}
Then replace '< Character name >' with the case sensitive name on the sheet (remove the < & >). click the tick mark, then check 'Show in Macro Bar'.

subclassFeature.name: Pass the Time
entries: As part of your rigorous training, you would learn to pick up many games of luck or skill. In each bout, acolytes would attempt to utilize their unnatural foresight against each other in what was essentially a contest to peer further into the future than their opponent.
Choose a {@item Gaming Set}. You become proficient with it and any checks made with Gaming Sets are made with advanatage.

subclassFeature.name: Peel back the Veil
entries: You achieve the first step towards understanding the nature of this world, utilizing your learnings as abilities.
At 6th level, you may spend two ki points to cast {@spell Augury}, {@spell Locate Object}, {@spell Find Traps} or {@spell Fortune's Favor|EGW} (without the spells material components).
Additionally, When you have no uses of Premonition, you can use a number of ki points equal to your proficiency bonus at the end of a short rest to regain use of it.

subclassFeature.name: Living ahead of the moment
entries: You have spent such time peering across the temporal realm that you have mastered it's interference with your reality. At the 11th level, you gain the following benefits:-

items: When you make a Premonition check or when rolling for your Premonition die, you may use a bonus action and ki point to reroll the {@dice 1d20|d20}.
You may now attempt to replace the rolls of creatures you can see within 20 feet of you, instead of 10 feet.

When you roll a 20 on your Premonition die, you may immediately spend it. You then get advantage on all attacks and saving throws as well as disadvantage on every attack made against you until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: A Body one with the Future
entries: At the 17th level, The barriers to the temporal realm now remain a mere curtain for your mind and can even twist the threads of fate to some extent. You gain the following features

subclassFeature.name: Predictive Impulse
entries: Whenever you use the attack action you may spend a Premonition die to make an additional attack using the result on it as the roll. Additionally, when you dodge an attack using a Premonition die, the next attack made against you is made with disadvantage till the state ends.

subclassFeature.name: Forge Fate
entries: Once per long rest, when you roll your Premonition die, you may instead choose a number from 5-15 and keep the Premonition die with that number.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Battlerager
entries: Known as Kuldjargh (literally "axe idiot") in Dwarvish, battleragers are dwarf followers of the gods of war and take the Path of the Battlerager. They specialize in wearing bulky, {@item spiked armor|scag} and throwing themselves into combat, striking with their body itself and giving themselves over to the fury of battle.

subclassFeature.name: Battlerager Armour
entries: When you choose this path at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with heavy armour and it counts as medium armour while you wear it for barbarian features. You also gain the ability to use spiked armour as a weapon.

While you are wearing spiked armour and are raging, you can use a bonus action to make one melee weapon attack with your armour spikes at a target within 5 feet of you. If the attack hits, the spikes deal {@damage 1d4} piercing damage, increasing to {@damage 2d4} at level 10 and {@damage 3d4} at level 17. You use your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

Additionally, when you use the {@action Attack} action to grapple a creature, the target takes piercing damage equal to your proficiency bonus if your grapple check succeeds. It takes this damage again if the creature is still grappled at the start of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Armour Maintainance
entries: You gain proficiency with you choice of {@item smith's tools|phb} or {@item leatherworker's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient in both, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

You may convert any armour you come across into a spiked variant of that armour by spending a long rest and 20 gp worth of materials doing so. If using magical armour, attacks using it count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunities.

subclassFeature.name: Reckless Abandon
entries: Beginning at 10th level, when you use Reckless Attack while raging, you are able to reduce some damage you take before the start of your next turn. Once per round, when taking damage, you may reduce it by an amount equal to your Constitituion modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Battlerager Charge
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action while you are raging. As part of the same action, you may make an attack with your spiked armour or attempt to grapple a creature.

If you moved at least 15 feet before making this attack, you can add your proficiency bonus to the damage. Or if you choose to grapple after making the movement, you deal twice your proficiency bonus as piercing damage to the target.

subclassFeature.name: Storm of Thorn
entries: Starting at 14th level, when a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, the attacker takes damage equal to your proficiency bonus if you are raging, aren't {@condition incapacitated}, and are wearing {@item spiked armor|scag}.

Additionally, when you move within 5 feet of a creature while raging in spiked armour, you may choose to deal piercing damage to it equal to your proficiency bonus. A creature can take this damage only once during a turn.

subclassFeature.name: Student of War
entries: When you take this Intellectual Pursuit at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in {@skill History}, and add double your proficiency bonus checks with it. If you are already proficient in {@skill History} you gain proficiency in another skill from the Prodigy skill list.

You also gain proficiency with all medium armour, shields, and all martial weapons without the heavy property. When you wear light or medium armour, you can use Intelligence, in place of Dexterity, when calculating your Armour Class.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Commander
entries: Staring at 3rd level, you can use an action to issue one of the Orders below, targeting a creature within 60 feet, other than yourself, that can see or hear you. A single creature can only benefit from one Order at a time.
When you issue an Order, you can spend a Mental Die to grant the target temporary hit points equal to your Die roll.

items.name: Attack Order
entries: The next time the target of this Order takes the Attack action before the start of your next turn, it can make one additional weapon attack as part of that action.

items.name: Defensive Order
entries: Until the beginning of your next turn, the target of this Order gains a bonus to its AC equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1 AC).

items.name: Maneuvering Order
entries: The target of this Order can use its reaction to immediately move up to its full movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

items.name: Steadfast Order
entries: Until the beginning of your next turn, the target of this Order gains a bonus to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution ability checks and saving throws they make equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1)

subclassFeature.name: Unwavering Resolve
entries: Starting at 6th level, you have advantage on saving throws to resist the effects of enchantment spells, and you are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition.
In addition, when you use your action to issue an Order, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Strategic Genius
entries: Starting at 13th level, when you use your action to issue an Order, you can issue the same Order to another creature within range.

subclassFeature.name: Master Tactician
entries: Beginning at 17th level, when you spend a Mental Die to grant the target of an Order temporary hit points, you add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) to the temporary hit points.
Also, when you use your action to issue an Order, you can target up to three creatures in range with the same Order.

subclassFeature.name: The Vengeful
entries: You have offered service to a vengeful being driven by hatred or the collective spirits of the damned who still bear grudges that need be satisfied. A patron of this kind might be a powerful being living in eternal agony due to another, one who through a betrayal most foul seeks the most terrible demise for their enemy or even a being who caters to the lost souls who still hold truck with those in the world of the living.

Those who join them in pact are usually seeking revenge themselves or seek to placate them, lest their ire befall upon someone else. Beneficiaries of their power unleash their wrath as strong curses that chase their foes till their graves.

subclassFeature.name: Harbinger
entries: You act as emissary for your patron's vengeance. You gain proficiency in {@skill Intimidation} checks. You also learn the {@spell hex} spell, always have it prepared and can cast it once per short rest at your highest warlock spell slot level without expending it. It doesn't count towards your spells known and acts as a curse for you if you cast it with the free or with a warlock spell slot.
When you cast a curse, You gain {@dice 1d10} + your Charisma Modifier Temporary Hitpoints.

subclassFeature.name: Vengeful Pact Spells
entries: The Hateful Spirits let you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Bestow Curse
entries: You learn the {@spell bestow curse}, always have it prepared and can cast it once per short rest at your highest warlock spell slot level without expending it. It doesn't count towards your spells known and acts as a curse for you.
You can now cast it at a target you can see within 30 feet and if the target succeeds on the initial wisdom save from this spell, the slot is not lost.

subclassFeature.name: Spiteful Infliction
entries: When you cast a curse you can employ of a number of ways to alter this spell to further enhance the target's suffering. They are listed below and you use them when you cast the spell, replacing the malus to ability checks:-

entries.name: Curse of Enfeeblement
entries: {@b Flesh made weak}. When the target rolls for damage from a weapon attack, it must roll {@damage 2d4} and subtract it from the damage.

entries.name: Curse of Pain
entries: {@b Body wrought with agony}. You upgrade the die class of the bonus necrotic damage involved in the curse ({@damage 1d6}->{@damage 1d8}->{@damage 1d10}->{@damage 1d12}). At level 14, you upgrade it by 2 die classes.

entries.name: Curse of Misfortune
entries: {@b Fate takes a turn}. Whenever an attack roll is made against the target, you can use a reaction to reroll the attack.

entries.name: Curse of Deprivation
entries: {@b Oblivion overcomes}. The target must make a Constitution Saving Throw at the start of each of its turns. If it fails, It is {@condition blinded} until the start of it's next turn. At 10th Level, you rob them of all senses, except truesight.

entries.name: Curse of Drowning (Level:10)
entries: {@b Breath becomes thread}. The target must make a Constitution Saving Throw at the start of each of its turns, gaining a point of exhaustion if it fails and ending the spell if it succeeds. It loses any points of exhaustion gained by the spell if it succeeds. The target is accutely aware of who is causing this effect if they know you.

entries.name: Curse of Death (Level:14)
entries: {@b Cessation}. At the start of the target's turn, it feels a feeling of severe dread. It knows it's fate and who dealt it. While a target is wracked with this curse, you may attempt to cease the target with an action. The target must make a Constitution Saving Throw, taking {@damage 7d10} force damage on a failure or half of it on a success and an additional {@damage 5d10} for each turn you've started since the casting of this curse, upto a maximum total of {@damage 22d10}. If the target takes 90 damage from this curse it is also {@condition stunned} till the end of its turn. You cannot use this curse again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Curse of Pursuit
entries: {@b Apprehension overtakes}. You know the direction of your target while they remain within 10 miles of you. At 10th Level, you know this while they remain on the same plane.
This curse requires no concentration but any other effects produced by the are nullified and cursing another with this while it is already active will end the curse on the previous target.
At 14th Level, you can spend 10 minutes in ritual to end this curse and produce the effects of {@spell scrying}. You treat the target as familiar for this casting.
You know two curses now and learn an additional curse at 10th and 14th levels. Each time you level up in this class you may choose to replace one of them for another you meet the requirements for.

subclassFeature.name: Virulent Curse
entries: Any creature attempting to end the spell with an effect such as {@spell counterspell} or {@spell remove curse} must make an ability check like the one in {@spell dispel magic} regardless of the spell's level.
The bonus necrotic damage produced by the spells bypasses resistances.

subclassFeature.name: Till The Grave
entries: Your wrath and vengeful spirit prevent you from taking your final rest. While a target of your curse remains within 90 feet of you and you are brought to 0 hit points, you do not fall {@condition unconscious} instead taking turns as normal. You still make death saving throws while you have 0 hit points, dying with 3 failures. Upon stabilizing you regain 1 hit point.

entries.name: Curse Improvement:
entries: The curses you place now last until they are dispelled and one instance of bonus necrotic damage from the curses bypasses immunities per turn.

subclassFeature.name: The Archivist
entries: Your patron is a collector, surveyor and keeper of knowledge. As many across the planes have discovered; knowledge is it's own kind of power. Your patron was perhaps once such being seeking such to gain this power or to possess secrets to control or for just the sake of knowing.

Those seeking the Archivist's pact likely seek knowledge themselves or perhaps the arcane trove of power they keep. Patron's may leverage this desire to further collect knowledge and secrets from either the world or their servants, but in some cases, are also known to disperse it.

subclassFeature.name: Broker of Knowledge
entries: The Archivist offers a different form of pact, one driven by your own understanding. Upon drawing this pact at level 1, you gain the following features:-

items: You may instead of using Charisma for any of the features granted by this class and it's invocations, use Intelligence. The ability is decided upon when you recieve this feature and may not be changed later.
You may be proficient in Intelligence Saving Throws instead of Charisma.
When choosing and learning cantrips you now gain access to the {@filter wizard's spell list|spells|class=wizard|level=0}.

You gain proficiency in either a language, a skill, a tool or a weapon of your choice. At the end of a long rest, you may replace any proficiency from this with another. At level 10, you may choose two such proficiencies after a long rest.

Coose a spell from the {@filter wizard's spell list|spells|class=wizard} of a level no higher than your highest warlock spell slot. Your patron bestows it knowledge upon you and it counts as a warlock spell but doesn't count towards your spells known.

subclassFeature.name: Archivist Pact Spells
entries: The Archivist lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Quick Recovery
entries: Your patron grants you knowledge in the face of danger. When you make an ability check or a saving throw, you can use your reaction to add your Spellcasting modifier to the roll.
