You can use this feature once before needing a short rest to regain it's use.

subclassFeature.name: Guarded Collection
entries: You and the secrets you carry have become far too valuable to your patron. At 10 Level, You are now immune and invisible to divination magic nor can you be percieved through magical sensors.
You also have advantage against Mental Saving Throws.

subclassFeature.name: Harvest Secrets
entries: You've earned one of your patron's greatest tools to reap and use your victims vulnerabilitie against them. At 14th level, as an action you create a mental pathway between you and a target you can see within 60 feet. Once created as a bonus action you may attempt to pry weaknesses from the target forcing them to make a Wisdom Saving Throw against your Spellcasting DC.

On a failure, you gain a weakness die which is a {@dice 1d8|d8} which you can either choose to keep or grant to an ally within 60 feet of you. A creature can either spend the {@dice 1d8|d8} on an attack against the target, granting a bonus to hit and damage rolls. Or if they force the creature to make a saving throw, they can roll the {@dice 1d8|d8} before their saving throw and give them a malus to the saving throw equal to the result.

subclassFeature.name: The Astral Entity
entries: Your patron is a powerful entity lost in the vastness of the Astral plane. Their interests rarely involve the affairs of the material plane so their intentions are usually mysterious, even to those who make their pacts with them purposely or otherwise.
Regardless of why, the entity grants their beneficiaries with power innate within the stars and the insights they bring.

subclassFeature.name: Stellar Vows
entries: On your turn, If you use an action to cast a cantrip, you may use a bonus action to cast a spell which would normally take an action to cast and that uses a warlock spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Astral Pact Spells
entries: The Astral Entity lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Constellate Practice
entries: Your entity has blessed you with the might of the meteor. Granting you the following benefits:

items: When casting eldritch blast, a small portal to the stars opens and spews small meteors in place of the beams. You may choose to change it's damage type to fire or radiant.

Once per turn, when a creature takes damage from a radiant spell of yours, you may force it to make a Constituion saving throw against your spell save DC, blinding it till the end of your next turn on a failure.
Once per turn, When you have no warlock spell slots, You can reroll a spell attack roll for a cantrip you cast.

subclassFeature.name: Astral Meditation
entries: As an action, a stellar portal opens and shadowy tendrils from within grab into the portal leaving an astral copy in its place similar to the one produced by the astral projection spell. It functions virtually the same as you but with half health (rounded down).

You may use a bonus action at any point to make the copy disappear as you reappear in a place within 5 feet of it. Any effects suffered by the copy do not transfer to you and when it's destroyed, you immediately appear within 5 feet of it. You may create this copy once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Astrological Compact
entries: As reaction to a creature's ability check, saving throw or attack roll, you may force it to make a Charisma saving throw. If it fails, you may record the roll and force the creature to reroll. You may later, as a reaction to a creature's ability check, saving throw or attack roll, replace the roll with the recorded roll. You may record and store up to three such results.

subclassFeature.name: The Croupier
entries: Tales and rumours occasionally spill from the taverns of men who appear to be perhaps too charming, a tad more deft or quite a bit smooth in the way they operate. Perhaps they've played the violin too well for his time or they've caught the hearts of one too many an admirer or, most commonly, they find themselves with too many winning hands. So tales and rumors become myth of men succumbing to the dealings of an opportunistic power and for once, they're right.

Entities of many vareity take the form of The Croupier when they come to strike a wager with their beneficiaries, usually appealing to their greed or their desire for more charm or even simply a want for the skill they offer. These beings can be tricksters, agents of chaos, enjoyers of the arts, observers of luck or even sheerly malignant. They take the form of a simple dealer luring their victims with bets eventually culminating in a stacked contract. Since after all:-
The house always wins.

subclassFeature.name: "Is this your card?"
entries: At 1st level when you choose this pact, your patron bestows his conduit for your Warlock spells; The Eldtritch Deck. You can spend 1 hour in ritual to summon the deck in your hand or convert an appropriate arcane focus to one. you may only have one at a time and attempting to create another will result the previous deck disappearing, leaving an arcane focus behind if it was used.

The deck counts as an arcane focus and appears as a pack of cards to a game of your choosing. It appears non-magical to divination magic and when drawn from the pack, produces the exact cards for whichever game is being played upto a total of 400 cards. Any cards outside the pack disappear after 24 hours. You may also choose to know the exact position and faces of cards in the deck.

You become proficient with {@filter gaming sets|items|source=phb|miscellaneous=mundane|type=gaming set} and learn the {@spell prestidigitation} spell. When you use it, you can conceal the verbal and somatic components of the spell as ordinary conversation and card handling.

entries.name: Eldritch Cards(Optional)
entries: When you cast {@spell eldritch blast} with the Eldritch Deck, instead of beams you can choose to give them the appearance of cards produced from your deck.

subclassFeature.name: Croupier's Pact Spells
entries: The Croupier Grants you knowledge of certain spells as you gain levels as a warlock. you always have the spells in the Croupier's Spells table prepared as you reach particular levels in this class. These spells count as Warlock spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Warlock spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Cardistry
entries: Your patron grants you the house edge; A set of abilities for you to choose from known as 'Tricks'. You know of one of your choice from the table below when you get this feature and can know as many as the number of warlock spell slots you possess, learning a new one when you gain another slot.

When you use a Trick, you must spend a warlock spell slot for the spellcasting involved with the Trick and you may not use the same Trick again until you finish a short or a long rest. You cannot use multiple tricks on the same spell. You may replace a Trick you know for another when you gain a level in this class.

entries.caption: Cardistry
rows: {@b Pick-Up}: You may use this trick when you cast a spell to disappear in a cloud of cards and turn {@condition invisible} until the beginning of your next turn.

{@b Reveal}: When a creature targets you with a attack roll or a spell, you may use this Trick and cast a spell with the casting time of an action and targeting only that creature if within range of the spell.

{@b Throw}: When you use the {@action cast a spell} action, you may use this Trick by throwing a card at a point within 30 feet of you. The spell is then cast as though you were standing at that point.

{@b Deal}: You can use this Trick by using an action to store a spell of a casting time of an Action, bonus action or reaction spending a warlock spell slot in the process. A person wielding this card may then use the corresponing action to cast the spell with your save DC, spell attack bonus and spellcasting ability, spending the card in the proccess. 8 hours after making this card, it disappears.
{@b Flip}: You can use this Trick by casting a spell with the casting time of an action as a bonus action.

{@b Flourish}: When you cast a spell you can use this Trick to bedazzle creatures around you with your stage magic. 3 creatures of your choice 60 feet away from you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or all become {@condition charmed} by you or all {@condition blinded} (your choice) until the start of your next turn.

{@b Split}: When you cast a spell that targets a single creature, you can use this Trick to target a second. If the spell includes an attack roll or a saving throw, both are subject to it. After seeing the results, you may pick one of them and they take the full effect of the spell.
{@b Hole}: You can use this Trick to cast a spell wihtout it's somatic and verbal components.

{@b Shuffle}: At the start of your turn you may choose to use this Trick by rolling {@dice 2d8|2 d8s}, rerolling any repeats then picking one. Until the start of your next turn, you are able to use the corresponding Trick in the table once.

subclassFeature.name: Sharp Instincts
entries: At the 6th level, your Senses and Skills as a gambler becomed honed. Pick one of the streams from below when you get this feature. You receive its benefits.

items: {@b Showmanship:} You gain proficiency in {@skill Performance} checks and your proficiency bonus is doubled when making them.
{@b Deceit:} You gain proficiency in {@skill Deception} checks and your proficiency bonus is doubled when making them.
{@b Finesse:} You gain proficiency in {@skill Sleight of Hand} checks and your proficiency bonus is doubled when making them.
{@b Flair:} Your proficiency bonus is doubled when making checks with {@item Gaming Set|phb|gaming sets}.
{@b Wariness:} You gain proficiency in {@skill Insight} checks and your proficiency bonus is doubled when making them.
{@b Mistrust:} You get a hidden +5 bonus to checks to determine an illusion that your DM secretly applies.

entries: If you are already proficient in a skill that you picked a stream for, you may pick another from the Warlock class' skills.

subclassFeature.name: Lady Luck's Kiss
entries: You know the {@spell fortune's favor|egw} spell and can cast it once at its lowest level without a material component. When cast this way, the duration lasts for 8 hours instead. You have it always prepared and it doesn't count towards your spells known limit.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Card
entries: At the 10th level, your patron hides a few tricks up your sleeve.
Once per long rest, you may cast a warlock spell that you haven't prepared using an available slot.

You also gain a wild card in the form of an additional special warlock spell slot. When casting with the wild card, you may use any applicable Trick you know in conjuction with it without spending a use of the Trick. You regain use of it after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The House Always Wins
entries: At the 14th level, your patron grants you his greatest boon; an unstable connection to the weave. You gain possession of 2 special dice in the form of a {@dice 1d4|d4} and a {@dice 1d6|d6}, gaining a {@dice 1d8|d8} as well at the 15th level in this class.

Whenever you spend a warlock spell slot, you may roll a {@dice 1d4|d4}. If casting from the 6th or 7th level Mystic Arcanum, roll a {@dice 1d6|d6} or a {@dice 1d8|d8} if casting from the 8th or 9th level Mystic Arcanum. If any of these dice rolls roll their maximum, you regain the spell slot or use of the Mystic Arcanum.
After rolling any of these dice, you may once spend a spell slot to roll it again. Once regained, that die cannot be used until a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Ronin
entries: The Ronin is a fighter who draws on a desire to win to fell his foes. A Ronin's wits help keep his breath and takes his enemies. Either they die fighting or he lives to see them dead.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Stealth}, {@skill Survival}, {@skill Deception}, or {@skill Intimidation}. Alternatively, you learn one language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Dirty Fighting
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your determination for victory allows for tactics foul. As a bonus action on your turn, you can take the {@action hide} or {@action disengage} action. When you do so, you also deal 3 additional damage on the next weapon attack you land within a minute. The damage increases when you reach certain levels in this class, increasing to 6 at 10th level and 9 at 15th level.
Additionally, you retain the benefit of being hidden till the end of your turn or until you take an action that breaks it.
You can use this feature three times, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rougish Cunning
entries: Starting at 7th level, your wits and cool allow you to keep calm during acts of deceit. Whenever you make a {@skill Deception} check, you gain a bonus to the check equal to your Wisdom modifier.
Your cunning also causes you to gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws. If you already have this proficiency, you instead gain proficiency in Intelligence or Charisma saving throws (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: No rest for the Wicked
entries: Starting at 10th level, when you roll initiative and have no uses of Dirty Fighting remaining, you regain one use.

subclassFeature.name: Weapon Testing
entries: Starting at 15th level, you learn to thoroughly exploit an enemy's weakness. If you make a weapon attack against a creature on your turn and have advantage on the attack roll, you gain advantage on the next weapon attack you make against the creature on the same turn. This effect can be repeated to chain advantages.
If this weapon attack you make has bonus damage from dirty fighting, it applies to each consecutive hit that turn but ends if you miss.
Additionally, you gain 10 feet of movement.

subclassFeature.name: Stubborn till the End
entries: Starting at 18th level, through sheer will, you use even your demise to your advantage. When you fall to 0 hitpoints and fall unconscious, you gain the benefit of being hidden as you feign death. On the start of your turn after this, you can take a turn as normal and you gain the benefit of your action surge feature. If on this turn you have 0 hit points, you ignore the effects of {@condition unconscious} but any damage done to you will still cause death saving throw failures and three death saving throw failures can still kill you.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Man-o'-Arms
entries: The Man-o'-Arms is a fanatic when it comes to weapons and their wielding. They are capable of holding using and exploiting multiple of them at the same time with a combination of preparation, smarts and finger-finesse.

subclassFeature.name: Weapon Maintainance
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in two of the following tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item tinker's tools|phb}, {@item leatherworkers's tools|phb} or {@item woodcarver's tools|phb}.

subclassFeature.name: Weapon Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in either Firearms or two Exotic weapons of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Ready
entries: Your dexterity with mastered weapons improves to accomodate two of them effectively in combat. While wielding a one-handed mastered weapon and a light mastered weapon, after you take the {@action Attack} you can make another attack with a bonus action.
You may load ammunition for a one-handed ranged mastered weapon without a free hand once per turn this way.
Additionally, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Scabbards and Holsters
entries: At the 7th level, in conjunction with your improved handling of weapons, you've devised a system of sheaths, quivers, bandoleers and other such quick-access storage around you such that you always have the weapon you need at the right time. You gain the following benefits:-

items: You can a bonus action attack after an {@action Attack} action if you are wielding two mastered weapons without the Two-Handed or Heavy properties.

Once per turn, as part of an attack, you can quickly sheath a mastered weapon you're holding, replace it with a different mastered weapon in your inventory and attack with it. If the weapon being swapped in has the Two-Handed property or if you want to use it's Versatile property, you must have a free hand to make an attack.
You ignore the Loading property of mastered weapons.
You no longer need a free hand to load ammunition into one-handed mastered weapons.
A number of weapons you carry equal to your proficiency bonus have their weight reduced by half.

subclassFeature.name: Adept Adaptation
entries: When you make a weapon attack, you can impart a weapon mastery property of a weapon used prior that turn. You must have mastered all weapons involved in this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Armed to the Teeth
entries: At the 15th level, it seemingly doesn't matter where it is on your body. A weapon on it is effectively in your hand when you need it.
You can draw and withdraw upto two mastered weapons as part of each attack.

subclassFeature.name: One-Man-Army
entries: Starting at the 18th level, when you use your Action surge. You get an additional bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Weapon of the Wild
entries: Your savage lifestyle has taught you the frivolity of weapons and the raw lethality of the gifts nature has given you. As such you have turned it into a weapon to bring a swift end to your prey. Choose one body modification from the bottom. It counts as a simple melee weapon for you with the finesse property.

entries.name: Fang
entries: Perhaps it grew naturally or shaved down by file, your teeth have fine points that can’t be argued against.
You may use them as an attack dealing {@damage 1d4} Piercing damage on a hit. This attack uses your Constitution modifier for its attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Fist
entries: Your fists have been carved and calloused from excessive use, becoming deadly weapons.

They count as light weapons that you may make attacks with when you have a free hand, dealing {@damage 1d6} Bludgeoning on a hit. Its damage die increases to a {@damage 1d8} when you have two free hands.

entries.name: Fingernail
entries: Your nails have thickened greatly, and with proper grooming, have turned into vicious claws.

They count as light weapons that you may make attacks with when you have a free hand, dealing {@damage 1d6} Slashing damage on a hit. When you land a sneak attack with them, you rip open vulnerabilities to further attack. The next attack that hits it before the start of its turn deals a additional {@dice 1d6} damage.

subclassFeature.name: Wit of the Wild
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Nature} and {@skill Survival} skills if you don't already have it. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of those proficiencies.

items: When you use the hide or disengage action, you gain an additional 10 feet of movement. Increasing to 15 feet at level 9 and 20 feet at level 17.
If you successfully hide from a creature, you remain unseen until either you make an attack, cast a spell or your turn ends.
When you land a melee sneak attack at advantage, you may use {@dice d8s||1d8} instead of the {@dice d6s||1d6} of your sneak attack dice

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Alteration
entries: You find your body reacting peculiarly to the magic around you. You gain the following benefits.

items: Your natural weapons count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. When you have equipped a magical weapon or armour with a +1 or greater enchantment, your natural weapons gain a bonus to their attack and damage rolls equal to the highest of such an enchantment possessed by an equipped item.
Your sense of smell improves, granting advantage to {@skill Perception} checks made using it.
Your natural weapons alter further, giving you the following benefit depending on your chosen weapon.:-

items.name: Fang
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Intimidation} checks made against anyone who sees your teeth in conversation.

items.name: Fist
entries: Once per turn, when hitting an object, you may add your sneak attack damage to the damage roll. You may not use sneak attack on that turn.

items.name: Fingernail
entries: You become able to manipulate the shape of your nails to some extent. You may use them as a substitute for thieves' tools granting you a {@dice 1d4} bonus to checks using them and you gain a climbing speed equal to your movement speed.
You also gain a {@i Cunning Strike} feature:

entries.name: Bewildering Strike (cost {@dice 2d6})
entries: The target gains disadvantage on {@skill Perception} checks till the start of your next turn. In this state, creatures hiding from the target may do so even in direct sight.

subclassFeature.name: Wilderness Within
entries: You bestial nature overtakes you in combat. All you seek is the demise of your prey. Your natural weapons alter further to meet that desire.

items.name: Fang
entries: Your teeth have grown a hunger of their own. It now deals {@damage 1d8} Piercing damage on a hit. When you land a sneak attack with your teeth, you may drain the very vitality from your foes recovering health equal to the sneak damage done. This does not work on the undead or constructs and can only use this ability once, regaining its use on a short rest.

items.name: Fist
entries: Your fists have taken a strange shape, molded by experience. They now deal {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage when you have one free hand and {@damage 1d10} when you have two free hands. Attacks made with them also ignore resistance to bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Fingernail
entries: You gain further insight into opening vulnerabilities within your targets. landing a melee sneak attack against a target will now grant the next attack made against that target before it’s turn begins advantage, dealing an additional {@damage 2d4} damage if the attack hits.

In addition, your senses improve even further: Your darkvision now goes out to 120 feet and areas that are lightly obscured do not affect your perception. You also gain 10 feet of blindsight towards creatures you can smell.

subclassFeature.name: Predator
entries: Your ferocity grows. You may use {@dice d10s||1d10} as your sneak attack dice, when you land a melee sneak attack with advantage. You may make a sneak attack without advantage once per short rest and still gain this benefit.

Additionally, the range of your blindsight reliant on smell increases to 30 feet Hidden and {@condition invisible} creatures do not benefit from those features against you while they are within this range.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Progress
entries: The Oath of Progress demands that its adherents be the torch that uplifts and leads all around him towards a brighter future.

A signature in the appearance of a Paladin of this oath is the strange and wondrous armour in their possession. A marvel of technology infused with divine power that they wear in their mission to better the lives of their fellow man.Working as engineers, architects and local leaders, they rarely come upon great fame. Instead, they are content being seen as village heroes, good samaritans or warriors of the folk acting in service to the meek and little. They hold a greater compassion for the common folk, the unenlightened and the dispossessed, thus toiling in the amelioration of society from the bottom up

As their act of devotion, those of this oath incessantly seek to innovate and spread those innovations to those who it may not come to. They also often act as origin for new ideas and ideals for society to adopt. Often coming at odds with those that govern. Seeing themselves as the wheels that turn, they utilise humble images of upliftment and unity such as torches, gears and walking men

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: You gain the following Channel Divinity options. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how Channel Divinity works.

entries.name: Activation
entries: While wearing the armour, you may use a bonus action to channel divinity into your very armour, powering it for 1 hour. While you are wearing it in this state, you gain the benefits of two of the features implemented into the armour, Choosing them when you activate it.

entries.name: Hit the Ground
entries: When rolling for initiative, you can use your channel divinity to give you and your allies within 30 feet +1 to their initiative roll. Additionally, they may use their reaction to move up to 20 feet without provoking opportunity attacks and until the end of their turn they receive +1 to attack rolls and spell save DCs.

subclassFeature.name: Working Class
entries: You gain proficiency with an {@item artisan's tools|PHB|artisan's tool} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Sacred Harness
entries: Through divine knowledge you gain the ability to produce a Sacred Harness; a conduit of innovation and divine power to augment a suit of armour that you wear. It takes the form of a piece of clothing or an accessory that wraps around arms, torso and legs.

You may craft this device over the course of 7 days and with materials worth 50gp during your long rests. This harness must then be configured and integrated into a set of armour which requires work that may be carried out during a short rest. While configuring the harness you may implement a number of the following features equal to your proficiency bonus. Whenever you gain a new feature you may also replace an old feature with another one.

entries.caption: Armour Features and Benefits
rows: +You gain a +1 bonus to your Spell Save DC. At level 11, the bonus increases to +2.

(Light Armour Only) If you have not moved more than 15 feet since the start of your turn, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC till start of your next turn. At level 11, the bonus increases to +2 and you may move upto 30 feet and retain this bonus.
(Medium Armour Only) You gain a +2 bonus to your Initiative rolls and gain the benefit of the {@feat alert} feat. At level 11, the bonus improves to +3.
(Medium Armour only) Your Dexterity score improves by 2 up to a max of 17. At level 11, it improves by 3 upto a maximum of 18.
Your armour imposes no disadvantage to {@skill Stealth} Checks and requires no Strength to operate. This effect remains active without needing powering.
(Level 11 on) When you are making Death Saving Throws, on a success you may roll a hit die, add your Constituion modifier to it and heal for that amount. This effect works only once per powering.
You gain advantage on {@skill Acrobatics} checks (At level 11, you also gain adavntage to Dexterity Saving Throws).
You gain advantage to all checks made with Strength (At level 11, you also gain advantage on all Strength Saving Throws).
You gain advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks. At level 11, You gain advantage on all Dexterity checks.
(Light Armour Only) When you receive psychic damage, you may reduce the damage taken by {@damage 2d4}. At level 11, you instead gain resistance to it.
(Medium Armour Only) When you receive elemental damage, you may reduce the damage taken by {@damage 2d4} . At level 11, you instead gain resistance to it.
(Heavy Armour Only) When you receive physical damage, you may reduce the damage taken by {@damage 2d4} . At level 11, you instead gain resistance to it.

(Medium Armour Only) Twice since powering the armour, you may use use your bonus action to perform the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action. At level 11, You may do it upto three times instead.
(Heavy Armour Only) Once per turn when you are hit with melee attack, you may use your reaction to push a large or smaller creature within 10 feet upto 10 feet away.
(Heavy Armour Only) (Level 11 on) Increases the range of your paladin auras by 5 feet. At Level 18, This increment changes to 15 feet.
(Light Armour Only) Grants a 10 foot bonus to your movement speed. At level 11, this bonus increases to 15 feet.
You gain a +1 bonus to weapon attacks while concentrating on a paladin spell. At level 11, this bonus increases to +2.
When rolling for damage, can convert Radiant damage into Fire, Cold or Lightning Damage (at lv.11 reroll upto twice)

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed in the Oath of Progress table. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how oath spells work.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Progress
entries: Different sects and orders that follow the oath of progress may possess different ideals or hold greater value in some principles, but they hold these tenets in common.

entries.name: Comradery
entries: Paving the road to the future alone is hard work, Your allies are therefore invaluable.

entries.name: Innovation
entries: Invention is the light forward. It is imperative that new ideas and means be either created or adopted.

entries.name: Conformity
entries: Difference may exist in appearance or ability but conformity must exist in thought, structure and action.

entries.name: Diligence
entries: The future rests for no one thus neither should you. You seek discipline in most aspects of your life.

entries.name: Courage
entries: You all go towards a darkness that must be illuminated. Others may not follow with their own, lest you pick up your torch.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Resilience
entries: Starting at 7th level, you constantly emanate a bolstering aura while you're not incapacitated. The aura extends 10 feet from you in every direction, but not through total cover.

If an ally takes damage while present in the aura and they aren’t unconscious they may roll  {@damage 1d6} and receive that many temporary hit points right after. At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet and hit points received increases to {@damage 2d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Perpetual Conduit
entries: Your mission is eternal and so must be the power that fuels you. You discover a tap into divine energy that you can fuel your augmented armour with. Starting at the 15th level, choose one feature of your harness. Its effect becomes permanent while you are wearing it.
You may change the benefitting feature whenever you are able to implement a new feature into the harness.

subclassFeature.name: Crusader of Destinies
entries: You harness a fragment of divine energy to push your armour beyond its limits. At the 20th level, while you are wearing your augmented armour, you can supercharge your armour as an action, for 1 minute. While in this state you gain every benefit of all the features implemented into the harness.
You regain use of this feature once you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Draconic Fealty
entries: Those who pledge themselves to a Dragon-Lord seek to emulate and uphold their values and swear their undying loyalty in their protection.

Also known as Dragon-Knights, they may be viewed as a threat or with great respect but are most definitely greatly feared. They typically act as their Dragon-Lord's agents usually as emissaries or commanders but are also known to be enforcers or worshippers becoming the Dragon-Lord's presence. Their arms and armour are often emblazoned with imagery of dragons with the colours of their Lord's aspect but can sometimes defer to symbols that represent their Lord's values.

Though few in number they may enter their lord's service for many reasons. They may be a Dragonborn or Dragon-marked who draw a connection to their Dragon-Lord, some seek their power, some share their desire for gold and some may even believe the act as a force for good. Regardless, through their fealty they all seek to become the best representation of their Dragon-Lord.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: You gain the following Channel Divinity options. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how Channel Divinity works.

entries.name: Wyrmshape
entries: As a bonus action or as a reaction to falling, you can Channel Divinity to imbibe yourself with your Lord's power for a minute. Spectral Draconic wing manifest allowing you to slow your descent to 60 feet per round taking no damage from the fall. You may also fly in short bursts, as you have a flying speed equal to your movement speed which goes away at the end of your turn. This flight does not provoke opportunity attacks.

In this form as a bonus action, you can exhale a breath in the form of a line 5 feet wide and 60 feet long or a 30 foot cone, subjecting creatures affected to a Dexterity Saving throw against your Spell Save DC. Creatures that fail take damage equal to a roll of {@damage d12s|1d12} equal to your proficiency bonus of the damage type associated with your aspect. Creatures who've succeeded receive half as much damage. At the beginning of your turn roll a {@dice d6|1d6}, you regain use of this feature on a roll of 5 or 6.

entries.name: Command
entries: As an action you can Channel Divinity to impose your Lord's will. Choose upto 2 creatures within 60 feet of you who can hear you. They must succeed on a Wisdom Saving Throw against your Spell Save DC or all be subject to the {@spell Command} spell, using the same word for all. You can additionally as part of this action command an ally to attack who may now use a reaction to make a weapon attack.
At level 7 in this class, you can choose a 3rd creature and at level 15 you can choose a 4th creature and a command 2nd ally to attack.

subclassFeature.name: Emissary of Scales
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Intimidation} or {@skill Persuasion} and you can speak, read and write {@language Draconic}.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Aspect
entries: Dragon-Knights typically gain the aspect of their Dragon-Lord but some allow their servants to choose for themselves. Depending on the aspect chosen, the damage type of certain features in this subclass will change.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed in the Oath of Progress table. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how oath spells work.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Draconic Fealty
entries: The beliefs upheld by a Dragon-Knight can vary drastically depending on their Dragon-Lord. Though some of these tenets are held in common.

entries.name: Fealty
entries: Dragon-Knights may differ but their loyalty to their Dragon-Lord is paramount.

entries.name: Dominance
entries: You are a leader and an exception amongst others. You must struggle to stay as such.

entries.name: Avarice
entries: Wealth may not determine worth but it is the next best measure.

entries.name: Rigour
entries: You strive to improve the self to better model yourself after your masters.

entries.name: Independence
entries: Reliance is weakness.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Pressure
entries: Starting at 7th level, You emit an aura of elemental pressure. Allies standing within 10 feet of you deal an additional {@damage 1d8} damage of the type of your aspect on a weapon attack. At level 18, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.
If you are proficient in {@skill Persuasion} or {@skill Intimidation} checks, your proficiency bonus for those checks is doubled for targets within your aura.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon-Lord's Will
entries: Traits of your Dragon-Lord begin to trickle into you. You gain resistance to the damage type of your Draconic Aspect.
In addition, you may change the damage type of your Divine Smite from radiant to your Draconic Aspect's.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of the Wyrm
entries: You serve as your Lord's ultimate champion and have earned the ability to become vessel for their greatest power. As an action, you transform yourself into an Avatar of your Dragon-Lord, granting you the following benefits:

items: Creatures of your choice that enter or start their turn in your aura must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened}. Creatures immune to the {@condition frightened} condition who fail are marked as defiant, you have advantage on attack rolls against them and deal additional damage equal to your Charisma modifier.
You gain the breath weapon of your Channel Divinity. It's area grows to either a line 5 feet wide and 120 feet long or a cone of feet now recharges on a roll of 3-6.
Wings sprout from your back granting you a flying speed equal to your movement speed. You do not provoke opportunity attacks if you fly away from.
Scales cover your body granting you an AC bonus equal to your Constitution modifier.
You gain immunity to the damage type of your aspect
If you fail a saving throw you can choose to succeed instead. You can't do so again until your next activation of this feature.

entries: You regain use of this feature once you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Art of Poise
entries: Within the spelldance it is prefered by most choreurgists to be wielding nothing as any unnecessary weight hinders the ability to motion fast and precisely. Practitioners of the School of Poise learn to integrate weapons into their spelldance.
They allow their body to meld with the weapon by adapting to their weapon's heft and wieldiness. If they manage to integrate it into their body, perhaps they may even cast spells through them.

subclassFeature.name: Poise Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Poise Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Balance Training
entries: You gain proficiency with a weapon that possesses the finesse property of your choice.

You must spend time before a long rest training with a weapon with the finesse property that you are proficient in, to get used to its weight and form after which it becomes your Poise weapon. Any such weapon of similar make can then be used as your poise weapon.
Your poise weapon becomes an arcane focus for you. When you cast spells, you can cast them through this weapon.
You may know only one poise weapon as it takes time adjusting to another.

subclassFeature.name: Quick on your Feet
entries: When you roll for initiative you may roll a {@dice 1d8} and add it to your initiative.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Perfected Balance
entries: You gain access to your Poise weapon's weapon mastery features.

subclassFeature.name: Overhand Thrust
entries: You've learnt to leverage your footwork into the greater reach of your lunges. You may extend your reach by 5 feet at the expense of 5 feet of your movement per attack.

subclassFeature.name: Insightful Strike
entries: When you successfully land a melee attack on a creature, you create an opening for yourself. The creature will suffer disadvantage on the next saving throw you subject it to till the beginning of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Art of Forte
entries: Cantrips on their own are too simple a spell to reach any height of power. Followers of the school of Forte recognize a method of casting them deemed unorthodox and unstable. They tap into an inner chaos present within their spelldance and the spells they cast, Sacrificing safety and certainty to unlock it's potential to wreak untold amounts of destruction.

subclassFeature.name: Forte Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Forte Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Interference
entries: If you cast a damaging Cantrip which targets a single creature and it fails its saving throw or the attack roll hits, The damage roll it receives may increase the damage. If any number is repeated in the damage roll, you must add it again to the total damage.
This feature must be used after rerolling any damage dice

subclassFeature.name: Overloaded
entries: Once per turn, you may roll an extra damage die for a cantrip you cast.

subclassFeature.name: Modulation
entries: Once per casting, you can reroll the damage die of a cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Constructive Interference
entries: {@b Enhances Interference}. When two of the damage dice roll the same even number, you can target a second creature with the same Cantrip within its range.

subclassFeature.name: Destructive Interference
entries: {@b Enhances interference}. For every repeated odd number that appears, the radius of a spherical area of effect grows by 10 feet centered at the target. Every creature in that area receives half the total damage of the corresponding damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Modulation
entries: {@b Enhances Modulation}. You can now either reroll 2 damage dice or set one to any number of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Art of Fervour
entries: In the arduous course of memorizing and repetition, you've taken a keen interest in the elemental nature of the spells you cast and the effects of your innate zeal in fueling them. In this journey, you gain greater insight into the elements, their reactions to the creatures they affect and perhaps more importantly, ways to protect against them.

subclassFeature.name: Fervour Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Fervour Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Fervour Spells
rows: Any damaging Cantrip of your choice,{@spell Chromatic Orb}

subclassFeature.name: Analysis
entries: At the 2nd level, you gain a basic understanding elemental attunement. Once per turn, when a creature you can see is affected by a Cantrip you cast, you can check To see if the creature was resistant, immune or vulnerable to the damage type.

subclassFeature.name: Prismatic Guard
entries: As part of getting this feature, pick three damage types except for force and physical damage types. As a bonus action, you can create a translucent shield called a prismatic guard which grants you resistance to one of the chosen damage types. You choose the resistance when the shield is created.
While the shield is up, you can change the resistance of the shield to another type that you know of with a bonus action.
As you progress in this subclass you learn of more damage types. learning 2 more at the 6th level, 2 more at the 10th level and 3 more at the 14th level including force damage.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Study
entries: At 6th level, your study of the elements has allowed you some specialization. You learn of two additional cantrip masteries and your limit of known cantrip masteries is respectively increased as long as two of those masteries are one from the following table:

If you do not meet the requirement of a mastery, you may replace a cantrip you know with with {@filter another|spells|class=wizard|damage=fire;acid;cold;lightning;thunder;necrotic;psychic;poison;radiant|level=0} from the wizard spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Prismatic Ward
entries: As part of creating the guard and as a bonus action you can pick two willing creatures within 30ft of you. They will receive the benefit of your Prismatic Guard while they are in range.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Fortress
entries: When you generate the shield, you can pick two damage types. You gain resistance to both and cantrips cast of the types active will deal an additional damage die for one damage roll per casting.
You may as a bonus action change one of the shields types while it is active.

subclassFeature.name: Art of Rigour
entries: There's more to casting than shaking a hand and uttering some words. Perhaps those that follow the school of Rigour understand this more than most. They view Choreurgy and minor magics as a science to be thoroughly studied and grasped. Cantrips and the arcane motion are equations on a parchment that need to be broken down and rebuilt constantly to achieve the most efficiency. With enough experimentation they hope to engineer movements so complex that it would be as if you were dancing with two bodies.

subclassFeature.name: Rigour Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Rigour Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Cantrip
entries: You've created a method to make the spelldance itself more efficient. You can add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of your Cantrips per casting.

In addition, your damaging cantrips affect even creatures that avoid the brunt of the effect. When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against your cantrip, the creature takes half the cantrip's damage (if any) but suffers no additional effect from the cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Power Surge
entries: As a bonus action, you can spend a spell slot to empower all cantrips cast until the beginning of your next turn. The cantrips gain a number of damage die equal to the level of slot consumed.

subclassFeature.name: Rigourous Study
entries: You learn of another Choreurgic Mastery. This does not count towards your Choreurgic Masteries known cap.

subclassFeature.name: Metachoreurgy
entries: You've learnt to tap into a 'Second Body'. Controlling it allows you to push the intricacy of your spelldance to new frontiers. Once per turn, when you cast a cantrip targeting a single creature, you can target a second within range. After you see the result of the resulting attack rolls or saving throws, you may pick which creature is affected by the spell.
Additionally, cantrips you cast do not require a somatic component.

subclassFeature.name: Art of Grace
entries: Practitioners of the art of grace are able to channel their dance into a sight of placidity, easing the stressed and benumbing the hurt. Due to their limited arcane capability they do not make for effective healers but through their soothing dance they are capable of numbing pain and easing suffering, allowing those under their care to fight just that little bit longer or at the very least, carry the wounded to safety.

subclassFeature.name: Grace Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Grace Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Lesser Healer
entries: You gain proficiency with the herbalism kit. If you are already proficient in it you may choose a tool proficiency from the possible Flickwrist's tool proficiencies.

subclassFeature.name: First Response
entries: You gain learn the {@spell First Response|tct} cantrip. You always have it prepared and it doesn't count against the number of cantrips known.

subclassFeature.name: Suppression
entries: You gain learn the {@spell suppress|tct} cantrip. You always have it prepared and it doesn't count against the number of cantrips known.

subclassFeature.name: Placating Presence
entries: When making a {@skill Persuasion} or a {@skill Deception} check you can add your Wisdom Modifier to it.

subclassFeature.name: Swansong
entries: When using the First Response feature, You are able to tap into an energy reserve innate within the creature. The creature being revived can expend upto half of his remaining hit dice (rounded up) to heal itself.

entries.name: Arcanist
entries: You'd think a doodad that does magic'd run mages outta jobs. But spell scrolls've never been pricier.
entries.by: Sochenna Gosse, High Scrivener at Solum Solarum

subclassFeature.name: Arcanist Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Arcanist Spells table. These spells count as Artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item jeweler's tools|phb}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Engine
entries: You gain the ability to craft a unique spellcasting focus called an {@i Arcane Engine} over the course of a long rest using a gem worth 10gp, a set of {@item jeweler's tools|phb}, an applicable Artificer's spellcasting focus and some of your blood(or any other bodily fragment up to DM discretion). It becomes a focus whose properties are only usable by you, magical only if any of its components are. Upon creation and after every short rest it gains a number of charges equal to its capacity as shown in the Artificer table above. These charges can fuel your Artificer spells, altering them.

When designing your arcane engine, you can implement two {@i Amplifiers} from the list below that allow you to use these charges. You may implement a third one at the 9th level of this class at which point you may also replace an existing one.

items.name: Expansion
entries: When you cast a spell that applies an effect over an area, you may spend a charge to inrease any one dimension of the spell by 5 feet

items.name: Persistance
entries: While you are not {@condition incapacitated} and subjected to an effect that breaks your concentration you may spend a charge to maintain concentration.

items.name: Transmutation
entries: When you cast a spell that deals a type of damage from the following list, you can spend a charge to change that damage type to one of the other listed types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, thunder.

items.name: Endowment
entries: When you cast a spell with the range of self, you may instead impart it on a willing creature you touch using a charge.

items.name: Elevation
entries: When you cast a spell with scaling effects, you may spend two charges to upcast it by one level. You may upcast it further by spending two more charges for each level. As a bonus action, you may boost a spell you are concentrating on that has not been boosted prior.

items.name: Expedition
entries: When you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can spend a charge to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting (no charge if it is a cantrip).

At a pinch you, can convert spell slots into charges and vice versa using a bonus action using the same conversion rate. You cannot keep more charges than your charge capacity when gaining spell slots this way. Any excess then will be lost.

subclassFeature.name: Super Efficiency
entries: Your Arcane Engine has its cut refined to the point that it is capable of being {@i Overcharged}. When you gain charges that would take you over your engine's capacity, you can temporarily store them until the end of your turn where they disappear.

items: You gain a bonus to saving throw DCs of your artificer spells equal to the bonus provided by an {@i Enhanced Arcane Focus} you are attuned to attuned to.

While overcharged, Once per round on your turn, you can spend a charge to gain an additional action which can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Cast a Spell} (cantrip only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action.
When spending a leveled spell slot of 2nd level or higher in casting a spell and you haven't used a charge as part of the same action, you gain a charge.

subclassFeature.name: Transference Engine
entries: Long periods of using and tinkering with the arcane engine has improved your understanding of channeling and storing arcane power You recieve the following benefits:-

items: Once per long rest, as an action, you can transfer a spell slot to or from a willing creature with the {@i Spellcasting} or {@i Pact Magic} feature. You may transfer any slot and you may reduce its level in the process, but the slot received must be one that can be stored by the recipient according to their spell slot table.

You may also attempt to steal arcane energy from an unwilling target to fuel your own spells. When using your action to {@action cast a spell} using a spell slot, you may use your bonus action to force a creature within 5 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, you gain 1 charge (2 if it is an enemy with the Spellcasting feature) and they lose their lowest level spell slot if they have any. You may then use these charges to fuel the spell being cast with your action. You may use this ability upto proficiency bonus number of times before a long rest.

When you receive your {@i Spell-Storing Item} feature as part of this class, you are also able to store 3rd and 4th level {@filter artificer spells|spells|class=artificer|cast time=action|level=1;2;3;4} into it.

subclassFeature.name: Focal Integration
entries: Perpetual use and exposure to the engine has its focus aligned with your magic. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your arcane engine becomes a part of you. You have quick and ready access to any of the tools used to make it and you can ignore the material component(wihtout a gold cost) of spells you cast.
You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your artificer spells in addition to any provided by your focus.
When you successfully end a spell with dispel magic or counterspell, you gain three charges.

subclassFeature.name: Art of the Spellfist
entries: A school of choreurgy made perhaps for madmen, few actually practice the proximal art without at the very least a blade between the self and danger. Spellfists seem to have no such regard.

Discovering a form of choreurgy that allows for the delivery of the minor magics through their fists themselves, they are quite effective at debilitating their foes with their magic punches but often find themselves in danger soon after.

subclassFeature.name: Crafty Hands
entries: You gain proficiency in either {@item potter's tools|phb} or '{@skill Sleight of Hand}'. If proficient in any of them, you may select a different proficiency available to a Flickwrist.

subclassFeature.name: Spellfist Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Spellfist Spells table. These spells count as Flickwrist spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Flickwrist spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Devil's Dukes
entries: You've achieved the ill-advised. You've translated the magic of choreurgy to flow just as easily through your fists.

items: You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes which have a damage die of {@damage d6|1d6}. This die changes to a {@damage d8|1d8} at level 10.

When you cast a cantrip with a target other than self, you may make an unarmed attack as part of casting the cantrip. This attack replaces any initial spell attack roll of the cantrip you cast. If the cantrip involves a saving throw, the creature is subjected to it if the attack hits. Either way, in addition to any other effect of the cantrip, you may either deal the cantrip's normal damage or the same amount as bludgeoning damage, you may also replace any damage die with your unarmed damage die.
If you benefitted from advantage on this attack roll, the enemy has disadvantage on this cantrips saving throw if the attack hits.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Hook Turn
entries: At the 10th level, You do not take opportunity attacks from creatures if you did not start your turn within their reach.

subclassFeature.name: Fistful of Feedback
entries: At the 14th level, When a creature within your reach misses an attack against you, you may retaliate with a cantrip loaded into an unarmed attack.
You can make this attack once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: College of Lullabies
entries: A bard from the college of lullabies recognises the importance of sleep in life. Many of life's tougher troubles often resolve themselves in slumber and bards seek to guide those in achieving that period of restful bliss. Many are employed by stressed nobility, anxious merchants or even by the weary party to lighten their rest.
In knowing the inner workings of fatigue and weariness, a bard of this college even holds the power of exploiting it to induce the ultimate repose.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Song of Rest
entries: At 3rd level, when rolling extra health from your Song of Rest feature, you may roll a second die and add it to the total healing.

subclassFeature.name: Shepherd of the Count
entries: As a bard of this college, you gain the following benefits to aid your somnifying efforts.

items: You do not need sleep, instead when you long rest, you may spend the time performing light activity. You are also immune to effects that magically put you to sleep or render you unconscious.

You learn the {@spell sleep}. It is always prepared for you and it doesn't count towards your spells known limit. You may cast it once per long rest at a level equal to half your bard level (rounded down) without expending a spell slot. Additionally, when you cast it, you roll d10s instead of the d8s in the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Rise and Shine
entries: At 6th level, you learn to make the fullest of your party's rest. When you are resting choose 5 other people resting with you. At the end of a long rest, they gain a bardic inspiration die that lasts until your next long rest. Though if you are short resting, the inspiration only lasts an hour.

subclassFeature.name: Song of Eternal Rest
entries: At 14th level, you perform the most potent of lullabies. As an action, you begin singing a lulling melody for a minutes duration. For the duration of your song, you behave as though concentrating on a spell. Creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you who can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw, failures suffer the effect of {@spell slow}. If they fail the saving throw again they fall {@condition unconscious}. An unconscious creature within range that hears the melody will remain in a magical coma without the need of food or water, requiring an action by a different creature to wake it up.

subclassFeature.name: Adherent
entries: Adherent's are artificers who have struck a pact with an eldritch being associated with craft and creation. Often fanatical, they hold the belief that objects of their creation possess superior function than that naturally offered to them. So in a bid for self improvement and as sacrifice to their patron, they slowly shed their mortal form so that it may be replaced with a synthetic one. Some of weak constitution and body see this path as inevitable and the sacrifices made as necessary.
Their patron blesses their servants for their devotion with his gifts of creation and destruction.

subclassFeature.name: Adherent Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Adherent Spells table. These spells count as Artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Artificer spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Adherent Spells
rows: {@spell contact other plane}, {@spell Mantle of Dread|AspysGuidetoInfinitum}

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb} and the {@skill Medicine} skill and can make it's checks with Intelligence instead of Wisdom. If you already have either of these proficiencies, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: First Sacrifice
entries: Through unspeakable methods, you have devised the first shedding of your mortal form. By offering your arm as sacrifice, you now make space for the blessing of cold iron. You no longer have an arm and have replaced it with a mechanical counterpart known as a Manipulator.
This arm is used for future sacrfices made as you level in this class and as such comes with features to help with that:-

items: The Manipulator acts as a vessel for your soul if you die while it remains attached. Any spell with the effect of restoring life to you can instead use the arm as a material component without consuming it.

The Manipulator can act as a conscious hand controlled by you even when you are {@condition unconscious}. It cannot speak, can 'see' out to 10 feet even in darkness, wield and manipulate objects and even cast spells on its own. It ceases to function when you die though it still possesses your soul.
You may install upto 2 sets of artisan's tools you are proficient with into the Manipulator. While installed.If you somehow lose proficiency of those tools, they cease to function.
It counts as a spellcasting focus for your artificer spells and can perform the somatic components of a spell even if it is holding something.

entries: As a boon for this sacrifice you learn {@spell spare the dying} and one {@filter warlock cantrip|spells|class=warlock|level=0} of your choice. You learn them as artificer spells and they doesn't count towards your cantrips known. You are also granted the power of {@filter Eldritch Invocations|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=EI}. you gain one now, and you gain more as you further progress as an artificer. Referring to the warlock table, you possess as many invocations as half your artificer level as a warlock (rounded down). You also count as a warlock with half as many levels for the requirements of these invocations.

subclassFeature.name: Second Sacrifice
entries: Your transformation is not yet complete. Through your Manipulator you may now install another replacement for your body select one from the list below you gain its benefits:

items: {@b Ambulators}: You are immune to any effect that would slow your walking speed unless it is reduced to 0 altogether. It may be infused with any infusion that enchants a pair of boots. Doing so will not count towards items infused.
{@b Auditors}: You are immune to being {@condition deafened}. You gain a +5 bonus to your passive perception and gain the benefits of the {@feat Alert} feat.
{@b Conduits}: You are immune to any effect that negates your reaction. Opportunity attacks against you are made with disadvantage and opportunity attacks you make gain advantage.

entries: Your Manipulator has now been upgraded to allow for greater precision. When making an skill check with Dexterity you may roll a {@dice 1d4} and add it to the result.

subclassFeature.name: Third Sacrifice
entries: Perfection is close. Through your Manipulator you may now install another replacement for your body select one from the list below you gain its benefits:

items: {@b Oculi}: You gain darkvision out to 60 feet (90 feet if you already possessed darkvision), cannot be {@condition blinded} unless your vision is physially obstructed and {@condition Invisible} objects and creatures are seen by you. You also gain a +1 bonus to ranged attack and damage rolls.

{@b Truncal Frame}: Your torso has been modified to better wear armour. You can don and doff armour as an action and count as proficient with heavy armour, suffering no penalties to {@skill Stealth} checks or movement speed. Additionally, you gain +1 AC while wearing armour and your can apply another point of Dexterity to your AC when wearing medium armour.

{@b Buttressed Column}: Your Strength score improves by 2 upto a maximum of 20. You count as a size larger for carrying weight. You gain advantage on Strength checks and Saving Throws. If being forced to move you move only half the distance (rounded up).

entries: Your visage has become a thing of horror. As a result you gain advantage on {@skill Intimidation} checks against creatures who can clearly see you.

subclassFeature.name: Final Sacrifice
entries: Though blood still runs through some of you, with this final sacrifice, you have reached a pinnacle in your transformation. When affected by a magical effect, you can choose classify as a construct for that effect. Choose your final replacement from below, you gain its benefits:

items: {@b Sanguiduct System}: Your Constitution score improves by 2 upto a maximum of 20. You become immune to poison and disease. Twice per long rest but once per turn of yours, you may gain a {@action hasted action|tct}.
{@b Co-Processor}: Your Intelligence score improves by 2 up to a maximum of 20. You become resistant to psychic damage and have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws.

entries: Additionally 4th level spells or higher count as Warlock spell slots for the purpose of invocation spells that require warlock spell slots.

subclassFeature.name: Vivemancer
entries: In a field of magic and invention, a unique breed of Artificers exists whose passion lies not only in the realm of gears and gadgets but also in the intricate tapestry of living organisms. Finding fascination with the inner workings of organisms, they believe from a certain perspective that living things to are machines that can be tampered with and even perhaps enhanced. Like necromancers toy with the dead and the forces of death, Vivemancers seek to experiment with the living with the end goal of reaching every vivemancer's holy grail; Artifical Life.

subclassFeature.name: Vivemancer Spells
entries: You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Vivemancer Spells table. These spells count as Artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of Artificer spells you prepare.

entries.caption: Vivemancer Spells
rows: {@spell locate animals or plants}, {@spell wither and bloom|scc}

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item leathermaker's tools|phb} and the {@skill Medicine} skill and can make it's checks with Intelligence instead of Wisdom. If you already have either of these proficiencies, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Flesh Homunculus
entries: Your quest to create artificial life begins, but for now you must make do with necromancy. You gain the ability the ability to create a Homunculus; a fused amalgamation of flesh or plant matter given structure with internal mechanisms that acts as servant and guardian to you.

You can design and create a Homunculus by spending your highest level spell slot, pounds of organic matter equal to 20 times your level as an artificer in pounds and an equal amount of gp in materials. You bring it all together using your Leatherworker's and Tinker's tools over the period of a long rest at which point you may choose the form it takes; A {@creature Homunculus Aggressor|tct}, a {@creature Homunculus Magus|tct} or a {@creature Homunculus Helper|tct}.

During the course of a long rest you may redesign the homunculus, costing you a tenth of it's creation cost in gold. During its design, assign the following scores to it abilities;(17, 15, 13, 12, 11, 10, 8). Then choose it's form and applicable features.

In combat, the Homunculus shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge} action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to psychically command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are {@condition incapacitated}, the Homunculus can take any action of its choice, not just {@action Dodge}.

subclassFeature.name: Biotic Enhancements
entries: Your study has only increased with experimentation and now you reap the rewards. You have discovered a few biological adjustments that can be applied to better serve it beneficiary. Select your homunculus or a humanoid willing to be modified and over the course of a long rest you can grant it one of the benefits from the table below. You know 2 such enhancements and can apply each only once. You learn an additional enhancement at level 9 and at level 18 and can change an enhancement you know for another when you gain a level in this class.

items: {@b Growth Hormone}: You grant 2 additional HP for each level as Artificer, You can also choose to make the size of the creature one size bigger.
{@b Carapace}: Your skin hardens, granting you +1 AC. Armour being worn cannot come off against your will.
{@b Aerial Adaptation (Level 15)}: You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed that you can use for an hour before needing a long rest.
{@b Aquatic Adaptation}: You gain a swimming speed equal to you walking speed and you can breath underwater.
{@b Terrestrial Adaptation}: While barefoot, you gain 10 feet of movement, a climbing speed equal to your walking speed and you move normallly through non-magical difficult.

{@b Primal Adaptations}: You grow out sharp claws that count as light natural weapons, dealing {@damage 1d8} slashing damage on an unarmed hit or a long tail that deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage on an unarmed hit.
{@b Appendage Breakage}: Your melee attacks gain an additional 5 feet of reach.
{@b Rabbit Ears, Hawk Eyes}: You gain advantage on {@skill Perception} checks and initiative rolls. You can not be surprised.
{@b Second Stomach}: You have advantage against effects that would poison or cause disease and gain resistance towards poison damage.
{@b Regeneration (Level 9)}: When your HP goes below half its maximum, a restorative glands kicks in healing for Hit points equal to your Intelligence Modifier.
{@b Poison Gland}: Once per turn, a weapon attack you make deal an an additional {@damage 1d6} poison damage. It deals an additional {@damage 1d6} poison damage at level 15.
{@b Predator Sight}: You gain Darkvision of 60 feet. If applied on a creature with Darkvision, it will extend its range by an additional 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Expert Fleshcrafter
entries: Your hand at fleshcraft only improves which can be seen in the ever improving Homunculus. You gain the following benefits:-

items: You can change the size of your homunculus to medium or small during redesign.
Your Homunculus cannot be {@condition charmed} while you aren't {@condition charmed} yourself.
Your Homunculus is immune to lightning damage from spells that you cast and instead recieves the damage as healing.

subclassFeature.name: Artificial Life
entries: You've unlocked the final secrets standing between you and truly artificial life. As a result, your homunculus has become a fully living sentient being. Your homunculus is now treated as a humanoid.

Your research has culminated into your finest enhancement; A racial trait. When you get this feature, choose a racial trait from any race. It is now available as an enhancement. If applied to your homunculus, it is treated as a creature of that race.
You've also reached a greater psychic bond with your homunculus. When you use your bonus action to command your Homunculus, both of your can spend your initiatives interchangeably.

subclassFeature.name: Mechanaut
entries: A knight may ride into battle on a steed, a wizard may summon many kinds of creature to serve as mount and there are even tales of those brave enough to seek dragons as their vehicle. The first Mechanauts sought in similar fashion to create mountable constructs capable of protecting their rider and thwarting foes.
Eventually however, their efforts led to the creation of moving juggernauts that rained destruction and fear upon most on the battlefield.

Mechanauts are both engineers and pilots to these hulking arcane machines known as 'Mechs'. Through tinkering with blueprints, they are able to modify various aspects of the Mech to suit their needs. A Mech as such is a platform for the Mechanaut and his creations, capable of supporting multiple weapons, field generators, shields and armour which can all be modified.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with two of {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item woodcarver's tools|phb} {@item carpenters's tools|phb} and {@item mason's tools|phb}. You utilize both in the creation of you your machine. If you already have either of these proficiencies, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Operational Handbook
entries: The Mech is a complex unwieldy construct that can offer many benefits depending on its creation and modification. The following section instructs pilots of the various components and their uses, the creation and upkeep of the Mech as well as the options for modification at their disposal. After all, a Mech is only as good as it's pilot.

subclassFeature.name: Creation and Modification
entries: The creation of a Mech is a long and arduous process that takes {@dice 1d4} days to finish. Costing 50 + Artificer level times 20 gp worth of materials to create using the tools made proficient in the Tool Proficiency feature.

At the end of a long rest, you may modify a single component to any applicable modification from the following lists and fully repair the Mech, restoring all of its hit points. A short rest spent repairing the mech will restore hit points equal to half it's hit point maximum.

subclassFeature.name: Cockpit
entries: The Cockpit is where you sit and control your Mech from. It is a cramped space is just big enough for a small or a medium creature wearing light armour to fit but only you know how to fully operate it. While you are adjacent to it, you can mount it by spending half your movement and dismount by spending the same.

By default, the mech remains 'Unpowered' and to use most of the Mech's features you must 'Empower' it by spending an action while sitting in the cockpit. 'Empowering' it grants the Mech an action, allows it to move and activates certain features of the Mech.
For most features and spells treat the mech as yourself.
The following is a list of the Cockpit designs available to a Mechanut.:-

subclassFeature.name: Undercarriage
entries: The Undercarriage is the primary mode of transport for your Mech. When Empowered, the Mech is allowed to move with a speed dictated by its Undercarriage. Later at 5th level, you may move the mech as a bonus action as well.
On the occasion that the mech becomes prone, Its recovery is dependant on its undercarriage as well.

subclassFeature.name: Chassis
entries: The Chassis represents the structure of the Mech and is responsible for its stablity and overall integrity. The mech has a number of hit points equal to 5 times your artificer level. An attack targeted at you instead targets the mech and you benefit from half cover for other effects.

When the Mech is reduced to 0 hitpoints it is rendered inoperable but not destroyed. Any additional damage from the effect that rendered it inoperable and further damaging effects are added to a different pool. If the damage in the pool exceeds the mech's hitpoints, it is destroyed.
The Mech has a storage unit and can normally carry 500 lbs. of material
The following is a list of the Chassis designs available to a Mechanaut:-

subclassFeature.name: Armour
entries: The Armour has a base AC of 12 + your Dexterity Modifier, And may be fitted with additional armour by utilizing a set of Medium or Heavy armour and spending half the gold cost of the base armour, gaining its AC bonus instead and any other benefits (You need to be attuned to any armour that needs attunement). You may also infuse the armour with any infusion that requires a set of armour and grant the Mech it's benefits.
The Mech, regardless of armour, is immune to Pyshcic, Poison, or Necrotic Damage but counts as an object for the purpose of vulnerabilities.

subclassFeature.name: Weapons
entries: The mech posseses two slots for weapons, Upon creation or modification you may fit upto two of the following weapons or you may fit a slot with a weapon you possess. Ammunition must be present in its storage if a weapon requires it but it ignores any 'Loading' property. When 'Empowered', you may use the Mech's action to make an attack with one of them Using your Intelligence Modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.
Weapon designs installed on the Mech can be infused with infusions with the Weapon requirement. The following is a list of the weapon designs available to a Mechanut.:-

subclassFeature.name: Modules
entries: Modules are additional enhancements that can be applied to the Mech. Unlike other parts, you can install multiple modules to the mech (Upto two now and three at level 15). You may even install Wondrous magic items to the magic as modules.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Subroutines
entries: While piloting your Mech it may now make 2 attacks as part of it's attack action. Each attack may be made with the same weapon or with different ones.
You have also learnt to better maneuvre your mech. As a bonus action, you may use the Mech's {@action Dash} action.

subclassFeature.name: Arsenal Rationalization
entries: The Mech gains a third weapon slot that you may use to install another weapon.
Additionally, The weapons for your mech get an upgrade:-

subclassFeature.name: War Colossus
entries: Through marvelous engineering and relentless upgrades you have designed a walking behemoth; The War Colossus.

As a bonus action you can transform the Mech into it's Colossus form. It's size category increases by one and it benefits from several features while in this form. You can use a bonus action to collapse the Mech, reducing it back to its original form.

items: While in the Mech, you may make Strength saves and checks with Intelligence.
When you move through a creatures space that is smaller than you, you may deal {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage to it. A creature may recieve this damage only once per turn.

Each creature hostile to you of size large and below that is within 60 feet of a Colossus form Mech must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell Save DC or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

subclassFeature.name: Saboteur
entries: When the Livian 12th Engineer corps trained their first Saboteurs, they expected them to infiltrate enemy lines in disguise and wreak havoc in their most crucial moments. Not only did they succeed in that front, their purpose has expanded in many directions since then. Finding use even in the front lines where they would wield a mechanism acting as a third arm to operate their complex devices.

Though proving to be highly effective, they would come back to bite the Livian empire. With the onset of the peace of the 11th Era, branches of the military would slowly dissolve into mercenary corps.
