entries: An upgrade of the {@optfeature Scutum|tct}. It now deals {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage to a creature and grants the next attack made against it advantage before the start of the creatures turn.
As a reaction to an ally within 5 of you getting attacked, you can add the barriers AC bonus to the creature's AC.

optionalfeature.name: Appendage
entries: An upgrade of the {@optfeature Pincers|tct}. It's reach increases by a further 5 feet. It's damage increases to {@damage 1d10} and a grappled creature takes lightning damage equal to your Intelligence modifier at the start of it's turn.

optionalfeature.name: Javelins
entries: An upgrade of the {@optfeature Bolts|tct}. It now deals {@damage 1d10} damage on a hit. Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon you can force it to make a Strength Saving Throw, being either pushed away by 15 feet or falling {@condition prone} pm a failure.

optionalfeature.name: Atomizer
entries: {@i Requires two weapon slots}
An upgrade of the {@optfeature DK Beam|tct}. The weapon now deals an additional {@damage 1d6} damage and can change its damage type to radiant on any attack.

optionalfeature.name: Running Guns
entries: {@i Requires two weapon slots}

An upgrade of the {@optfeature Rolling Guns|tct}. It no longer has its's bonus action attack. Instead, Once on your turn when you make an attack with this weapon, you can make an additional attack with it as part of the attack.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Cloak
entries: Your grants you a cover to protect you from harm. It can take take form of a cloak, a robe or a cape. The cloak acts as mystical storage that appears non-magical to divination magic. With your hand within the cloak you may draw or stow an item no heavier than 10 lbs. and as large as can be obscured by the cloak. The cloak this way can store items upto 50 lbs. in weight. When inspected by anyone besides the pact keeper the cloak appears to be a plain piece of cloth with no trace of the items stored.

If you lose or destroy the cloak, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive another from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a rest, destroying the previous one in the process. The cloak becomes extremely brittle when you die and it's contents manifesting nearby.

optionalfeature.name: Twice Armed
entries: You can now turn a second magical weapon into your pact weapon. You must perform the required ritual as usual and if attempting to do the ritual for a third magical weapon, a pact weapon of your choice must break its bond with you.

You can summon two pact weapons or two of the same pact weapon with an action, provided both your hands are free and gain the benefit of the {@optfeature two-weapon fighting} feature when fighting with them.

optionalfeature.name: Protection of the Cloak
entries: You may flip the cloak as a reaction to an attack and gain the benefit of the {@spell shield} spell. You may use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Shroud's Embrace
entries: The cloak wraps tighter and produces warmth or chill as necessary. The wearer of the cloak has resistance to cold damage. In addition, you and everything you wear and carry are unharmed by temperatures as low as -50 degrees Fahrenheit and as high as 150 fahrenheit.

optionalfeature.name: Breakfall Veil
entries: The wearer of the cloak descends at 60 feet per round and may move 2 feet horizontally for every foot they descend. The wearer experiences no damage from falling this way.

optionalfeature.name: Cowl of Oblivion
entries: You know the spell {@spell Greater Invisibility}. For you, it is a warlock spell and it doesn't count against the limit on the number of spells you know and can cast it once without expending a warlock spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Mantle of Mercy
entries: Once per short rest, you can use a reaction to receive only half damage from an instance.

optionalfeature.name: Cerement of Safety
entries: When you drop to 0 hitpoint you can with your remaining consciousness designate a place you can see within 10 feet of you. You turn {@condition invisible}, teleport there and you fall {@condition unconscious}. When you are {@condition unconscious} even when you are sleeping, you remain invisible to all besides people you have designated as allies.

optionalfeature.name: Know Thy Blade
entries: You are able to use the mastery property of your pact weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Otherworldy Creation
entries: You know the {@spell fabricate} spell and can cast it once per day without a spell slot. You also gain an alternate way to cast this spell. This way, the spell becomes a conjuration spell as the components are sent to an extraplanar destination and return near instantly as the product you desired.

optionalfeature.name: Instruction of the Archive
entries: The Archive empowers your Book of Shadows, granting you the ability to record spells. Choose {@filter three Wizard Spells|spells|level=1|class=wizard} when you receive this invocation. You can now prepare two additional spells every long rest that are recorded within this book. You may also record spells in this book as a wizard would in his spellbook.

optionalfeature.name: Token of Ability
entries: Whenever making a dice roll by the talisman, you may roll another dice and add it to the result.

optionalfeature.name: Bestowed Sapience
entries: Your Patron bestows your familiar witha a fragment of the Archives wisdom.

items: Familiars your summon now possess an Intelligence score of 17 and are sapient creatures.
You can summon {@creature inkling mascot|scc} or {@creature oblex spawn|mpmm} when you cast {@spell find familiar}.
When rolling for initiative you can choose have your familiar have the same initiative as you.
You can command your familiar to attack without an action.

optionalfeature.name: Cleave
entries: If you hit a creature with a melee attack using this {@table Cleaving Weapons|tct|weapon}, you can make an attack roll with the weapon against a second creature within 5 feet of the first that is also within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the weapon’s damage, but don’t add your ability modifier to that damage, unless that modifier is negative. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Graze
entries: If your attack roll with this {@table Grazing Weapons|tct|weapon} misses a creature, you can deal damage to that creature equal to the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon, and the damage can’t be increased in any way, other than increasing the ability modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Push
entries: If you hit a creature with this {@table Push Weapons|tct|weapon}, you can push the creature up to 10 feet away from you horizontally if it is no more than one size larger than you.

optionalfeature.name: Sap

prerequisite.other: Versatile property or No other properties

entries: If you hit a creature with this {@table Sapping Weapons|tct|weapon}, that creature has Disadvantage on its next attack roll before the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Slow
entries: If you hit a creature with this {@table Slowing Weapons|tct|weapon} and deal damage to the creature, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If you hit the creature more than once with this property, the Speed reduction doesn’t exceed 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Topple
entries: If you hit a creature with this {@table Toppling Weapons|tct|weapon}, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition prone} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Vex
entries: If you hit a creature with this {@table Vexing Weapons|tct|weapon} and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Tumble
entries: If you hit a creature with a melee attack from this {@table Tumbling Weapons|tct|weapon} and deal damage to the creature, You can move through into the creature's space once without spending movement speed.

optionalfeature.name: Adopted Magics
entries: Choose 2 cantrips and a level 1 spell from the {@filter Sorcerer|spells|level=0;1|class=sorcerer}, {@filter Wizard|spells|level=0;1|class=wizard} or {@filter Warlock|spells|level=0;1|class=warlock} spell lists. They now count as druid spells for you, are always prepared and do not count towards the number of spells prepared.

optionalfeature.name: Bestial Speech
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with animals} at will without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Monstrous Shape
entries: You can now Wild Shape into Monstrosities. you must still meet the CR limitation.

optionalfeature.name: Borrowed Essence
entries: As part of a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your druid level (rounded up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Flow of Entropy
entries: You can cast {@spell chaos bolt} as a cantrip once per turn.
You mast cast it more than once at level 11

optionalfeature.name: Ballroom Bane

spell: A cantrip that causes poison damage

entries: A creature who fails the saving of {@filter a poison cantrip you cast|spells|damage=acid|level=0} you cast will be {@condition poisoned} till the start of your next turn.
Additionally, your cantrips ignore resistance to poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Break Down

spell: A cantrip that causes acid damage

entries: Once per turn, a creature who fails the saving throw of {@filter an acidic cantrip you cast|spells|damage=acid|level=0} you cast will have it's AC reduced by 1 until the start of your next turn.
Additionally, your cantrips ignore resistance to acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Move and Shake

spell: A cantrip that causes thunder damage

entries: Once per turn, when you cast {@filter a cantrip that deals thunder damage|spells|damage=thunder|level=0}, you may force a creature receiving such damage to make a Strength save, failing which will make it either fall {@condition prone} or be pushed horizontally upto 10 feet. You may force the save a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier before a long rest
Additionally, your cantrips ignore resistance to thunder damage.

optionalfeature.name: Smooth as Ice

spell: A cantrip that causes cold damage

entries: Once per casting of {@filter a cantrip that deals cold damage|spells|damage=cold|level=0}, you freeze a 10 foot radius area around your target, rendering it difficult terrain regardless of whether the attack hits or not. This area lasts till the start of your next turn.
Additionally, your cantrips ignore resistance to cold damage.

optionalfeature.name: Burning Sensation

spell: A cantrip that causes fire damage

entries: When you roll damage for {@filter a cantrip that deals fire damage|spells|damage=fire|level=0}, treat the dice as exploding dice.
Additionally, your cantrips ignore resistance to fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Auxiliary Power

spell: A cantrip that causes lightning damage

entries: When a creature takes damage from {@filter a cantrip that deals lightning damage|spells|damage=lightning|level=0}, For each die that rolled max, you may roll another damage die and damage a creature within 30 feet of the target.
Additionally, your cantrips ignore resistance to lightning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Life-Tap Dance

spell: A cantrip that causes necrotic damage

entries: When a creature takes damage from {@filter a cantrip that deals necrotic damage|spells|damage=necrotic|level=0}, For each die that rolled max, you may roll a damage die and heal yourself or willing creature within 30 feet of the target for the amount.
Additionally, your cantrips ignore resistance to necrotic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Blinding Lights

spell: A cantrip that causes radiant damage

entries: Once per turn, when a creature takes damage from {@filter a cantrip that deals radiant damage|spells|damage=radiant|level=0}, You can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw or be blinded till the start of your next turn. You can force the save a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Additionally, your cantrips ignore resistance to radiant damage.

optionalfeature.name: Know Thine Every Move

spell: A cantrip that causes psychic damage

entries: Once per turn, when a creature takes damage from {@filter a cantrip that deals psychic damage|spells|damage=psychic|level=0}, You create a fleeting mental link with the target. While linked like this you gain the following benefits until the start of your next turn:

items: You know the creatures location, while it remains within 60 feet of you.
It does not gain the benefits of being {@condition invisible} or hidden from you.
It cannot receive advantage on attacks against you.

entries: Additionally, your cantrips ignore resistance to psychic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Wind Warp
entries: In addition to the area of effect of {@spell Air Trick|tct} increasing to a 10 foot cube, You gain the following options when you cast it:-

items: You can cause a light or strong breeze to pass through the area, creatures in the area of a strong breeze are {@condition deafened}.

You can create a dense fog in the area, {@quickref Vision and Light|PHB|2||heavilly obscuring} it. You can also use your action to thicken or rarify fog in as you like, making it heavily obscured, lightly obscured or transparent. Any wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.
You can cause a deafening burst of sound. Creatures must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be deafened until the end of their next turn. It can also be heard upto 700 feet away.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Temper
entries: You may cast the {@spell Blade Ward} spell as a bonus action a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier. You gain all such uses after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Jeté
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can leap 10 feet without spending your movement.
The leap distance improves as you take levels in this class. Going to 20 at level 5, 30 feet at level 11 and 40 feet at level 17.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Elusion
entries: You may wear medium armour and still retain the benefits of Elusion and Fleet of Foot.
Additionally, If a medium armour you are wearing imposes disadvantage on {@skill Stealth} checks, it no longer does so.

optionalfeature.name: The Toss from Across
entries: Your range for Flickwrist cantrips is doubled. This does not apply to cantrips with the range of 'Self'.

optionalfeature.name: Arsenal of the Mind
entries: When you cast {@spell Phantom Weapon|tct}, You may instead conjure upto two weapons that you can hold and gain the following benefits with them:

items: You treat attacks with them as weapon attacks, using your Dexterity modifier for Attack and Damage rolls.
They count as poise weapons if they arent ranged or {@b Heavy}, gaining the {@b Light} property if so
Thrown weapons reappear in your hand instead of disappearing after being thrown.
Ranged weapons may conjure ammunition as part of the attack if not provided.

optionalfeature.name: Style Fusion
entries: With some effort you have combined two casting styles into one. As a result, you learn one Casting Style option in addition to the one you know.
Whenever you reach a level that grants an additional Choreurgic Mastery, you can replace this feat's casting style with another one from this class that you don't have.

optionalfeature.name: Will-o-Wisp Waltz
entries: You recieve the following options and features when you cast {@spell Dancing Lights}:-

items: Upon casting the spell, you may have the created lights hover around you, following you as you move.

You may use a bonus action to launch an orb from where it is 60 feet towards a creature you can see, making a ranged spell attack against it. The light is then extinguished, dealing {@damage 2d6} radiant damage on a hit. You may do the same with a conglomeration of orbs, with it instead dealing {@damage 4d6} radiant damage.

A union of orbs instead sheds bright light in a 20 feet around it and dim light for another 20 feet. {@condition invisible} creatures or objects in its bright light it do not benefit from the condition.

The number of lights produced by this spell increases as you gain levels in this class, gaining two more each at level 5,11 and 17. A union of these orbs grants more light as well, each radius improving by 10 feet at level 5,11 and 17.

optionalfeature.name: Choreum Proxima
entries: While not wearing shields, medium or heavy armour, your AC equals 10 + your Intelligence modifier + your Dexterity modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Effortless Moves
entries: Cantrips that require concentration, no longer do when you cast them. Though if you cast a concentration cantrip while another is still active, the earlier casting ends.

optionalfeature.name: Free Expression
entries: You may cast a cantrip without its verbal and material component. Checks made to dispel or {@spell counterspell} your cantrips are also made with disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Art of Long-Fire
entries: The reach of {@spell Green-Flame Blade|tce} extends to the reach of your weapon. In addition, you can cause the fire to leap from the target to a different creature of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of it.

optionalfeature.name: Gale
entries: The spell {@spell Gust|xge} improves in the following ways when you cast it:-

items: The spell can now affect creatures of large size
When a creature fails the saving throw, it is pushed upto 20 away.
The object that can be moved can way upto 20 pounds and can be pushed upto 30 feet away.

optionalfeature.name: Hook Turn
entries: When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to cast a cantrip at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Deflection
entries: You may attempt to grant advantage to a creature 30 feet away against a spells saving throw and you may do so with one hand free.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Stability
entries: You can also reroll one damage die of a cantrip you cast, regardless of the result.

optionalfeature.name: Deepened Esotericism
entries: You can pick an additional 2 cantrips from the {@filter Druid|spells|level=0|class=Druid}, {@filter Cleric|spells|level=0|class=Cleric}, {@filter Warlock|spells|level=0|class=Warlock} or {@filter Bard|spells|level=0|class=Bard}. They count as Flickwrist cantrips and you may add it to the cantrips you know. These cantrips do not count towards your Cantrips Known limit.
Flickwrist cantrips do not benefit from Eldritch Invocations.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Spellbending
entries: As long as you know the location of the creature and an unobstructed path of a length less than or equal to the range exists between you and the target, you can target it and do not suffer any disadvantages from it remaining unseen or {@condition invisible}

optionalfeature.name: Lengthened 'Lectric Lasso
entries: When you cast {@spell Lightning Lure|tce}, the range of the spell increases to 30 feet. And on a failure, you may move the target in any horizontal direction that isnt further from you. On a failure, you may also choose to deal the damage it would have received if it had landed 5 feet next to you.

optionalfeature.name: Fuego
entries: You can cast {@spell burning hands} as a cantrip once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Stone's Throw
entries: You can cast {@spell catapult|xge} as a cantrip once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: The Grand Illusion
entries: you can cast {@spell silent mage} as a cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Sun's Arrows
entries: You can cast {@spell scorching ray} as a cantrip once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Sauté
entries: You can cast {@spell jump} as a cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: 1-Tonne-Stomp
entries: You can cast {@spell earth tremor|xge} as a cantrip once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Bolts out of the Blue
entries: You can cast {@spell magic missile} as a cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Captivating Performance
entries: You can cast {@spell enthrall} as a cantrip once per turn.

optionalfeature.name: Weave Sense
entries: You can cast {@spell detect magic} as a cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Fluidity
entries: You can change the damage type of a cantrip cast to the type of one cast prior on the same turn.

optionalfeature.name: Hasty Haven
entries: Once per turn, you can cast {@spell sanctuary} as a cantrip. You can do so a number of times equal to your Intelligence Modifier before a long rest

optionalfeature.name: Delayed Departure
entries: When you cast {@spell spare the dying}, the target you stabilize continues to make death saving throws but now at advantage, ignoring failed saves and reviving on a roll of 19 or 20. Additionally, if damaged while stabilized by this spell, the creature takes one less failure.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Chain
entries: You learn the {@spell find familiar} spell and can cast it as a ritual. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

When you cast the spell, you can choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, {@creature quasit}, or {@creature sprite}.
Additionally, when you take the {@action Attack} action or cast {@spell eldritch blast}, you allow your familiar to use its reaction to make one attack of its own.

optionalfeature.name: Protection of the Blade
entries: You gain proficiency in Medium armor.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Blade (variant)
entries: You can use your action to create a pact weapon in your empty hand. You can choose the form that this melee weapon takes each time you create it (see chapter 5 for weapon options). You are proficient with it while you wield it. This weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage. Additionally, when you attack with that weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

Your pact weapon disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the weapon (no action required), or if you die.

You can transform one magic weapon into your pact weapon by performing a special ritual while you hold the weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest. You can then dismiss the weapon, shunting it into an extradimensional space, and it appears whenever you create your pact weapon thereafter. You can't affect an artifact or a sentient weapon in this way. The weapon ceases being your pact weapon if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different weapon, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The weapon appears at your feet if it is in the extradimensional space when the bond breaks.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Talisman
entries: Your patron gives you an amulet, a talisman that can aid the wearer when the need is great. When the wearer fails an ability check, they can add a {@dice d6} to the roll, potentially turning the roll into a success. This benefit can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a long rest.

If you lose the talisman, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous amulet. The talisman turns to ash when you die.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Tome
entries: Your patron gives you a grimoire called a Book of Shadows. When you gain this feature, choose three {@filter cantrips|spells|level=0} from any class's spell list. The cantrips do not need to be from the same spell list. While the book is on your person, you can cast those cantrips at will. They don't count against your number of cantrips known. Any cantrip you cast with this feature is considered a warlock cantrip for you. You can also use an action to tear a page from the book of shadows to regain a warlock spell slot. Once you do so, you cannot gain another warlock spell slot through this feature until you finish a long rest. If you lose your Book of Shadows, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous book. The book turns to ash when you die.

optionalfeature.name: Banishing Arrow
entries: You use abjuration magic to try to temporarily banish your target to a harmless location in the Feywild. The creature hit by the arrow must also succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished. While banished in this way, the target's speed is 0, and it is {@condition incapacitated}. At the end of its next turn, the target reappears in the space it vacated or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
After you reach 10th level in this class, a target also takes {@damage d6} force damage when the arrow hits it. This damage increases to {@damage 2d6} at 18th level.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Arrow
entries: Your enchantment magic causes this arrow to temporarily beguile its target. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage, and choose one of your allies within 30 feet of the target. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it is {@condition charmed} by the chosen ally until the start of your next turn. This effect ends early if the chosen ally attacks the {@condition charmed} target, deals damage to it, or forces it to make a saving throw.
The psychic damage increases to {@damage 3d6} and {@damage 4d6} when you reach 10th and 18th level in this class respectively.

optionalfeature.name: Bursting Arrow
entries: You imbue your arrow with force energy drawn from the school of evocation. The energy detonates after your attack. Immediately after the arrow hits the creature, the target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take {@damage 2d6} force damage each.
The force damage increases to {@damage 3d6} and {@damage 4d6} when you reach 10th and 18th level in this class respectively.

optionalfeature.name: Enfeebling Arrow
entries: You weave necromantic magic into your arrow. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. The target must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the damage dealt by its weapon attacks is halved until the start of your next turn.
The necrotic damage increases to {@damage 3d6} and {@damage 4d6} when you reach 10th and 18th level in this class respectively.

optionalfeature.name: Grasping Arrow
entries: When this arrow strikes its target, conjuration magic creates grasping, poisonous brambles, which wrap around the target. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} poison damage, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it takes {@damage 2d6} slashing damage the first time on each turn it moves 1 foot or more without teleporting. The target or any creature that can reach it can use its action to remove the brambles with a successful Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your Arcane Shot save DC. Otherwise, the brambles last for 1 minute or until you use this option again.
The poison damage and slashing damage both increase to {@damage 3d6} and {@damage 4d6} when you reach 10th and 18th level in this class respectively.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing Arrow
entries: You use transmutation magic to give your arrow an ethereal quality. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, the arrow shoots forward in a line, which is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long, before disappearing. The arrow passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra {@damage 2d6} piercing damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.
The piercing damage increases to {@damage 4d6} and {@damage 6d6} when you reach 10th and 18th level in this class respectively.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Arrow
entries: Using divination magic, you grant your arrow the ability to seek out a target. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, choose one creature you have seen in the past minute. The arrow flies toward that creature, moving around corners if necessary and ignoring three-quarters cover and half cover. If the target is within the weapon's range and there is a path large enough for the arrow to travel to the target, the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. Otherwise, the arrow disappears after traveling as far as it can. On a failed save, the target takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage, and you learn the target's current location. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and you don't learn its location.
The force damage increases to {@damage 3d6} and {@damage 4d6} when you reach 10th and 18th level in this class respectively.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Arrow
entries: You weave illusion magic into your arrow, causing it to occlude your foe's vision with shadows. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage, and a 5 ft dome of magical darkness appears at the creature's space until the start of your next turn.
The psychic damage increases to {@damage 3d6} and {@damage 4d6} when you reach 10th and 18th level in this class respectively.

optionalfeature.name: Careful Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, you can protect some of those creatures from the spell's full force. To do so, you spend 1 sorcery point and choose a number of those creatures up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). A chosen creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw against the spell, and it takes no damage if it would normally take half damage on a successful save.

optionalfeature.name: Esotoric Spell
entries: When you cast a spell with the Ritual tag, you can spend 1 sorcery point to cast the spell without expending the spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can spend 1 sorcery point to double its duration, to a maximum duration of 24 hours.
If the affected spell requires concentration, you have advantage on any saving throw you make to maintain that concentration.

optionalfeature.name: Heightened Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist its effects, you can spend 2 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw made against the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Spell
entries: If you make an attack roll for a spell and miss, you can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll the {@dice d20}, and you must use the new roll.
You can use Seeking Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Transmuted Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals a type of damage from the following list, you can spend 1 sorcery point to change that damage type to one of the other listed types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, thunder.
You can use Transmuted Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Twinned Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, you can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).
If you twin a spell that requires concentration, you make concentration checks to maintain that spell at disadvantage.

To be eligible, a spell must be incapable of targeting more than one creature at the spell's current level. For example, {@spell magic missile} and {@spell scorching ray} aren't eligible, but {@spell ray of frost} and {@spell chromatic orb} are.

optionalfeature.name: Blaze Reprisal
entries: 1-2: Adds {@dice 1d8} fire damage to attacks.
3-4: Attacks cause targets to ignite, dealing {@dice 1d8} fire damage at the start of their next turn.
5: Attacks create a blaze around the target, dealing {@dice 2d8} fire damage to enemies within 10 feet.
6: Unleash a fiery explosion, dealing {@dice 4d8} fire damage to all enemies within 30 feet of you. Requires a Dexterity saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Glacial Guard
entries: 1-2: Gain +1 AC and deal {@dice 1d4} cold damage to melee attackers.
3-4: Attacks slow the target, reducing their speed by 10 feet until your next turn.
5: Freeze the ground, making it difficult terrain in a 15-foot radius around the target.
6: Encase targets in ice on hit, {@condition stunned} for 1 turn. Requires a Constitution saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Tempest Fury
entries: 1-2: Increase movement speed by 10 feet. Attacks add {@dice 1d4} lightning damage.
3-4: Attacks push enemies back 10 feet.
5: Gain advantage on all Dexterity saving throws and skill checks.
6: Create a tempest on hit, dealing {@dice 2d8} lightning damage to the target and up to two additional enemies within 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Stone Bulwark
entries: 1-2: Gain +2 to all saving throws. Resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
3-4: Attacks fortify you, granting temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Constitution modifier.
5: Attacks cause the earth to grasp enemies, reducing their speed to 0 until the end of their next turn.
6: Trigger a localized earthquake, knocking enemies within 20 feet prone. Requires a Strength saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Void Embrace
entries: 1-2: Attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage, healing you for half the amount dealt.
3-4: Diminish enemy strength, reducing their damage output by {@dice 1d4} for 1 turn.
5: Silence enemies hit, preventing them from casting spells for 1 turn. Requires a Wisdom saving throw.
6: Consume life force, dealing {@dice 3d6} necrotic damage to all enemies within 15 feet. You gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Solar Flare
entries: 1-2: Add {@dice 1d6} radiant damage to attacks. Dispel magical darkness in a 10-foot radius.
3-4: Illuminate targets, granting advantage on attacks against them and dealing {@dice 1d6} additional radiant damage.
5: Enemies hit are {@condition blinded} for 1 turn. Requires a Constitution saving throw.
6: A radiant burst expands from you, blinding all enemies within 20 feet and dealing {@dice 3d8} radiant damage. Requires a Constitution saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Aether Wind
entries: 1-2: Attacks extend your reach by 5 feet and add {@dice 1d4} force damage.
3-4: Generate an updraft with each hit, allowing you to ignore difficult terrain.
5: Gain a flying speed of 30 feet for 1 turn.
6: Create a vortex on hit, pulling up to three enemies within 30 feet towards the target. Requires a Strength saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Nature's Bind
entries: 1-2: Attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} poison damage and slow enemies by 10 feet.
3-4: Entangle enemies hit, reducing their speed to 0 until they succeed on a Strength saving throw.
5: Vines grapple the target, {@condition restraining} them for 1 turn. Requires a Strength saving throw.
6: A massive vine burst restrains all enemies within 20 feet, dealing {@dice 3d6} poison damage. Requires a Strength saving throw.

entries.caption: Alchemical Silver
rows: On application of this coating, Your weapon or one group of ammunition (30 arrows, 10 crossbow bolts, 20 sling bullets, or 5 shuriken) attacks as a silvered weapon for the next 1 minute.
The weapon or ammunition deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage against creatures that are vulnerable to silvered weapons.
The weapon deals an extra {@dice 2d6} damage against creatures that are vulnerable to silvered weapons.

entries.caption: Alchemist’s Acid
rows: As an action, you can throw this flask at a creature. Make a ranged attack (20/60) or a melee attack with your strength. On a hit, the creature takes {@dice 1d10} Acid damage and takes an additional {@dice 2d6} Acid damage at the end of their turns unless they take an action to remove the acid. The acid washes off after 1 minute.
{@dice 2d10} Acid Damage and {@dice 3d6} Acid damage per round.
{@dice 3d10} Acid Damage and {@dice 4d6} Acid damage per round.
{@dice 4d10} Acid Damage and {@dice 5d6} Acid damage per round.
{@dice 5d10} Acid Damage and {@dice 6d6} Acid damage per round.
{@dice 6d10} Acid Damage and {@dice 7d6} Acid damage per round.

entries.caption: Alchemist’s Fire
rows: As an action, you can throw this flask at a point on the ground within 60ft that you can see. All Creatures within 20ft of the point must make a Dexterity Saving Throw or take {@dice 1d6} fire damage and are set on fire. A creature can use an action to pat off the flames or take {@dice 1d4} fire damage at the end of their turns. The fire goes out in 1 minute. On a success, creatures take half damage and are not on fire.
{@dice 2d6} Fire damage and {@dice 2d4} fire damage per round.
{@dice 3d6} Fire damage and {@dice 3d4} fire damage per round.
{@dice 4d6} Fire damage and {@dice 4d4} fire damage per round.
{@dice 5d6} Fire damage and {@dice 5d4} fire damage per round.
{@dice 6d6} Fire damage and {@dice 6d4} fire damage per round.

entries.caption: Alchemist’s Frost
rows: As an action, you can throw this flask at a creature. Make a ranged attack (20/60) or a melee attack with your strength. On a hit, the creature takes {@dice 1d10} Cold damage and must make a dexterity saving throw or be restrained in ice. The Ice has 20 Hitpoints and an AC of 10. Any damage targeting the creature will also damage the ice. A creature can take an action to make a strength check to break of the restraint. The ice thaws after 1 minute.
{@dice 2d10} Cold damage and the Ice has 30 Hitpoints.
{@dice 3d10} Cold damage and the Ice has 40 Hitpoints.
{@dice 4d10} Cold damage and the Ice has 50 Hitpoints.
{@dice 5d10} Cold damage and the Ice has 60 Hitpoints.
{@dice 6d10} Cold damage and the Ice has 70 Hitpoints.

entries.caption: Antivenom
rows: Applying this on a poisoned creature will render poisons affecting it of DC 15 or lower inert.
Applying this on a poisoned creature will render poisons affecting it of DC 25 or lower inert.
Applying this on a poisoned creature will render poisons affecting it of DC 35 or lower inert.

entries.caption: Beastbane
rows: As an action, you can light this incense and throw it at a point on the ground within 60ft that you can see. Any beasts within 100ft of the area must make a constitution saving throw or use all its movement and Action(If needed) to exit the area. A moderate breeze will dispel the effect till it flows. The Incense burns away after 1 hour.

entries.caption: Blastpatch
rows:
As an action, you can apply a blast patch to a square within 5ft of you. When a creature walks into the space, it must make a Dexterity saving throw or be subjected to the effects of the blast patch. 

{@b Firepatch} - {@dice 1d8} Fire damage and the target cannot use reactions till the start of its next turn. 

{@b Cold Patch} - {@dice 1d8} Cold damage and the target's speed is 0 till the end of its next turn. 

{@b Shock patch} - {@dice 1d8} Force damage and the target is pushed 10ft back. 

A blast Patch can be detected with passive perception equal to or higher than the DC of the patch.

entries.caption: Blinding Bomb
rows: As an action, you can throw this bomb at a creature. Make a ranged attack (20/60) or a melee attack with your strength. On a hit, the creature and every creature within 5ft of it must make a constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of its turns. On a success, the creature is no longer blinded.

entries.caption: Bloodstinger Poison
rows: As part of the attack action, you can apply this poison to your melee weapon and make an attack against a creature. On a hit, the creature must make a constitution saving throw or be subject to another attack as its movements slow down. If this attack hits, it takes an additional {@dice 2d4} poison damage. If you can already make 2 or more attacks on a turn, you deal the poison damage on your second attack and do not get an extra attack from this poison.

entries.caption: Clearsense Powder
rows: When a Blinded or deafened creature inhales this powder, It is cured of those conditions and gain {@dice 1d4} temporary hitpoints.

entries.caption: Dragonfire Tar
rows: As an action, you can throw this bomb at a creature. Make a ranged attack (20/60) or a melee attack with your strength. On a hit, the creature is covered in tar that burns hot with alchemical flame. At the start of its turns, the creature takes {@dice 3d4} fire damage. As an action, it can remove the tar from its body with a successful sleight of hand check against the DC.

entries.caption: Ghoststrike Oil
rows: As part of the attack action, you can apply this poison to your melee weapon and make an attack against an undead creature. On a hit, the creature must make a constitution saving throw or be subject to another attack as its movements slow down. If this attack hits, it loses all its resistances and immunities and has vulnerability to Psychic damage for a minute. The creature can repeat the save at the end of their turns, ending the effect on a success. If you can already make 2 or more attacks on a turn, the effect applies on your second attack and do not get an extra attack from this oil.

entries.caption: Goodnight Tincture
rows: You apply this tincture to a food or drink item within 5ft of you. A creature that consumes that food or drink must succeed on a constitution saving throw after 1 minute or become {@condition unconscious} for one hour or till it is shook awake, takes damage, or is subject to a harmful effect.

entries.caption: Herbal Incense
rows: As a part of a short rest, you can burn this incense. Any creature that is within 20ft of this incense for the entire duration of the short rest regains an additional 10 hitpoints.

entries.caption: Jolt Flask
rows: As an action, you can throw this flask at a creature. Make a ranged attack (20/60) or a melee attack with your strength. On a hit, the creature and creatures within 5ft of it must make a constitution saving throw or be unable to take any actions till the end of its next turn.

entries.caption: Lockbust Chalk
rows: This chalk expands inside a lock once the end is broken off. If you use a lockbust chalk while lockpicking, you can add +2 to the check.

entries.caption: Slow-Step Oil
rows: As an action, you can apply this poison to your melee weapon and make an attack against a creature. On a hit, the creature must make a constitution saving throw or be subject to another attack as its movements slow down. If this attack hits, its movement speed is halved till the end of its next turn. If you can already make 2 or more attacks on a turn, the effect applies on your second attack and do not get an extra attack from this oil.

entries.caption: Tracking Dust
rows: The tracking dust creates an area 20ft diameter filled with shimmering dust. In areas where the dust is spread, Perception checks to track can be made with a +2 to the check.

entries.caption: Clearwater Solution
rows: On adding clearwater solution to a volume of liquid filling a cube 1 square on side (5 feet by 5 feet by 5 feet; approximately 935 gallons), the solution removes any poison or disease present in the liquid after 1 minute.

entries.caption: Salve of Slipperiness
rows: You take 1 minute to apply this slimy salve to your body. For 10 minutes after this application, you make Acrobatics or Athletics checks against grapples at advantage.

entries.caption: Smokestick
rows: As an action, you throw this to a point you can see within 60 feet. The area within 20 ft of that point is lightly obscured. The smoke lasts until the end of your next turn.

variantrule.name: Alcohol and other things that will kill you.... Or save you
entries: The multiverse of Infinitum is multifaceted to say the least. However, one thing that does not lose its meaning between the endless worlds of Infinitum is the insatiable curiosity. Naturally, this curiosity becomes the origin for many professions that build on trial and error. Any hopeless mucker can take up, with practice of course, the tools of a chef, a brewer, a poisoner, a herbalist or an alchemist. These people look for meaning in the endless unsense of components. There is always another combination, a way to better an existing combination, a way to transcend the binding functions of these components into something that carries more meaning and create things that are worth more than the sum of their parts.

entries.name: These professions in Infinitum
entries: In your travels around the multiverse, you will find individuals at various skill levels in these professions. The ones that are {@b Proficient}, the ones that are {@b Experts}, the ones that are {@b Masters} and finally, the ones that are {@b True masters}. Everyone starts their journey at the most base of this lengthy adventure in search of the true concoction.

As a player, you can start your journey in any of these four professions at the {@b Proficient} or the {@b Expert} level, provided your class or background gives you proficiency or expertise in these professions.

Alternatively, you can spend your downtime training under a {@b Master} or a {@b True Master} to gain proficiency in these tools. The table below lists the profession, time needed and the cost of training under a master.
Once you are proficient, you can train for expertise. The time needed to train for expertise in a profession is double the initial period.

As an Expert, You can add twice your proficiency bonus to checks made with the tool of your profession. Additionally, you can look for a true master to train further and become a master yourself. The time needed to train for master status in a profession is three times the initial period.

As a master, You can add four times your proficiency bonus to checks you make with the tools of your profession. Additionally, you begin your initial true master training under a true master for four times the initial period. After that, you have to spend double the initial period working out your original style for the profession of your choice. You do not spend gold for these two weeks but you must stay in downtime.

As a True Master, you have reached the pinnacle of your art. You are respected across continents as a True Master of the art. You receive an invite to the Guild of True Craftsmen and you can use your influence to always gain a 50% reduction to
prices on sales under your profession. You also add four times your proficiency bonus to checks you make with the tools of your profession and you treat any d20 roll of 14 or lower on the checks as a 15.

entries.name: Skill checks related to your profession
entries: As a skilled individual in your profession, you get certain bonuses to non-modification checks you make with your tools.

variantrule.name: The Herbalist
entries: As an herbalist, you have learned the uses of certain flora and fauna to make treatments against deadly effects. With proficiency in this tool, you can use downtime to craft any of the healing potions from the table below provided you have the time and gold.

entries.name: Herbal Remedies
entries: As an expert herbalist, you have mastered the finer aspects of the profession. You know the methods to better even the mildest of healing potions. However, you can only better the potions you make yourself since the composition of potions differ between craftsmen.

You can spend gold equal to 160% of the crafting cost to modify your potion. Make an herbalism kit check (Intelligence) with the DC equal to the DC given on the table below. On a Success, you can roll one additional healing dice when you use this healing potion. You so so it by spending 1 hour for every 50gp you spend(Rounded up). The DC for subsequent use of Herbal remedies also goes up by 1 for this dose. On a Failurethe potion is lost and unusable. You can do this to a single dose as many times as listed in the table below.

entries.name: Optimization
entries: As a Master, whenever a healing potion crafted by you is used, you can roll the hitpoints that the potion restores twice and choose one of the two totals. Additionally, you can use Herbal Remedies on a single dose as many times as twice your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Herbalist Ascendancy
entries: A true master of the craft can make even the most effective healing remedies. If you have the gold, you can make any healing potion at the end of a long rest. This healing potion will be created with the maximum herbal remedies applications. Once you create a healing potion this way, you cannot do so again for 1 week. Additionally, when you roll for healing on a healing potion created by you, you always roll the maximum value.

variantrule.name: The Poisoner
entries: As a poisoner, you have learned the uses of certain flora and fauna to make deadly poisons. With proficiency in this tool, you can use downtime to craft any of the poisons from the poisoner's table below provided you have access to the materials, time, and gold needed for the ones that do.
You will need to spend 1 hour for every 50gp you spend making the poison.

entries.name: Using a poison
entries: Every Vial of contact and injury poison can hold upto 3 doses of a certain poison. Each time you harvest poison from a deador incapacitated creature, you need to succeed on a Poisoner's kit (Intelligence) check of DC 20. On a success, you get one dose of the poison.

As an action, you can coat a melee weapon with the poison or dip upto 3 pieces of ammunition. The Poison loses potency after 3 successful melee attacks. Ammmunition that misses can be collected and used again. In any case, an application will have potency for 1 minute from the application time.

entries.name: Malicious Addition
entries: As an expert poisoner, you have mastered the finer aspects of the profession. You know the methods to better even the mildest of poisons. You can only better the poisons you make yourself since the composition of poisons not made by you is hard to figure out. However, if the poison is a venom, you can attempt to increase its potency anyway.

You can spend gold equal to 160% of the crafting cost to modify your poison. Make a poisoners kit check (Intelligence) with the DC equal to the Saving throw DC of the poison. On a Success, the DC of the poison goes up by 1 and you add one more damage die to it by spending 1 hour for every 50gp you spend(Rounded up).On a Failure, the poison is lost and unusable. You can do this to a single dose as many times as your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Optimization
entries: As a Master, the Saving throw DC for any poison you make/harvest cannot be less than 15. Additionally, you can use Malicious Addition on a single vial as many times as twice your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Poisoner Ascendancy
entries: A true master of the craft can make even the most potent of poisons. As part of the Guild of True Craftsmen, you have access to every poison component that costs less than 1000gp and you can buy them instantly through the bag of holding you receive as a True Master.
Additionally, the Saving throw DC of any poison you make/harvest cannot be less than 19.

variantrule.name: The Alchemist
entries: As an alchemist, you have learned the way of transmuter. You can make reagents and chemicals with devastating effects or restorative properties depending on your mood. With proficiency in this tool, you gain a permanent 20% cost reduction on all costs incurred in the {@variantrule The Herbalist|AspysGuidetoInfinitum|Herbalist} and {@variantrule The Poisoner|AspysGuidetoInfinitum|Poisoner} professions including the learning costs.
Magic is unnecessary to create alchemical items, but arcane ingredients are required. These items are rare and expensive, so alchemists commonly have adventuring backgrounds.

To make Alchemical Reagents/items, you need to acquire the formula for the reagent. Check the {@table Alchemical formulae|AspysGuidetoInfinitum|Alchemical formulae} table for all alchemist formulae available for purchase and the ability needed to make each item

When you get proficency in this tool, you learn two {@table Alchemical formulae|AspysGuidetoInfinitumGuidetoInfinitum|Alchemical formulae} of your choice from the table. Everytime you gain a level after proficiency, you learn one additional formulae.

entries.name: Making an alchemical reagent
entries: You can use Alchemist's supplies to create the reagents/items you own the formulae to.

When you make an alchemical item, make a check with your Alchemists Supplies with the listed ability. On a success, the item is created successfully. On a failure, the item and the materials are lost. On a Critical success, the item deals double the dice as damage if it has a damage value. You can still roll the skill check as a true master and a failure can be treated as a success. Each Alchemical creation can have upto 6 levels of refinement. Your skill at this profession dictates the maximum level of the item you can create.

entries.name: Expert Transmuter
entries: As an expert in alchemist's supplies, you gain a +10% permanent cost reduction to costs incurred in the Herbalist and Poisoner professions.

Additionally, you can alter permanently properties of objects to gather energy. You perform a special alchemical procedure on one object composed entirely of Stone (but not a gemstone), Wood, iron, copper, silver, or gold. Transforming it into a material of a lower tier. The energy released from this conversion can be transfered into a spellcaster as a level 1 spell slot. You cannot add more spell slots to a spell caster than they can hold. Refer to the table below for the amount of
material needed and the conversion results.
Every conversion takes 15 minutes of work which can also be part of a short rest. You can do as many conversions as your proficiency bonus and you get all uses back after a long rest.

entries.name: Optimization
entries: As a Master, You gain a further +10% cost reduction on on all costs incurred in the Herbalist and Poisoner professions. Additionally, you can transmute materials to gain spell slots twice as many times as your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Alchemist Ascendancy
entries: A true master of alchemy can draw the residual energies that are lost in the form of heat and light from their material conversions. The spell slots gained from conversations can be level 3 or lower.

Additionally, Every dawn, you can draw upto 2000gp worth of raw materials at half price from your bag of holding of true craftsmen. These materials are enchanted to be only used for transmutation and you must send the residual materials back after drawing their energies before you take a long rest. The bag of holding will refund the amount for the materials you return.

entries.name: The Invention of Gunpowder
entries:
By 1390AC, The term 'Blackpowder' had already seen its conception. A fine powder made of burnt wood and brimstone that
burned rather explosively. Naturally, it was mass produced and packed in small kegs for extremely satisfactory results in
warfare. But it was not until a couple decades ago that people discovered another use for this powder. If packed tightly into
a metal cylinder, it could propel projectiles to great distances. The new king of Larcous, Oko armed his troops with miniature
versions of these 'Cannons' that could be hand-held. The Siege of Gin put this technology in the hands of the talented
engineers of Eardon and soon, Variations of Oko's design found its way into some in the Royal Army. Though it cannot be
said for sure how many, a considerable number of guilds chase after this technology and some even produce these outside
the bounds of Damutis and Sasitor.

entries.name: Proficiency in Firearms
entries: Learning how to use these handheld cannons require rigorous training in posture and aim. The shots from a firearm fire faster and further than an average crossbow bolt. Mastering the different postures to manage the recoil from shooting a firearm is a part of the training one undergoes to master the firearm.
You can gain proficiency in firearms through one of the following ways:

items: By taking the {@feat Gunner|tce} feat instead of an Ability Score Improvement if you meet the requirements.
By having atleast one level in either the Fighter or the Artificer class.
By any racial or background feature as determined by the DM

entries: As an {@class Artificer|drk}, you have learned how these devices work and with some research and effort, you can easily avoid therecoil from a firearm with a posture suited to your form.
As a {@class Fighter|drk}, you have spent years in training to master holding your posture after firing.

entries.name: Acquiring or Crafting a firearm
entries: Keeping the principal idea of the firearm, the central metallic cylinder that packs the blackpowder and shot intact, you can craft these devices with multiple variations. The table below lists the available designs for purchase and the time required for an artificer to craft them.

entries.name: Crafting a firearm
entries: You can craft/upgrade any of the firearms if you meet the following requirements.

items: Proficiency in Firearms and Tinker's tools.
Own a set of smiths tools, a set of woodcarver's tools and a set of tinkers tools.
Have the raw materials needed to make the firearm. You need to spend half the cost of the firearm to start crafting it.

entries: The firearm is crafted over a course of days or hours. Taking 10 hours of work per 50gp spent upgrading. The minimum amount of time spent crafting cannot be less than 2 hours per long rest.

entries.name: Upgrading a firearm
entries: A firearm can be upgraded to have abilities listed below by the one that crafted it. If you attempt to upgrade a firearm that was not crafted by you, then you will have to spend an additional 40 hours of downtime with the firearm and succeed on an Intelligence (tinker's tools) check to understand the workings of the firearm. On a faliure, you can reattempt the check after a long rest. The DC for which will be equal to:

{@b Familiarization DC} = 12 + Number of upgrades it can hold + 1 for each minor upgrade on it + 2 for every Major upgrade on
it - Number of failed attempts
Each firearm can hold a number of minor and major upgrades as listed in the firearm table.

items: A minor upgrade takes 150gp and 2 days/18h of strenuous activity to craft.
A Major upgrade takes 350gp and 4 days/36h of strenuous activity to craft.

entries: If you replace an upgrade on a firearm, you will have to first disassemble the upgrade by spending 1/4th its gold cost and 1/8th time. The cost and time marks dismantling and reforging the parts of the firearm to its initial state.
Wherever a feature is limited by an Intelligence modifier, consider the Intelligence modifier of the creature that crafted it.
{@b Firearm Upgrades save DC} = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

entries.name: Misfiring
entries: A firearm is a powerful weapon of war. The impact of its shots stagger both the shooter and the one struck by it. The use of a firearm requires outmost precision and concentration given the speed at which its system functions and mishandling a firearm often causes damage to the firearm and the shooter.

When using a firearm, if you roll below the misfire chance of the firearm before any modifiers on an attack, the firearm misfires and will remain unusable until it is repaired. To repair a misfired firearm, you can use a bonus action to make a
Dexterity or Intelligence (Tinker's tools) check. The DC for which will be Equal to 10 + Misfire score of the firearm. On a failure, the firearm is broken and you will have to spend 2 hours and half the firearm's cost to fix it.
The misfire chance of a firearm is listed on the firearms table. Upgrading a firearm increases this misfire chance. +1 for every minor upgrade and +2 for every major upgrade.

table.name: Weapon Masteries
table.caption: Weapon Masteries
rows: If you hit a creature with a melee attack using this weapon, you can make an attack roll with the weapon against a second creature within 5 feet of the first that is also within your reach. On a hit, the second creature takes the weapon’s damage, but don’t add your ability modifier to that damage unless that modifier is negative. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.

If your attack roll with this weapon misses a creature, you can deal damage to that creature equal to the ability modifier you used to make the attack roll. This damage is the same type dealt by the weapon, and the damage can’t be increased in any way, other than increasing the ability modifier.
If you hit a creature with a melee attack from this weapon and deal damage to the creature, You can move up to 10 feet through the creature's space without spending movement speed.
If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can push the creature up to 10 feet straight away from yourself if it is Large or smaller.
Versatile Property or No Weapon Property
If you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature has Disadvantage on its next attack roll before the start of your next turn.

If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If you hit the creature more than once with this property, the Speed reduction doesn’t exceed 10 feet.

If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + the ability modifier used to make the attack roll. On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition prone} condition.
If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to the creature, you have Advantage on your next attack roll against that creature before the end of your next turn.

table.name: Minor Upgrades
rows: As an action, you alter the firing mechanism of your gun to release a burst of ash and smoke. This cloud forms a 10-foot cube centered on a point of your choice within the firearm's range, spreading around corners, and the area covered by this cube is considered heavily obscured. This smoke lasts for 10 minutes and cannot be dispersed. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

You equip your firearm with a targeting mechanism. If you haven't moved this turn, you
can aim down your sights as a bonus action, reducing your speed to 0 and granting you advantage on all attacks you make using your firearm until the end of your turn.

You alter your ammunition to have explosive capabilities. When you hit a target with a successful attack from your firearm, all creatures within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} piercing damage.

You equip your gun with an arcane net meant to trap opponents. As an action, choose a creature within range of your firearm. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained}. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat this saving throw, ending the effect on a success. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

You modify the barrel of your firearm and the model of your ammunition to suppress the sound of a
firearm shot by reducing its exit velocity. This will reduce the distance a firearm can be heard from 400ft to 60ft.
Blade and Black Powder (Except hand mortar)

You create a matching blade to accompany your firearm, rendering you a deadly opponent in both melee and ranged combat. Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.
Additionally, when you use your action to shoot using your firearm, you can use your bonus action to strike at a creature within melee range. Make a melee attack roll. The attack roll uses your Dexterity modifier, and you are proficient with the attack. On a hit, the attack deals slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Dexterity modifier.

table.name: Major Upgrades
rows: As a bonus action, you can charge your weapons with blazing force. Until the start of your next turn, whenever you make a successful attack, you deal extra fire damage equal to your 2+proficiency bonus. You can charge your weapons this way a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and regain all uses after a short or long rest.

You equip your firearm with a volatile piece of Uldgar, allowing you to release a piercing bolt of electricity as an action on your turn. The lightning fires from you in a straight line that is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 3d8} lightning damage on a failure and half as much on a success. You can use this feature as many times as your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and regain all uses after a short or long rest.

When you hit a creature with a successful ranged weapon attack with a firearm, you can immediately cause the bullet to hit another creature within 15 feet of the original target. The second target takes piercing damage equal to your Dexterity modifier (minimum of one). You can redirect a bullet in this way a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, and regain all expended uses after a short or long rest.

As an action, you can fire a barrage of bullets. Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from yourself must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking piercing damage equal to 3d10 + your Dexterity modifier on a failure and half as much on a success. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

You equip your firearm with a secondary barrel that can fire incendiary grenades. When you take the attack action, you can replace one of your usual attacks with a grenade shot. The range for
which is half the range of the firearm, and deals 3d10 fire damage on a failed dexterity save or half as much on a successful one in a 20ft radius spherical area. Once you use the grenade shot, you must spend 1 minute reloading the launcher before using it again.

action.name: Hasted Action
entries: Certain features grant you an additional action that you may use on your turn known as a Hasted Action. This action can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack each only), {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action.

hp.special: equal to five times your artificer level

actionEntries.name: Shock Mortar
entries: Choose a point within 30 feet. Creatures 10 feet around that point must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} Thunder damage.

object.name: Eldritch Cannon, Beacon Lenser

hp.special: equal to five times your artificer level

entries: {@note Created by the {@subclassFeature Eldritch Cannon|Artificer|DRK|Cannoneer|tct|3} subclass feature.}

actionEntries.name: Shock Mortar
entries: The cannon projects a beacon 20 feet long, creatures in its path must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 2d8} radiant damage on a failure or half as much on a success.

race.name: Warforged

entries.name: Age
entries: A typical warforged is between two and thirty years old. The maximum warforged lifespan remains a mystery; so far, warforged have shown no signs of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Most warforged take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law and neutrality. But some have absorbed the morality, or lack thereof, of the beings with which they served.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Constructed Resilience
entries: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you {@condition unconscious}, and you can see and hear as normal.

entries.name: Integrated Protection
entries: Your body has built-in defensive layers, which can be enhanced with armour:

items: You can don only armour with which you have proficiency. To don armour other than a shield, you must incorporate it into your body over the course of 1 hour, during which you remain in contact with the armour. To doff armour, you must spend 1 hour removing it. You can rest while donning or doffing armour in this way.
While you live, the armour incorporated into your body can't be removed against your will.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.
In addition to these features, a warforged can support an additional feature in the form of an upgrade.

entries.name: Adaptive Plating
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Battle Platform (Juggernaut only)
entries: You have a platform built into your chassis. While large, a small creature can ride on the platform without squeezing. To make a melee attack against a target within 5 feet of you, they must use spears, a similar polearm or weapons with reach.

entries.name: Nightvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Steadfast
entries: You have advantage on checks and saving throws made against being moved or knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Specialized Design
entries: You gain one skill proficiency and one tool proficiency of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: A typical Vermkin reaches adulthood at age 16 and lives up to 100 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Small.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You speak common and one other language.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness as shades of gray.

entries.name: Scurry
entries: You can walk on two feet or four without impediment and can move through any creature's space without penalty to your movement.

entries.name: Age
entries: A Leberi grows to be a teen at around the same age as humans though they age slower afterwards, living to be around 130 years old though some live upto 150 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: A Leberi’s concerns tend to start and end with themselves and those of close relation when in Leberi Society, Staying neutral most of the time. When taken out of their element though, they may align extremely in any direction.

entries.name: Size
entries: Leberi Tend to be a little taller than humans on average and weigh a little less. Your size is Medium

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Pungent Blood
entries: Your blood has the strange property of being thicker. You are resistant to Poison Damage and Immune to Diseases.

entries.name: Natural Escaladers
entries: Your long, warped and rubbery fingers allow for a firmer grip granting you a climbing speed of 20 feet

entries.name: Sensory Sacrifice
entries: Depending on the circumstance of your birth you may have lost one or more senses to gain a boon granted as an eldritch invocation. This invocation must not have any prerequisites. You may lose Smell and Taste, Sight or Hearing.

entries.name: Language
entries: You speak Liberian and 1 language of your choice.

entries.name: Leberi (Gelas'Bat)
entries: Leberi Mainlanders found deep within the jungles of Liberia. Despite looking humanoid, they display many features found in reptiles, fish or even frogs.
