entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Leberi grow into their teens the same time humans do and possess some facet of their Leberi Longevity living to be around 110 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Fiercely argumentative, the Leberi tend to sit anywhere in terms of alignment except on the fence.

entries.name: Size
entries: Half Leberi are aren't too dissimilar from humans in body proportion, though they tend to be more lean. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sour Blood
entries: You have advantage against saving throws involving poison damage and Disease.

entries.name: Seabound
entries: Swimming comes naturally to you. You gain a swim speed of 30 feet and while swimming, you may {@action dash} with a bonus action.

entries.name: Skilled Artisan
entries: You become proficient in any one skill and either one set of tools or one weapon.

entries.name: Otherworldly Trace
entries: You can attune to 1 additional item as long as one of the items you’re attuned to is a tattoo.

entries.name: Language
entries: Common, Leberi and one other language.

entries.name: Half-Leberi
entries: The discovery of the Half-Leberi coincides with the discovery of the Liberian Isles in the Year 1139 of the 11th Era, when the Biltian explorer Pensacura Menastorn made landfall on the isle of Cetu. They were found to be in tribes located on many of Liberian Isles as well as the coast on the mainland. They were noted to be a convival, lively and free spirited folk with the elders being generally a lax but jovial people while the young are ebullient and adventurous. This picture of leberi life was sadly a brief one, with colonization efforts by the three empires reducing the people to mainly a life of servitude.

Half-Leberi became the term of use after the Leberi were discovered on the mainland of Liberia. Half-Leberi were theorized to be either the result of ancient human interaction with the mainland or an adaptation to life away from it on the isles. They are Human-like in appearance with the exception of saggy skin, round beady eyes, better height and scale like patches on parts of their body.

entries.name: Super Specialization
entries: You gain one tool proficiency of your choice and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses those tools.

entries.name: Artifex
entries: Despite a warforged's prowess in combat, its role in combat is that of support. The frontlines were still largely manned by non-automatons. And when they begin to deplete they are replaced by the bakers, doctors and factory workers. It is in those dire times that the resistance to a warforged in the factory place was the least. Especially after the war, when some of the combat varieties could be more better put to use rebuilding the economy.

images.title: A Warforged Artifex sealing a Pyteli Box

entries.name: Propelled Gait
entries: Your walking speed improves by 5 feet.

entries.name: Skirmisher
entries: A benefit to warforged design was its precision and reduced mass without the sacrifice to general capability. As such This design was made to handle more precise equipment like rifles and artillery with subroutines for close-quarters combat as well.

images.title: A Warforged Skirmisher charging into combat, Unkown theatre and time.

entries.name: Spell Databank
entries: You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=Wizard}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it. In addition, Whenever you reach a level in a class which grants you the spellcasting feature, you may choose to know one additional spell from the spell list offered. After you choose this spell, you may not use this feature to learn another.

entries.name: Incatator
entries: Although much rarer due to the high production cost and rarity of resources to build it, A variety was produced to provide magical support for minor engagements. Equipped with a special mechanism that imparts its creators intelligence, it is able to manipulate the weave using it.

images.title: A Warforged Incatator simultaneously watching and incribing results of an experiment.

entries.name: Transformation Subroutine
entries: As an action, you may change your size from medium to large or vice versa. Additionally, you have advantage against any spells or effects that would alter your form against your will.

entries.name: Combat Patterns
entries: You are proficient in one martial melee weapon of your choice.

entries.name: Juggernaut
entries: The first role granted to warforged remained its most common role; as shock troops. This amounts to its simple design, cheaper parts and sheer tenacity. It became an integral part of many armies with many tactical maneuvres reliant on their functioning.

images.title: A Warforged Juggernaut rearming at The Battle of Eilonwie. 11E Year 877.

entries.name: Bright-eyed and Bushy-tailed
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Persuasion} skill and can roll the check with advantage once per short or long rest.

entries.name: Keen Linguist
entries: You know common and two other languages of your choice. After hearing and seeing a minute of conversation in an unknown language, a softfur gains a small grasp of the spoken language can infer basic meanings.

entries.name: Button-Eyed
entries: When a creature attacks you, you can use a reaction to force the creature to make a Wisdom save (DC = 8 + Proficiency Bonus + Charisma Modifier). If the being is sentient, it may redirect the attack or make it against you with disadvanatage. You regain use of this feature after a short rest.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Softfurs are gregarious by nature, maybe even more so with those outside their communities. They tend to be good or neutral as a result.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries: You have advantage on attack rolls against another creature if at least one of your allies isn't {@condition incapacitated} and is within 5 feet of it.

entries.name: Vengeful Prick
entries: As a reaction to melee attack against you within 5 feet, you may impale the attacker on the needles on your back. The attacker takes damage equal to your Constitution modifier + half your level (rounded down).

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Pricklebacks live a belligerent life, equal parts working with or against each other depending on the tribe. Tending to chaotic as a result.

entries.name: Iron Gut
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison and disease, and you have resistance against poison damage. You can also eat rotten food without any ill effects.

entries.name: Nose for Trouble
entries: You have advantage on {@skill perception} checks made to hear or smell.

entries.name: Sneaky Scurry
entries: You gain proficiency in {@skill Stealth} checks. You can walk on two feet or four without impediment and can move through non-magical difficult terrain or any creature's space without penalty to your movement.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: A Longsnout's loyalty typically lies with himself and his immediate pack. Most are neutral, though a streak of them fall on the chaotic side.

entries.name: River Born
entries: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and you have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Masters of the Axe
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item greataxe|tct|Greataxes} and {@item Battleaxes|tct|Battleaxes} and the 'heavy' property of a greataxe doesn't give you disadvantage on attack rolls. In addition, you gain the benefit of the {@feat Slasher|tce} feat.

entries.name: Housecarving
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item woodcarver's tools|phb} or {@item carpenter's tools|phb}.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Dykentail society is structured and hierarchical, usually revolving around the river they were born near. They usually want what's best for their Damhaven, leaning them towards lawful and good.

entries.name: Swift Climbers
entries: You have a walking speed of 35 feet and a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Free Gliders
entries: While you aren't {@condition incapacitated}, you do not take damage from falling and can move upto 2 feet for every 1 foot that you descend.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Dreyfolk's chaotic nature lead them to live very independent lives, though few would wish harm upon others.

images.title: An illustration of a Dreyfolk bandit

itemGroup.name: Gloves of the Elements
entries: Also known as 'Elemental Gloves', they were used primarily in the education of Evocation magic. More advanced gloves were created for specialization or for those with a penchant for that kind of magic.
